recipe_ingredients: ['1 (750 ml.) bottle Rose Wine', '1 liter Pomegranate Italian Soda, chilled', '1/4 c. Fresh Mint', '1 c. Rum', '1/4 c. Lime Juice', '1 lb. Strawberries, hulled', '2 Navel Oranges', '1 c. Blueberries', '2 Limes', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['Wash blueberries and strawberries, then slice strawberries into quarters. Slice 1 orange and 1 lime in half lengthwise, then cut into thin slices. Slice second orange and lime into quarters.', 'In a large pitcher, muddle mint, quartered orange and lime, and 1/4 cup of strawberries with a wooden spoon or muddler for 20 seconds. Add rum, and muddle for an additional 30 seconds. Remove lime and orange skins. Add lime juice, wine, and remaining fruit and stir, then top with pomegranate soda. Stir again, add ice before serving.']

recipe_description: Back in the days of the ancient Greeks and Romans, wine wasn’t nearly as delicious as it is today; as a result, it was usually mixed with water, juices, spices, and even fruits to make it drinkable. In 15th century Spain, red wine or “sangria” (which comes from the Spanish word for “blood”) mixed with spices, fruits, and water began to gain popularity – after a couple thousand years and a whole lot of partying, sangria has evolved into the boozy, fruity beverage we all love today! This fairly traditional version is heavy on the citrus along with apples, brandy, and cinnamon and makes a great party punch.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 (1.5 lt.) magnum Red Wine', '1/2 c. Brandy', '1 c. Orange Juice', '1 Orange', '1 Lime', '1 Honeycrisp Apple', '1 c. Grapes', '1 Cinnamon Stick', 'Sparkling Water, chilled', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['Prep fruit. Slice orange in half lengthwise, then cut into thin slices; repeat with lime. Core apple, then halve lengthwise and cut into thin slices. Halve grapes lengthwise; refrigerate fruit until needed.', 'In a punch bowl or large pitcher, combine wine, brandy, orange juice, and the cinnamon stick. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours. Stir in ice and fruit before serving.', 'Optional: Leave space at the top of each glass and top with sparkling water for fizzy sangria.']

recipe_description: The Brandy Old Fashioned is the unofficial state drink of Wisconsin, and with good reason – it’s delicious! We’ve gone with a sweet version of this classic, Midwestern cocktail, and while it may not technically be a true Old Fashioned, we say ignore the haters and get your brandy on.
recipe_ingredients: ['2 Maraschino Cherries', '1 Sugar Cube', '3 dashes Angostura Bitters', '1 Large Ice Cube', '2 slices Fresh Orange', 'Sparkling Water']
recipe_instructions: ['Place sugar cube in an old fashioned glass and lash with bitters, then add 1 slice of orange and 1 cherry and muddle until sugar has dissolved.', 'Add brandy and stir, then add ice. Top with sparkling water and garnish with remaining orange slice and cherry.']

recipe_name: Asian Pear & Apple Sangria with Ginger & Lemon
recipe_description: Back in the days of the ancient Greeks and Romans, wine wasn’t nearly as delicious as it is today; as a result, it was usually mixed with water, juices, spices, and even fruits to make it drinkable. In 15th century Spain, red wine or “sangria” (which comes from the Spanish word for “blood”) mixed with spices, fruits, and water began to gain popularity – after a couple thousand years and a whole lot of partying, sangria has evolved into the boozy, fruity beverage we all love today! Asian pears and apples come together in this nod to traditional sangria, albeit with a slightly modern twist. It’s perfect for fall, what with the spicy ginger and warm cinnamon flavors; serve it cold, or forego the ice and heat it up for a delicious mulled wine.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 (750 ml.) bottle Red Wine', '1/3 c. Brandy', '2 Asian Pears', '2 Gala Apples', '1 Lemon', '1 thumb-sized piece Fresh Ginger', '2 Cinnamon Sticks', '1/2 c. Cane Sugar', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['Peel and very finely grate ginger knob, then set aside. Wash pears and apples, then remove cores; cut into bit-sized cubes. Slice lemon into small wedges.', 'Add apples, pears, and sugar to a large pitcher and muddle gently with a wooden spoon or muddler for 30 seconds. Add lemon, ginger, and brandy, then muddle additional 30 seconds. Add cinnamon sticks, then top with red wine and stir to incorporate. Add ice before serving.']

recipe_description: Back in the days of the ancient Greeks and Romans, wine wasn’t nearly as delicious as it is today; as a result, it was usually mixed with water, juices, spices, and even fruits to make it drinkable. In 15th century Spain, red wine or “sangria” (which comes from the Spanish word for “blood”) mixed with spices, fruits, and water began to gain popularity – after a couple thousand years and a whole lot of partying, sangria has evolved into the boozy, fruity beverage we all love today! Nowadays, you can combine almost any wine, booze, and fruit and call it sangria; this white wine version takes a dip down to the tropics with pineapple and passionfruit juice, as well as fresh mangos and oranges for the perfect end-of-summer cocktail.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 (750 ml.) bottle Sweet White Wine', '1 c. Coconut Rum', '1 c. Pineapple Juice', '1/2 c. Passionfruit Juice', '2 Mangos', '2 Navel Oranges', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['Wash and dry mangos before slicing the flesh from the pit, the remove the outer skin from the wedges; cut into bite-sized chunks. Wash oranges, then slice in half lengthwise. Cut into thin slices.', 'In a large pitcher, combine white wine, coconut rum, pineapple juice, and passionfruit juice. Stir to combine, then add ice and stir again. Add mango chunks and orange slices before serving.']

recipe_description: It’s late summer, which means we’re heading into prime fig season – to celebrate, we’ve got organic, California Black Mission Figs on sale for just $3.99 a pound all week! Fig bars are a great way to snack healthy, but these homemade fig bars take healthy snacking to the next level. Low in sugar and high in fiber and protein, you’ll have kids and grownups alike clamoring for more.
recipe_overview: ['Serves: 1 Pan of Bars', 'Prep Time: 20 minutes', 'Cook Time: 18-22 minutes']
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 c. Gluten-Free Rolled Oats', '1 heaping c. Walnuts', '1 tsp. Ground Cinnamon', '1/4 c. + 1 tsp. Maple Syrup', '1/4 tsp. Salt', '6 Organic Black Mission Figs, washed & stems removed', '1 tbsp. Maple Syrup', '2 tbsp. White or Black Chia Seeds']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Add oats, walnuts, salt, and cinnamon to the bowl of a food processor. Process for about 1 minute or until mixture is the consistency of sand, then transfer to a mixing bowl. Add maple syrup and combine. In the same food processor, add figs, 1 tablespoon of maple syrup, and chia seeds. Process for about 40 seconds, pausing halfway through to scrape down the sides. Let filling sit to allow chia seeds to bloom, about 12 minutes.', 'Dust work surface and rolling pin with gluten-free flour, then lightly dust dough. Turn out dough onto work surface and roll into a large rectangle, about 1/4 inch thick. Top half of dough with fig filling, then fold dough in half to cover filling. Seal edges with fork and transfer to prepared baking sheet.', 'Bake for 18-22 minutes of until edges are golden. Allow to cool completely before slicing into bars.']

recipe_description: This week, we’re celebrating the end of summer with 10% off our entire line of Stemple Creek Ranch local, organic, grass-fed beef! Thinly-sliced rib eye gets the ultimate Korean beauty treatment in a heavenly marinade of Asian pear, soy sauce, sesame, rice wine, and lots of fresh aromatics. Serve it on top of rice for an easy weeknight dinner, or use it as a base for stir fries, meal bowls, even soups!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 lb. Stemple Creek Organic Boneless Rib Eye Steak, frozen', '1/4 c. Soy Sauce', '1 tbsp. Mirin Rice Wine', '2 tbsp. Brown Sugar', '2 tbsp. Asian Pear, grated (can substitute 1 tbsp. mashed Kiwi, if necessary)', '1 tbsp. Sesame Oil', '1 thumb-sized piece Fresh Ginger, grated', '3 cloves Garlic, grated', '3 Scallions, chopped', '1/2 tsp. Black Pepper', '1 tbsp. Toasted Sesame Seeds']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine soy sauce, mirin, brown sugar, Asian pear, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, scallion, and pepper in a medium bowl. Using a very sharp knife, slice frozen rib eye against the grain into very thin strips, no thicker than 1/8 of an inch. Add beef strips to marinade, tossing to combine. Cover tightly and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.', 'Before cooking, allow meat to come to room temperature, at least 30 minutes. Heat a cast iron skillet until hot but not smoking; working in batches and using tongs to allow excess marinade to drip off, add meat to pan in a single layer. Allow meat to cook until the edges are caramelized and the meat is just cooked through, then toss with 1 teaspoon of sesame seeds and remove from pan. Repeat until all meat is cooked. Serve with rice.']

recipe_description: This week, we’re celebrating the end of summer with 10% off our entire line of Stemple Creek Ranch local, organic, grass-fed beef! Tender, flavorful flank steak is the star of these nachos; make a single serving to go with a beer and the game, or make a huge tray and feed a crowd, the choice is up to you!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 lb. Stemple Creek Organic Flank Steak', '1 tbsp. Chili Powder', '1 tbsp. Cumin', '1 tsp. Hot Paprika', '1 tsp. Oregano', '1 tsp. Salt', '1 Lime, juiced', '1 (16 oz.) can Pinto Beans, rinsed & drained', '4 c. Corn Tortilla Chips', '2 c. Monterey Jack Cheese, shredded', '1 (16 oz.) tub Pico de Gallo Salsa', '1 Avocado, sliced', '1/3 c. Sour Cream']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 450 degrees and prep baking sheet by covering with a sheet of aluminum foil. Combine chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, and salt in a small bowl, then thoroughly rub mixture into flank steak. Heat a cast iron skillet or grill pan with 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil until hot but not smoking, then sear flank steak on both sides flipping once. Remove from heat and top with fresh lime juice, then leave to rest, about 10 minutes. Dice or shred steak into bite-sized pieces.', 'Spread tortilla chips in a rough layer on the sheet pan, then top with beans, steak, and cheese. Bake until cheese is bubbling and beans/steak are heated through, about 10 minutes. Remove from oven and transfer to serving plate, if desired. Top with pico de gallo salsa, sour cream, and sliced avocado. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: It’s late summer, which means we’re heading into prime fig season – to celebrate, we’ve got organic, California Black Mission Figs on sale for just $3.99 a pound all week! Everyone knows that figs and blue cheese are a marriage made in heaven, but we’ve upped the ante with crispy prosciutto and a tangy Balsamic reduction. Great for a party or when you want a treat that’s simply decadent.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 c. Balsamic Vinegar', '12 fresh Organic Black Mission Figs, washed & dried', '1/2 c. Gorgonzola Cheese, crumbled', '6 slices Prosciutto, halved widthwise', '1 tbsp. Fresh Rosemary, chopped', 'Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Prepare a baking pan by covering with a large piece of parchment paper.', 'To make glaze, heat balsamic vinegar in a small saucepan on medium low until simmering. Reduce to 1/4 of a cup of liquid, then remove from heat.', 'Cut an "X" in the top of each fig, cutting deeply enough to allow for filling but without cutting completely through the bottom. Stuff with about 1 teaspoon of Gorgonzola, then wrap with 1 piece of prosciutto and place on baking tray. Sprinkle stuffed figs with rosemary and black pepper, then bake for 12 minutes or until prosciutto is crisp.', 'Top with balsamic glaze before serving.']

recipe_name: Fig & Goat Cheese Salad With Warm Bacon Vinaigrette
recipe_description: It’s late summer, which means we’re heading into prime fig season – to celebrate, we’ve got organic, California Black Mission Figs on sale for just $3.99 a pound all week! Figs and bacon are a classic combination, and we’re letting the flavors speak for themselves in this simple yet elegant salad. Lightly wilted greens, creamy goat cheese, sweet figs, and salty bacon – YUM!
recipe_ingredients: ['4 c. Mixed Greens, washed & dried', '8 fresh Organic Black Mission Figs, quartered', '1/4 c. Chevre or other fresh goat cheese', '1 c. Pecans', '6 pieces Bacon', '1 Shallot, minced', '1 clove Garlic, minced', '1 tbsp. Dijon Mustard', '1 tsp. Honey', '1/4 c. Olive Oil', '1/4 c. Red Wine Vinegar', 'Salt & Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Cook bacon until crisp, then remove from pan. Drain grease, reserving about 1 tablespoon of grease in the pan. Add the shallot and garlic, and cook on low heat until garlic is fragrant and shallots are translucent. Crumble bacon and return to pan to warm through; transfer entire contents of pan to a medium bowl. Add red wine vinegar, honey, and dijon mustard and combine. Slowly stream in olive oil while whisking constantly, then season generously with salt and pepper.', 'Place mixed greens into a large salad bowl and top with figs, pecans, and dollops of Chevre. Dress with warm bacon vinaigrette immediately before serving.']

recipe_description: Labor Day is fast approaching, and we plan on spending it grilling, grubbing, and generally having a great time! These caprese pinwheels are simple to make and delicious to eat, a definite crowd pleaser for any barbecue or picnic!
recipe_ingredients: ['3 (10 in.) Flour Tortillas', '1 (8 oz.) package Cream Cheese, at room temperature', "1/4 c. Oliver's Own Pesto", '2 c. Cherry Tomatoes, sliced into rounds', '2 c. Spinach, washed & dried', 'Balsamic Vinegar', 'Salt & Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['In a large bowl, beat together cream cheese and pesto until completely mixed.', 'Lay out tortillas and spread each evenly with one third of cream cheese mixture. Top with tomato slices and a thin layer of spinach, then season lightly with salt and pepper. Drizzle lightly with balsamic vinegar.', 'Roll tightly, then wrap in plastic film. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until cream cheese is firm, then slice into 1 inch thick discs. Serve with additional pesto, if desired.']

recipe_description: Labor Day is fast approaching, and we plan on spending it grilling, grubbing, and generally having a great time! These Southwestern-style stuffed peppers get an extra hit of smokey flavor from the grill and make a great addition to any potluck.
recipe_ingredients: ['4 large Green Bell Peppers, tops & seeds removed', '1 lb. Ground Beef', '1 (16 oz.) can Black Beans, rinsed & drained', '1 (16 oz.) can Diced Tomatoes, in juice', '1 Jalapeno Pepper, chopped', '1 c. Spanish Rice, precooked', '1 1/2 c. Cheddar Cheese, shredded', '1 c. Corn Kernels', '1 Onion, finely chopped', '3 cloves Garlic, minced', '1 tsp. Cumin', '1 tsp. Chili Powder', '1 tsp. Garlic Powder', 'Salt & Pepper', '1 tbsp. Vegetable Oil']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat grill on medium. In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil until hot but not smoking; add beef to pan, and season with cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Cook until completely browned then transfer to a plate lined with a paper towel to drain.', 'Add onion and jalapeno to saute pan and cook until onion just translucent, then add garlic. When garlic is fragrant, add corn, tomatoes, and black beans. Cook until mixture is heated through, then return beef to pan along with the Spanish rice. Combine until thoroughly mixed, then remove from heat. Season with salt and pepper, mixing to combine, and allow to cool to room temperature.', 'Char peppers lightly on the grill, turning frequently to ensure even char. Combine filling mixture with cheddar cheese, then generously spoon filling into peppers until entirely stuffed. Reduce grill heat to low and return peppers to grill; cover and allow to cook for 30 minutes or until peppers are cooked and the filling is hot throughout. Serve immediately.']

recipe_name: Chickpea & Kale Salad With Tahini Dressing
recipe_description: Labor Day is fast approaching, and we plan on spending it grilling, grubbing, and generally having a great time! A chickpea and kale salad isn’t just social media-worthy health food, it’s also really flippin’ tasty! Nutty tahini dressing pairs with tender sweet potatoes, protein-packed chickpeas, and luscious kale; layer on a little avocado, and you’ve got a salad that just can’t be beat.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 large head Curly Green Kale, washed & dried', '1 (16 oz.) can Chickpeas, rinsed & drained', '1 Sweet Potato, peeled & cubed', '1 Avocado, sliced', '1 c. Tahini', '1 large Lemon, juiced', '1 tbsp. Honey', '1/2 tsp. Cumin', '1 clove Garlic, finely minced', '1/2 c. Salt', '1/4 c. Water ( to thin, add more or less as desired)']
recipe_instructions: ['Fill a small pot fitted with a steamer with about an inch and a half of water and bring to a boil; place cubed sweet potato into steamer. Cover and steam until tender, about 10 minutes. Remove and set aside to cool.', 'Chop kale into bite-sized pieces and place into a large bowl. In a separate bowl, stir together tahini, lemon juice, honey, cumin, garlic, and salt; slowly add 1/4 cup of water to thin until desired consistency is reached.', 'Add chickpeas, cooled sweet potato, and avocado to kale, then top with tahini dressing. Toss before serving.']

recipe_description: Labor Day is fast approaching, and we plan on spending it grilling, grubbing, and generally having a great time! A grilled pizza is a great way to satisfy a homemade pizza craving without heating up the oven. Top it with fresh, local summer veggies, and you’re in for quite the dinner treat!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 medium Zucchini, washed & julienne sliced into rounds', '1 c. Cherry Tomatoes, sliced in half', '1 Red Bell Pepper, roasted & peeled', '1 ear Corn, washed & kernels sliced off', '3 cloves Garlic, thinly sliced', "1 c. Oliver's Own Marinara Sauce", "1 lb. Oliver's Own Fresh Pizza Dough", '1 c. Grated Mozzarella Cheese', '1/2 c. Fontina Cheese', '1/2 c. Parmesan Cheese', '1 tsp. Italian Seasoning', 'Olive Oil', 'Salt & Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat grill pan or barbecue on high. Stretch pizza dough into a 12 inch round; when grill is hot, brush grates lightly with olive oil. Top a cookie sheet with a thin layer of cornmeal and lay dough on top; use sheet to transfer dough to prepared grill. Close lid and grill on one side until bubbly and lightly crisped, about 2 minutes. Rotate dough if necessary to ensure even cooking. Transfer dough back to cookie sheet, grilled side up.', 'Top dough round evenly with marinara sauce, then sprinkle on mozzarella, fontina, and parmesan cheeses. Cover top with zucchini, corn, cherry tomatoes, garlic, and bell pepper; drizzle lightly with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle Italian seasoning over entire pizza.', 'Return pizza to grill and close lid. Cook until bottom is crisp and lightly charred and cheese is bubbly, about 3 minutes.']

recipe_description: Celebrate all things local with this delicious burger recipe. Locavores unite! Serve with a can of Oliver’s Own Robust Porter for a truly transformative meal!
recipe_ingredients: ["1 package Oliver's Own Rosemary Focaccia", "4 pack of Oliver's Own Gourmet Burger Patties", "Oliver's Own Roasted Red Pepper Aioli", 'Two Rock Valley Aged Goat Cheese, sliced', 'Walla Walla Onions, sliced', 'Local Beefsteak Tomatoes (from The Patch), sliced', 'Sonoma Brinery Pickles']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat a large cast iron skillet (or grill) over medium-high heat.', 'While the skillet is heating, cut the focaccia into burger-sized squares, then slice lengthwise - these will be your burger buns! Remove the burger patties from the package and reshape with your hands so they are slightly larger than your burger bun (they will reduce slightly in size while cooking).', 'Once the skillet is hot, but not smoking, add the burger patties, salting if desired. Without moving the patties, let them cook for 5 minutes, then flip and top with the Two Rock Valley Aged Goat Cheese and cook for another 4 minutes. Once the burgers are done, remove and let rest. While the burgers rest toast the focaccia slices on your skillet or grill.', "To assemble your burgers, spread a good amount of Oliver's Own Roasted Red Pepper Aioli on the cut-side of each piece of focaccia, then add the burger, tomato and onion! Serve with Sonoma Brinery Pickles and a cold can of Oliver's Own Robust Porter."]

recipe_description: This week, we’re getting ready for the Gravenstein Apple Fair with 20% off hard ciders! Take your roasted chicken to the next level with this simple and delicious way of infusing flavor and moisture. Get ready for caramelized deliciousness!
recipe_overview: ['Serves: 1 Chicken', 'Prep Time: 30 minutes', 'Cook Time: 1 hour 15 minutes']
recipe_ingredients: ['1 Whole Chicken, cavity washed & entrails removed', '2 c. Dry Hard Apple Cider', '1 Tart Apple, quartered', '1 Yellow Onion, quartered', '1 large bundle Thyme', '2 Carrots, peeled & cut in half', '2 lb. Yukon Gold Potatoes, scrubbed & cubed', 'Salt & Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Thoroughly grease a wire roasting rack and place in large, rimmed baking dish. Heat cider in a small saucepan until boiling, then reduce heat to medium-low; simmer until reduced to about 1/2 cup, about 30 minutes.', 'Pat chicken dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture, then season cavity thoroughly with salt and pepper. Stuff chicken with the apple, onion, thyme, and carrots, then butter skin and season the outside of the chicken thoroughly. Place on greased roasting rack, then potatoes to the baking dish underneath.', 'Bake until chicken is golden brown, about 30 minutes then reduce heat 350 degrees. Baste with cider reduction every 15 minutes for about 30 to 45 minutes, or until chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165 degrees. Let rest at least 15 minutes and season potatoes to taste before serving.']

recipe_name: Pork Chops with Hard Cider Reduction
recipe_description: This week, we’re getting ready for the Gravenstein Apple Fair with 20% off hard ciders! Pork and apples are a total classic of a pairing, but you’ve never had them like this – the complex flavors of the cider add a level of nuance that you just can’t get with plain apple juice. The chops are perfect for when you want an easy dish that still feels upscale.
recipe_ingredients: ["6 Oliver's Natural Boneless Center Cut Pork Loin Chops", '2 c. Dry Hard Apple Cider', '1 Shallot, minced', '3 cloves Garlic, minced', '1 tsp. Rosemary, finely chopped', '3 tbsp. Butter', '1 c. Tart Apples, chopped', '1 tsp. Brown Mustard', 'Salt & Black Pepper', '1 tbsp. Vegetable Oil']
recipe_instructions: ['Pat pork chops dry with paper towels, then season liberally with salt and pepper on both sides. Heat vegetable oil in large skillet on medium high until hot but not smoking. Sear pork chops on both sides, working in batches of 3 to ensure a good sear. Remove and set aside.', 'Add butter to pan, swirling to coat. Saute shallots and garlic until translucent and fragrant; add rosemary and apples and continue cooking until apples are slightly softened, about 5 minutes. Add hard cider and increase heat to high, scraping pan to release any fond. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium. Simmer until thickened and glossy, about 15 to 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.', 'Return chops to pan, turning to coat, and cook until heated through, about five minutes. Serve topped with reduction.']

recipe_description: This week, we’re getting ready for the Gravenstein Apple Fair with 20% off hard ciders! This hard cider caramel is great for topping everything from pancakes to ice cream, or go for the double-apple experience and throw it on baked apples. Either way, it’s a sweet, cider-y treat no one will be able to resist!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 c. Sweet Hard Apple Cider', '1 c. Brown Sugar, packed', '1 tsp. Cinnamon', '1/2 c. Heavy Whipping Cream', '1/2 tsp. Vanilla Extract', '1/4 tsp. Kosher Salt']
recipe_instructions: ['In a small, heavy-bottomed saucepan, heat hard cider until boiling then reduce heat and simmer uncovered until reduced half, about 10 to 15 minutes stirring frequently.', 'Remove sauce from heat and stir in salt and vanilla extract. Store in a tightly sealed jar in the fridge.']

recipe_description: Let’s those local Gravenstein apples shine in this delicious crisp that’s perfect for Summer!
recipe_ingredients: ['10 cups Gravenstein apples, peeled, cored and sliced', '1 cup sugar', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1/2 cup water', '1 cup quick-cooking oats', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 cup packed dark brown sugar', '1/4 teaspoon baking powder', '1/4 teaspoon baking soda', '1/2 cup Clover butter, melted']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees.', 'Place the sliced apples in a 9x13 baking dish. Mix the sugar, 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour and ground cinnamon together, and sprinkle over the apples. Pour water evenly over all.', 'Combine oats, 1 cup flour, dark brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda and melted butter together. Crumble evenly over the apple mixture.', 'Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes, or until bubbly.']

recipe_description: While heirloom tomatoes are certainly best fresh, a whole realm of possibilities opens up when you apply a little heat. This cioppino uses fresh heirlooms as a base, making for a stew that’s packed with real tomato flavor. Sure it’s summer, but trust us – you won’t want to wait for winter once you try it!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 lb. Mixed Fresh Shellfish (clams, prawns, mussels, crab, etc.)', '1 lb. Firm-Fleshed Fish (halibut, salmon, etc.)', '4-5 large Fresh Heirloom Tomatoes, peeled', '1 c. Red Wine', '2 tbsp. Balsamic Vinegar', '1 Red Onion, diced', '6 cloves Garlic, sliced', '1 tsp. Honey', '2 Bay Leaves', '1 tsp. Dried Oregano', '1 c. Basil Leaves, packed & roughly chopped', 'Juice of 1 Lemon', '1 c. Fresh Parsley, roughly chopped', '1/4 c. Olive Oil', '2 c. Chicken Stock', 'Salt & Black Pepper, to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['Place peeled tomatoes into a blender or food processor and puree on high until uniform; strain through a fine mesh sieve to remove seeds and set aside. Heat 1 tbsp. olive oil in a large pot, then saute onion and garlic until translucent and fragrant; add pureed tomatoes, chicken stock, red wine, balsamic vinegar, and lemon juice. Stir briefly to combine, then heat on medium high until boiling. Reduce heat to low and add basil, bay leaves, and oregano. Cook about 20 minutes, uncovered.', 'In the meantime, clean and prep fish and shellfish. Rinse and scrub mussels and clams, and remove beards from mussels; discard any individuals that are open or whose shells are not tightly clamped. If using crab or lobster, wash and clip so meat is easily accessible. Check fish for pin bones and remove any skin or leftover scales. Add clams and mussels to cooking liquid, then cover and cook until they have begun to open, about 5 minutes; add additional shellfish and fish, stirring gently, and continue cooking for about 5 minutes. Season with and pepper to taste.', 'To finish, stir in parsley and remaining olive oil. Serve with crustini for dunking.']

recipe_description: Pickles? With MY heirloom tomatoes?! You bet! Tangy and salty, these tomato pickles are great on their own or as a part of a dish. Try them with a little fresh burrata cheese for a funky take on caprese or add them to a salad for a sour bite.
recipe_overview: ['Serves: 1 (16 oz.) jar', 'Prep Time: 20 minutes', 'Cook Time: 7-10 days']
recipe_ingredients: ['3-4 Fresh Heirloom Tomatoes, vertically quartered', '2-4 cloves Garlic, roughly smashed', '1/2 c. Basil Leaves. packed & roughly chopped', '2 tbsp. Kosher Sea Salt (non-iodized)', '1 c. Purified Water', '1/3 c. Apple Cider Vinegar (only use for quick pickles)', '1/2 tsp. Peppercorns', '1/2 tsp. Crushed Red Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Place tomatoes, garlic, peppercorns, crushed red pepper, and basil into a 16 oz. sterile glass jar with a tight-fitting lid.', 'In a separate bowl, whisk together salt and water; continue whisking until salt is completely dissolved. If making quick pickles, whisk in vinegar as well. Pour mixture over tomatoes so that tomatoes are completely submerged; however, it is important to leave at least an inch of headspace at the top of the jar. This will accommodate gasses that develop during fermentation.', 'To ferment, leave in a dark and cool area for 7 to 10 days. Unless using a jar fitted with an airlock, "burp" your pickles daily by loosening the lid. This releases any gasses and prevents accidental explosions; continue this even when pickles are finished as they will continue fermenting in the fridge. For quick pickles, allow tomatoes to marinate overnight in the refrigerator. Pickles will keep for about 30 days in the fridge.']

recipe_description: Heirloom tomatoes, pork, and beef come together to form this sauce of the gods. Serve it tossed with fresh penne pasta for a delicious weeknight dinner or dish it up with creamy, cheesy polenta for an easy meal that feels luxurious.
recipe_ingredients: ['4-5 large Fresh Heirloom Tomatoes, peeled', '2 tbsp. Tomato Paste', '1 c. Dry White Wine', '1 1/2 c. Basil Leaves, packed & roughly chopped', '1 c. Fresh Parlsey, packed & roughly chopped', '2 Bay Leaves', '1 tsp. Dried Oregano', '1 Yellow Onion, finely diced', '6 cloves Garlic, minced', '1 lb. Ground Beef', '1/2 lb. Ground Pork', '1 tbsp. Butter', '3 tbsp. Olive Oil', '1 tbsp. Fresh Lemon Juice', 'Salt & Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Place peeled tomatoes into a blender or food processor and puree on high until uniform; strain through a fine mesh sieve to remove seeds and set aside. Heat 1 tbsp. olive oil in a large frying pan until hot but not smoking; add beef and pork to pan. Season liberally with salt and pepper and allow to continue browning, then break apart roughly with a spoon. Continue cooking until meat is browned. Transfer meat to a plate lined with paper towels to drain.', 'Add 1 tsp. olive oil to pan. On medium heat, saute onions and garlic until translucent and fragrant; return meat to pan and mix with veggies. Add white wine, increasing heat slightly and scraping the bottom of the pan to release any fond that may have built up. Add tomato puree, basil, bay leaves, and oregano and cook for about 20 minutes or until sauce has thickened. Stir in tomato paste, parsley, butter, lemon juice, and remaining olive oil; cover and allow sauce to continue cooking for an additional 10 to 15 minutes.', 'To finish, season with salt and pepper to taste.']

recipe_description: This week, we’re throwing it all on the grill, and there’s nothing that grills up quite so nice as a piece of sumptuous pound cake. Dished up with fresh berries and ice cream, this cake is crispy on the outside and decadently soft on the inside; try it as a creative end to a barbecue or dish it up as an easy weeknight dessert!
recipe_ingredients: ["1 Oliver's Own Vanilla Pound Cake, sliced into 1 inch-thick pieces", '6 tbsp. Unsalted Butter, melted', '2 c. fresh, seasonal Berries', '1 tbsp. Light Brown Sugar', '1 tbsp. Lemon Juice', 'Ice Cream, for serving']
recipe_instructions: ['In a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, combine the berries, lemon juice, and sugar. Cook until the berries have softened and have begun to release their juice, about 10 minutes.', 'Preheat grill or grill pan on medium-low heat. Brush the pound cake slices with melted butter, then grill until the cake is toasted, about 2 minutes per side.', 'Serve pound cake topped with berry mixture and ice cream, if desired.']

recipe_description: These tasty crustaceans get done up in high style with a spicy, jalapeno-lime marinade and a little fresh char from the grill. Perfect for a game day lunch or a healthy dinner.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 lb. large Raw Prawns, peeled & deveined', '1/2 c. fresh Lime Juice', '1 fresh Jalapeno Pepper, chopped & seeded/ribs removed', '1/3 c. Cilantro, pack & roughly chopped', '1/2 tsp. Cumin', '1/4 c. Olive Oil', '1/2 tsp. Salt', '1/2 tsp. Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['In a blender, combine lime juice, olive oil, jalapeno, cilantro, cumin, salt, and black pepper; puree until cohesive but not smooth. Place raw shrimps in a large glass or Pyrex bowl, then pour in marinade, tossing so that shrimps are evenly coated with marinade. Cover tightly, then place in the refrigerator. Allow shrimps to marinate at least 15 minutes or up to 2 hours (any longer and the acid in the lime juice will begin to cook them).', 'If using bamboo or wooden skewers, soak for 30 minutes in water before using. Clean and prep grill, then heat on medium-high. Arrange three or four shrimps on each skewer, then place on grill. Cook 2 to 3 minutes per side, flipping once, or until shrimps are fully opaque and pink. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: Holy Halloumi, talk about the ultimate grilled cheese! No, seriously, we’re straight up grilling cheese – it’s delicious. This specialty of Cyprus is crafted from sheep’s milk and boasts an extremely high melting point, meaning you can in fact throw it straight on the grill. Use it to liven up kebobs, dish it up with grilled bread, or enjoy it as a sweet-salty treat with fresh watermelon.
recipe_ingredients: ['1/2 lb. Halloumi Cheese, cut into 1/2 inch-thick slices', '3 tbsp. Oregano', '2 tbsp. Olive Oil', '1 grilled Lemon, juiced', 'Sliced Watermelon or Grilled Bread (for serving)']
recipe_instructions: ['Heat grill on medium-high. Brush cheese with olive oil and place onto grill for 2 minutes on each side, or until distinct grill marks have formed.', 'Sprinkle halloumi with oregano and drizzle with olive and grilled lemon juice. Serve on a slice of watermelon or grilled bread.']

recipe_description: Who knew that all you needed for restaurant-quality pizza was already sitting in your backyard! Grilled pizzas are the crispiest pie you can get without a real wood-burning oven; you can top these babies with just about anything, but we’ve opted for simple deliciousness with this easy Margherita version. These babies are perfect for a funky summer barbecue or anytime you want great pizza!
recipe_ingredients: ["1 package Oliver's Own Pizza Dough, at room temperature", '1 c. Basil Leaves, packed & chopped', '1 large Beefsteak or Heirloom Tomato, cored & washed', '16 oz. Fresh Mozzarella, sliced', '2 cloves Garlic, crushed', '3 tbsp. Olive Oil + more for grill', 'Salt & Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Clean and prep grill, then preheat on high until needed. Stretch dough to form a circle and transfer to a lightly floured cookie sheet; lightly grease prepared grill with olive oil, then transfer dough rough onto grill. Grill briefly on one side until bottom is just beginning to brown and the top is bubbly. Transfer back to floured cookie sheet, grilled side up, then close grill lid to retain heat.', 'Mix crushed garlic with 2 tbsp. of olive oil, then brush mixture across prepared pizza round. Top first with mozzarella, then tomato slices, and finish with chopped basil. Drizzle with remaining tablespoon of olive oil and season with salt and pepper, then lightly oil grill again before transferring pizza back. Reduce the heat to low and close the lid. Allow pizza to cook until crust is browned and cheese has melted 2-3 minutes.']

recipe_description: Looking for something refreshing and a little boozy for summer? Look no further than this incredible cooler! Fresh honeydew and cucumbers plus a shot (or more) of gin makes this cocktail both tremendously thirst-quenching and great for a party. With a little mint to brighten things up, you’ve got a cocktail that just won’t quit!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 medium, ripe Honeydew Melon, peel & seeds removed', '1 large Cucumber, peel & seeds removed', '8 oz. Gin', '1/2 c. Mint Leaves, roughly chopped', '1/2 c. Lime Juice', '1 c. Honeydew Melon Balls, for garnish', '4-6 Mint Sprigs, for garnish']
recipe_instructions: ['Cut honeydew and cucumber into small chunks. Blend with gin, mint leaves, and lime juice until completely smooth; strain through a fine mesh sieve into a pitcher, then chill.', 'Serve cold, with several melon balls and a sprig of mint in each glass.']

recipe_name: Melon & Arugula Salad with Spicy Ham
recipe_description: Peppery, sweet, and with just the right amount of heat, this salad is a total winner! We’ve used canary melons for their subtle sweetness and excellent texture, but you could do this with any melon you prefer.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 medium, ripe Canary Melon, peeled & seeded', '1 lb. Fresh Arugula, washed & dried', '6-8 thin slices Jamon Serrano', '1 Shallot, finely minced', '1 clove Garlic, finely minced', '1/2 c. Olive Oil', '1/3 c. Red Wine Vinegar', '1 tbsp. Dijon Mustard', '1/3 c. Basil, finely chopped', '1/2 tsp. Salt', '1/2 tsp. Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, vinegar, shallot, garlic, mustard, basil, salt, and pepper. Set aside until needed.', 'Slice canary melon into bite-sized cubes, and slice ham into thin strips. Combine melon and ham with arugula. Coat with dressing, then toss to combine.']

recipe_description: This week, we’re happy to feature Garden of Life’s fabulous line of Collegen Peptide powders! These funky little amino acids are key in maintaining a healthy body, and if they have additional beauty benefits, hey – we’re not going to complain! This silky pannacotta gets a health boost with collagen peptides and fresh cherries, making it the ultimate health-food treat!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 c. Coconut Milk', '2 tbsp. Garden of Life Unflavored Collagen Peptides', '2 tbsp. Honey', '1 tsp. Vanilla Extract', '1 lb. Fresh Cherries or Strawberries, pitted/hulled & sliced', '1/4 c. Grand Marnier', '1 tbsp. Sugar']
recipe_instructions: ['In a blender or food processor, puree coconut milk, Garden of Life Unflavored Collagen Peptides, honey, and vanilla until smooth. Allow collagen to bloom briefly by leaving puree to bubble for about 5-10 minutes. Pour mixture into a saucepan and heat on medium, whisking constantly until collagen has fully dissolved. Fill individual ramekins or cups about halfway with pannacotta mixture and allow to chill until set, about 3 hours.', 'While the pannacottas set, combine fresh cherries or strawberries, Grand Marnier, and sugar in a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate; allow fruit to macerate for 2 hours.', 'To serve, top pannacotta with macerated fruit immediately before consuming.']

recipe_description: The perfect dish for a hot summer’s day! Chilled to perfection and loaded with fresh cantaloupe, this sweet and savory soup makes a delicate start to a summer meal.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 medium, ripe Cantaloupe', '1 large Cucumber', '1 Shallot, chopped', '1/3 c. Ice Water', '1 tbsp. Sherry Vinegar', '1/3 c. Extra Virgin Olive Oil', '2/3 c. Plain Yogurt (plus more for garnish, if desired)', '4-6 strips Prosciutto', 'Salt & Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Cut the cantaloupe in half and remove the seeds. Carefully peel flesh from skin with a sharp knife, then roughly cut into small cubes. Peel cucumber with a vegetable peeler, then cut in half to expose seeds. Scoop out seeds with a spoon and discard, then roughly chop cucumber.', 'In a blender, combine melon, cucumber, shallots, and water; blend until smooth, then pour half of mixture into a separate bowl. Add yogurt and vinegar to blender and pulse again to combine; with the blender running, slowly stream in olive oil, then continue blending until creamy and smooth. Combine with reserved gazpacho mixture, season generously, then chill until needed.', 'Crisp prosciutto in a saute pan, then remove to drain. When prosciutto has cooled, break apart into small pieces. Serve chilled gazpacho topped with prosciutto, a dollop of yogurt, and a drizzle of olive oil.']

recipe_description: This week, we’re happy to feature Garden of Life’s fabulous line of Collegen Peptide powders! These funky little amino acids are key in maintaining a healthy body, and if they have additional beauty benefits, hey – we’re not going to complain! This smoothie has everything – collagen peptides, plant-based protein, the works. Top it off with some fresh raspberries, and you’ve got yourself the ultimate healthy breakfast!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 scoop Garden of Life Strawberry Lemonade or Cranberry Pomegranate Collagen Peptides', '1 scoop Garden of Life Organic Vanilla Plant Protein', '1 1/2 c. Coconut Water', '1 tbsp. Chia Seeds', '1 tbsp. Ripe Avocado', '1/2 c. Non-Dairy Milk', '1 c. Fresh Raspberries']
recipe_instructions: ['Blend all ingredients on high until smooth. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: This week, we’re happy to feature Garden of Life’s fabulous line of Collegen Peptide powders! These funky little amino acids are key in maintaining a healthy body, and if they have additional beauty benefits, hey – we’re not going to complain! This delicious chocolate smoothie is packed with protein but light on sugar, and with a boost from collagen peptides, it’s the ultimate post-workout treat!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 scoops Garden of Life Unflavored Collagen Peptides', '1 Avocado, pitted & removed from skin', '2 tbsp. Cacao Powder', '1 Banana, frozen', '1 tbsp. Almond Butter', '2 tbsp. Honey', '2 c. Almond Milk']
recipe_instructions: ['Blend all ingredients until smooth. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: Watermelon and jicama combine to form a salad that is superbly light and incredibly refreshing. Bring it to a summer barbecue as a side dish or mix up a big batch and snack away!
recipe_ingredients: ['4 c. Seedless Watermelon, cut into chunks', '2 c. Jicama, peeled & cut into small chunks', '1/2 c. Lime Juice', '2 tbsp. Honey', '1 tsp. Lime Zest', '1/3 c. Mint Leaves, roughly chopped', '1 tsp. Salt', '1 tsp. Chili Powder', '1/2 tsp. Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['In a small bowl, combine lime juice, honey, lime zest, mint leaves, salt, chili powder, and black pepper.', 'Combine watermelon and jicama chunks in a large salad bowl, then top with dressing. Toss to combine, serve immediately.']

recipe_description: Peaches, meet your new best friend – delicious rosé wine! Gently simmered to succulent perfection, these peaches taste so elegant that no one will ever guess they’re a cinch to make.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 (750ml) bottle Rosé Wine', '4 Yellow or White Peaches', '1 Vanilla Pod, split lengthwise', '1 sprig Fresh Rosemary', '1/2 c. Sugar', '2 large strips Lemon Zest']
recipe_instructions: ['Peel peaches by briefly submerging them in boiling water and then immediately plunging them into an ice bath. Remove the skins, cut the peaches in half, and set them aside.', 'In a large saucepan, pour in wine and add vanilla, rosemary, sugar, and lemon zest. Heat on medium until sugar has dissolved, then add peaches. Cover with water and bring to a boil, then reduce heat and cook for about 15 minutes. Remove peaches and chill.', 'Continue reducing wine until forms a thick syrup; remove the lemon zest, rosemary sprig, and vanilla, then chill syrup. Serve peaches in a pool of wine syrup.']

recipe_description: Dry rosé, sweet tequila, and tart lime juice form the base of this exceedingly drinkable sangria. Top it off with fresh fruit, and you’ll be made in the shade! Until you run out, that is.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 (750ml) bottle Dry Rosé Wine, chilled', '1 c. Tequila Blanco', '1 c. Fresh Lime Juice', '2 c. Strawberries', '1 Navel Orange', '1 (6oz) package Raspberries', '1 (16oz) bottle Lemon-Lime Soda, chilled']
recipe_instructions: ['In a 1 gallon pitcher, stire together rosé, tequila, and lime juice. Slice strawberries into bite-sized pieced, and slice orange into thin wedges. Rinse and drain raspberries.', 'Combine fruit with sangria mixture. Top with soda, stirring again. Serve chilled.']

recipe_description: Rosé may be the hottest trend in wine, but FROsés are the coolest! These slushy-like cocktails are perfect for sipping on a hot summer’s day, especially if there’s a pool to lounge in.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 (750ml) bottle medium or dark Rosé Wine', '1 c. Strawberries, roughly chopped', '1/2 c. Sugar', '2 tbsp. fresh Lime Juice']
recipe_instructions: ['Pour wine into a large glass or pyrex baking dish and freeze until nearly solid, about 6 hours. Due to the alcohol content in wine, it will not freeze completely solid.', 'While wine is freezing, combine sugar and 1/2 cup water in a medium saucepan. Heat on medium, whisking constantly, until sugar has been completely dissolved. Add chopped strawberries, then remove from heat and allow strawberries to steep in syrup for about 30 minutes. Strain strawberries from syrup, transfer syrup to container, and chill.', 'Scraoe rosé into a blender, add lime juice and 1/4 cup of strawberry syrup with one cup of ice and blend. Transfer blender pitcher to freezer until frosé has thickened (about 25 minutes), then blend again into a slushy consistency.']

recipe_description: This modern take on a classic treat is perfect for the kid in every grown-up! Sparkling rosé wine pairs beautifully with raspberry sorbet and mint for an adult float that’s full of fun. Try it as a classy way to end a dinner party, or give your next barbecue the luxury treatment and impress your guests!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 (750ml) bottle Sparkling Rosé Wine, chilled', '1 (16oz) container Raspberry Sorbet or Sorbetto', '1 (6oz) package Fresh Raspberries', '8 sprigs Fresh Mint']
recipe_instructions: ['Into several cocktail glasses, scoop one or two small scoops of raspberry sorbet. Bruise mint leaves gently, then add 2 leaves to each cocktail glass and with 2 to 3 raspberries.', 'Top with sparkling rosé to finish. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: This week, check out an Oliver’s exclusive straight from from Valley Ford Cheese and Creamery: their wonderfully light and creamy Farmer’s Cheese! This spread made from farmer’s cheese is a traditional Slavik dish popular in Austria and Hungary; it’s loaded with sweet paprika, briney capers, and pungent caraway seeds. Try it as a delicious dip with crackers or spread it on some dark bread for an afternoon snack!
recipe_ingredients: ["8 oz. Valley Ford Farmer's Cheese", '4 oz. Butter, softened', '1 tbsp. Sweet Paprika', '1 (4oz) jar Capers, chopped', '1/2 tsp. Brown Mustard', '1/2 tsp. Caraway Seeds', '1 large Shallot, finely minced', '1 clove Garlic, finely minced', 'Salt & Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ["Beat together the farmer's cheese and butter until well-mixed and fluffy. Stir in paprika, capers, mustard, caraway seeds, shallot, and garlic until paprika has been totally combined and other ingredients are evenly dispersed. Season generously with salt and pepper, stirring again.", 'Transfer liptauer mixture to a small serving bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap, then refrigerate for 1 hour to set. Serve on any dark brown bread and top with veggies, smoked fish, or sliced pickles.']

recipe_description: This week, check out an Oliver’s exclusive straight from from Valley Ford Cheese and Creamery: their wonderfully light and creamy Farmer’s Cheese! These farmer’s cheese gnocchi are tremendously rich but still light and as fluffy as a cloud. We’ve done them up with brown butter and sage, but these puppies would go beautifully with fresh pesto, marinara, or your favorite meat sauce.
recipe_ingredients: ["1 c. Farmer's Cheese", '2 large Eggs', '1/8 tsp. Salt', '1/2 c. All-Purpose Flour', '3 tbsp. Butter', '1 bunch Fresh Sage, washed', 'Parmesan Cheese, for serving']
recipe_instructions: ['In a large bowl, combine cheese, eggs, and salt, then begin incorporating the flour. The dough will be fairly loose and sticky; this will make for a more delicate gnocchi. Form the dough into tiny balls then press flat so there is a divet in the center.', 'Heat a large pot of water until boiling. Gently drop in gnocchi; when the gnocchi float, they are done. While gnocchi cook, heat butter and sage in a saute pan on medium until butter begins to brown, about 2 minutes. Add half the gnocchi and saute until browned on both sides, then remove; repeat with remaining gnocchi. Top generously with parmesan before serving.']

recipe_description: Round out your 4th of July barbecue with a true campfire experience, minus the campfire. This dessert dip takes everything you love about s’mores, combines it with luscious hazelnut-chocolate spread, and makes it about ten times as easy!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 (10oz) bag Large Marshmallows', '1 c. Milk Chocolate Chips', '1 c. Hazelnut-Chocolate Spread', '1 tbsp. Unsalted Butter', '1 (14 oz. box Graham Crackers']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. Heat a large cast-iron skillet on the stove, then remove from heat when hot. Add butter to skillet, swirling to coat. Scatter chocolate chips across the bottom of the skillet, then dollop on hazelnut-chocolate spread; top with marshmallows.', 'Place the entire skillet in the oven and bake for 5 to 6 minutes or until marshmallows have melted slightly and are golden brown on top.', 'To serve, scoop out dip with graham crackers. For a fun twist, use chocolate and cream sandwich cookies instead!']

recipe_description: S’mores are the staple of summer, right? Every year we find ourselves making the same original s’mores as last. This year, find s’more ways to make your summer s’mores!
recipe_ingredients: ['4 whole graham crackers, halved', '8 large marshmallows, toasted', '2 teaspoons hot caramel ice cream topping, warmed if necessary', '2 teaspoons chocolate syrup']
recipe_instructions: ['Top four graham cracker halves with toasted marshmallows.', 'Drizzle with caramel topping and chocolate syrup; top with remaining crackers']

recipe_description: S’mores are the staple of summer, right? Every year we find ourselves making the same original s’mores as last. This year, find s’more ways to make your summer s’mores!
recipe_ingredients: ['8 oz. semisweet chocolate, chopped', '1 can (14 ounces) sweetened condensed milk', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '16 whole graham crackers, halved', '2 c. miniature marshmallows']
recipe_instructions: ["In a heavy saucepan, melt chocolate over low heat. Add milk; cook and stir until smooth. Stir in vanilla. Making one s'more at a time, spread 1 tablespoon chocolate mixture over each of two graham cracker halves.", 'Place eight or nine marshmallows on one cracker; gently press the other cracker on top. Repeat. Wrap in plastic; store at room temperature']

recipe_description: This salad is as healthy as it is delicious; it’s the perfect side dish for any 4th of July barbecue!
recipe_ingredients: ['3-4 medium sized Red Beets', '1 c. fresh Blueberries, washed', '1 (1lb) package Mixed Spring Greens', '1 c. Roasted Almonds', '1/2 c. Feta Cheese', '1/4 c. Raspberry Vinegar', '1/4 c. Orange Juice', '1/2 c. Olive Oil', '2 tbsp. Dijon Mustard', '1 tsp. Fresh Thyme, finely chopped', 'Salt & Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Scrub beets to remove any dirt and cut off ends, then stab several times all over with a fork. Wrap beets in a sheet of aluminum foil and place on a sheet pan. Roast beets for 45 to 60 minutes, or until beets are fork tender. When beets are finished, remove from oven and allow to sit without removing foil for an additional 10 minutes. Peel beets and cube, then set aside to finish cooling.', 'To make the dressing, whisk together all dressing ingredients in a small bowl and chill. In a large salad bowl, place half the mixed greens in the bottom of the bowl, then toss in half the blueberries, almonds, and cooled beets. Repeat for a second layer, then pour dressing over the top. Toss salad until evenly dressed and ingredients are evenly distributed, then crumble in chunks of feta. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: This classic piece of Americana gets an upgrade with tangy blue cheese and crispy bacon. Add in some multicolored potatoes, and you have a fun salad perfect for your 4th of July bash!
recipe_ingredients: ['3 lb. Gold Fingerling or Mixed Color Fingerling Potatoes', '1/2 c. Fresh Chives, finely chopped', '1/4 c. Fresh Parsley, finely chopped', '6 slices Bacon, chopped', '1 c. Blue Cheese, crumbled', '1/2 c. Olive Oil', '2 tbsp. Dijon Mustard', '1/4 c. Red Wine Vinegar', 'Salt & Black Pepper', '1 Shallot, minced', '1 clove Garlic, minced', 'Salt & Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Thoroughly wash all potatoes, then chop all potatoes into uniform chunks. If using mixed colors of potatoes, boil red and gold potatoes together but boil the purple potatoes separately – they tend to bleed their color when they’re cooking. Cook potatoes for about 10 minutes or until tender then drain, continuing to keep purple potatoes separated. Allow to cool.', 'While potatoes cook, cook chopped bacon until crisp, then drain and cool. Whisk together olive oil, Dijon mustard, vinegar, herbs, shallot, and garlic; season liberally with salt and pepper.', 'When potatoes are cool, combine with bacon and blue cheese crumbles. Pour on dressing and toss until potatoes are evenly coated and bacon and blue cheese have been evenly distributed throughout. Serve chilled or at room temperature.']

recipe_description: These ribs are sweet and smoky, and the patriotic colors make them a great addition to a classic 4th of July barbeque!
recipe_ingredients: ['4 (2lb) racks Baby Back Ribs, membrane removed', '2 tbsp. Garlic Powder', '2 tbsp. Onion Powder', '1 1/2 tsp. Paprika', '1 tsp. Salt', '1 tsp. Black Pepper', '4 c. Blueberries', '3 c. Apple Cider Vinegar', '1 sprig Fresh Sage', '2 sprigs Fresh Thyme', '1 Bay Leaf', '1 clove Garlic, smashed', '2 1/4 c. Brown Sugar, packed', '1 Onion, diced', '2 tbsp. Unsalted Butter', 'Salt & Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Mix garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt, and black pepper together in small bowl. Rub ribs with spice mixture, then place on sheet pan with a rack and cover with foil. Bake covered about 2 hours or until very tender.', 'While ribs are cooking, heat butter in a medium saucepan and sauté onions and garlic until soft. Wrap thyme sprig and fresh sage with a piece of twine and tie together; sauté briefly, then add blueberries, mashing briefly with a potato masher or fork to release the juices. Add apple cider vinegar, brown sugar, and bay leaf. Cover and cook for 20 to 30 minutes, stirring frequently, or until the sauce has thickened slightly and the blueberries have broken down completely. Remove the herb bundle and bay leaf, and transfer to a blender; puree until smooth or until desired consistency is reached.', 'Remove ribs from oven, and raise the oven temperature to 450 degrees. Baste ribs generously with blueberry glaze before returning to the oven for an additional 10 minutes. For extra char and caramelization, give the ribs 5 minutes under the broiler on the high setting to finish. Allow 10 minutes to rest before slicing; serve with remaining blueberry glaze.']

recipe_description: Let’s face it – now that summer’s here, it’s HOT. Cool off this 4th of July with these refreshing wine spritzers! Loaded with fresh watermelon and blueberries, it’s a cocktail that’s as fun to look at as it is to drink.
recipe_ingredients: ['2 c. Watermelon, cubed', '2 c. Blueberries, washed', '1 (750ml) bottle Dry White Wine, chilled', '1 (1lt) bottle Lemon-Lime Soda, chilled', '1 c. Watermelon Juice, chilled', '2 Limes, sliced into wedges (garnish)']
recipe_instructions: ['Place cubed watermelon and blueberries in the bottom of a 1-2 gallon pitcher. Pour in watermelon juice and white wine, then top with soda. Stir gently and pour into glasses, making sure each glass has watermelon cubes and blueberries.', 'Garnish with a lime wedge.']

recipe_description: Did someone just say peach SALSA?! That’s right, these juicy beauties make a delicious salsa, especially served on top of a mouthwatering piece of salmon. Try it for a healthy dinner tonight!
recipe_ingredients: ['Salmon', '1 (1 lb.) piece fresh Salmon, cut into 4 pieces', '1 tbsp. Paprika', '1 tsp. Chili Powder', '1 tsp. Cumin', '1 tsp. Garlic Powder', '1/2 tsp. Onion Powder', '1/2 tsp. Black Pepper', '1/4 tsp. Salt', '2 tbsp. Canola Oil', 'Salsa', '2 fresh/ripe Peaches, pits removed', '1 Avocado, halved & Pit removed', '1/2 Red Onion, finely chopped', '1 Jalapeno Pepper, seeds/ribs removed', '1/4 c. fresh Lime Juice', 'Salt & Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['To make the salsa, finely dice the peaches, avocado, and jalapeno; toss them together with the red onion and lime juice. Season with salt and pepper, stirring again to combine, then set aside until needed.', 'Mix the paprika, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, pepper, and salt in a small bowl. Check salmon for any remaining bones and remove any still left; rub the flesh side only with the spice mixture, being sure to coat it thoroughly.', 'Heat canola oil in a skillet on medium; when the oil is hot but not quite smoking, place fish skin side down into pan. Sear for 4 minutes, then flip and sear an additional 4 minutes or until the internal temperature registers 145 degrees.', 'Top with peach salsa before serving.']

recipe_description: Keep the flavor of fresh plums going all year round with this easy and flavorful plum butter! Also, with no sugar added, it’s a great alternative to traditional jams and jellies.
recipe_ingredients: ['4-6 lbs. fresh Plums', '2 Clementines, cut in half', '1/4 c. Honey', '2 Cinnamon Sticks', '1/4 tsp. Salt']
recipe_instructions: ['Fill a large pot with water and bring to a roiling boil; at the same time, fill a large bowl 3/4 of the way full with ice and water. Score the bottoms of each plum by a making a cut lengthwise across the bottom and another cut crosswise through that. Submerge the plums in the boiling water for about 30 to 45 seconds then immediately plunge into the ice bath to stop the cooking. Let the plums sit in the ice bath for about 5 minutes, then peel and cut in half to remove the stone. Repeat until all plums are prepped.', 'Place prepared plums and all other ingredients in a large pot and heat on medium. The plums will begin to release liquid fairly quickly; as they soften, gently break them apart with a wooden spoon to encourage them to continue to break down. Reduce heat to medium low, and cook uncovered for 30 to 45 minutes or until plum butter is smooth and thick. Remove clementine pieces and cinnamon sticks to finish. This can either be canned for shelf storage or can be kept in the fridge for about 30 days.']

recipe_description: Take advantage of the summer bounty with this delicious marriage of nectarines and blackberries! Sweet, tart, and oh-so tasty, you’ll wish summer could be all year round!
recipe_ingredients: ['Crust', '1 1/2 c. All-Purpose Flour', '1/2 tsp. Sugar', '1/4 tsp. Salt', '1/2 c. Unsalted Butter, kept very cold & cubed', '1/4 c. Ice Water', 'Filling', '1 1/2 lb. fresh Nectarines, sliced', '1 1/2 c. fresh Blackberries', '2 tbsp. Honey', '1/2 tsp. Cinnamon', '1/8 tsp. Cardamom', '1 tsp. All-Purpose Flour', '2 tbsp. Unsalted Butter', '1/4 tsp. Salt', '1 Egg, beaten with 1 tbsp. Water']
recipe_instructions: ["To make the crust, stir together flour, sugar, and salt in a large bowl. Leave the butter in the fridge to keep it extremely cold. When ready, cut butter into flour mixture until it's the texture and color of sand. Begin slowly adding the ice water, 1 tbsp. at a time, stirring until a rough dough begins to form. Work the dough by hand until it comes together into a rough ball; cover tightly and chill until ready.", 'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine sliced nectarines, blackberries, honey, cinnamon, cardamom, 1 tsp. of flour, and salt. When dough is chilled, roll out into a rough circle, about 10 inches in diameter, and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment. Pile fruit mixture in the center and begin folding up edges to contain the filling. Brush with beaten egg and distribute 2 tbsp. of butter in pieces across the exposed filling. Bake for 1 hour, then allow 15 minutes to cool before serving so filling can set.']

recipe_description: Tender and crispy, these wings get a heaping helping of homemade apricot barbecue sauce to punch up their flavor!
recipe_ingredients: ['20 Chicken Wings', '1/2 tsp. Salt', '1 tbsp. aluminum-free Baking Powder', 'SAUCE', '1 Red Onion, diced', '6 fresh Apricots, peeled/pits removed & cut in half', '3 cloves Garlic, sliced', '1 thumb-sized piece fresh Ginger, peeled & sliced', '1 Jalapeno Pepper, sliced', '1/4 c. Honey', '1 (7 oz.) can Tomato Sauce', '2 tbsp. Apple Cider Vinegar', 'Salt & Pepper', '1 tbsp. Canola Oil']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 250 degrees. In a large bowl, toss chicken wings with salt and baking powder; arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet fitted with a rack. Bake for about 30 minutes to remove excess fat and moisture, then raise the heat to 425 degrees and continue cooking for 40-50 minutes. Remove from oven when wings are golden brown and crispy.', 'At the same time, in a medium sized pot, heat canola oil and saute onion, garlic, ginger, and jalapeno until soft. Add apricots and continue cooking; when apricots are slightly soft, add honey, tomato sauce, and vinegar. Cook an additional 15 to 20 minutes or until apricots have fully broken down and sauce has thickened slightly, then transfer to a blender and puree until smooth.', 'Allow baked wings to rest for about 5 minutes, then toss in warm sauce. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: With the return of summer comes the return of everyone’s favorite herb: basil! We’ve heaped it into delicious fresh pesto, perfect for slathering on salmon, and with local King Salmon fillets at just $14.99 a pound, you know you’re in for summer treat that can’t be beat!
recipe_ingredients: ['4-6 Local/Fresh/Wild King Salmon Fillets, skin removed', '2 Lemons, sliced into 12-18 rounds', 'Salt & Pepper', 'Pesto', '2 c. Basil Leaves, packed', '1 c. Parmesan Cheese, grated', '3/4 c. Olive Oil', '2/3 c. Pine Nuts or Chopped Walnuts', '4 cloves Garlic, chopped', '1/4 tsp. Salt', '1/4 tsp. Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 450 degrees, and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Add basil and pine nuts to a food processor and pulse several times, then scrape down the sides before continuing. Add garlic and parmesan and repeat. After scraping down the bowl for the second time, turn the food processor on so it is blending continuously, then slowly stream in the olive oil while the food processor is running; this will help the pesto emulsify. Season with salt and pepper, stirring to combine. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.', 'Check salmon fillets for possible pin bones and remove any if found. Pat down salmon fillets, and season on all sides with salt and pepper; arrange 3 slices of lemon per salmon fillet on the baking sheet, and place salmon fillets on top of lemon slices. Generously spoon pesto on top of fish, then place in the oven. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until salmon has reached 145 degrees.', 'Serve with fresh lemon wedges and any leftover pesto.']

recipe_description: Tender, flavorful Snake River Farms American Wagyu beef makes for the ultimate steak experience. Keep your preparation simple and let this insanely delicious meat shine!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 (12 oz.) Snake River Farms American Wagyu Boneless New York Steaks', '2 tbsp. Vegetable Oil', '3 sprigs Fresh Rosemary', '2 sprigs Fresh Thyme', '4 tbsp. Unsalted Butter', 'Sea Salt', 'Black Pepper.']
recipe_instructions: ['Season both sides of each steak liberally with sea salt only. Heat a cast iron skillet on medium high heat until hot; add vegetable oil, swirling to coat. When oil is nearly smoking. place steaks into pan one at a time, pressing gently to ensure an even sear. Allow steaks to cook with moving for 4 minutes, then flip and continue cooking for 2 minutes.', 'Add rosemary and thyme sprigs to the pan with the butter; as the butter melts, spoon over steaks. Continue cooking, basting steaks constantly, for an additional two minutes, being careful not to overcook. When cooked, season with black pepper and allow the steaks to rest for 5 to 8 minutes before slicing.']

recipe_description: This classic cocktail gets the luxury treatment with Suntory Toki Whiskey, it’s sure to be the cherry on top of a fantastic Father’s Day!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 oz. Suntory Toki Whiskey', '1 oz. Lemon Juice', '1/2 oz. Simple Syrup', '1 Cocktail Cherry', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['Add ice to a rocks glass. Pour in whiskey, lemon juice, and simple syrup; stir until well blended and chilled.', 'Garnish with the cocktail cherry before serving.']

recipe_description: Redemption Rye Whiskey blends perfectly with bitters and Absinthe for a cocktail that brings the Big Easy straight to your backyard. Let the good times roll this Father’s Day with this delicious cocktail!
recipe_ingredients: ['3 oz. Redemption Rye Whiskey', "Peychaud's Bitters", '3 drops Absinthe or Herbsaint', 'Lemon Twist', '1 Sugar Cube']
recipe_instructions: ['Fill an old-fashioned glass with ice and allow to chill. In a mixing glass, lash sugar cube with bitters until completely saturated; muddle to crush the sugar cube. Add rye whiskey and stir to blend.', 'Discard ice from glass. Add Absinthe or Herbsaint to glass and swirl to coat; discard remaining liquid. Pour in whiskey mixture and garnish with lemon to finish.']

recipe_description: The quintessential whiskey cocktail, this Old Fashioned is the true test of a good bartender. Impress dad this Father’s Day by giving him a truly high class experience!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 oz. Basil Hayden Bourbon Whiskey', '1 Sugar Cube', '2 dashes Angostura Bitters', 'Orange Peel, for garnish']
recipe_instructions: ['Place the sugar cube in the bottom of a rocks glass and lash with 2 dashes of bitters. Mix with one bar spoon of water and muddle until sugar is completely dissolved. Add bourbon and stir.', 'To finish, add one large ice cube. Allow to sit for half a minute to dilute slightly, then add orange peel and serve.']

recipe_description: This trifle has everything: fresh blueberries, tart lemon curd, and fluffy whipped cream. It’s so good, it’s guaranteed to be the crown jewel of any summer party!
recipe_ingredients: ['3 c. Fresh Blueberries', '1 (8-10 oz) Angel Food Cake, cut into 1 inch cubes', '3 c. Whipped Cream, stiffly beaten', 'Lemon Curd', '3 Lemons', '1 1/2 c. Sugar', '1/4 lb. Unsalted Butter, at room temperature', '4 extra large Eggs', '1/2 c. Lemon Juice', '1/8 tsp. Salt']
recipe_instructions: ['To make the lemon curd, zest the lemons being careful to avoid the white pith; combine zest with the sugar and cream together with the butter. Add eggs individually, then add lemon juice and salt, mixing until combined. Transfer mixture to a saucepan and cook over low heat until thickened, stirring constantly. Do not allow to boil. Remove from heat and chill completely before using.', 'To assemble the trifle, set aside 1/4 c. blueberries for garnish. In a large trifle dish, arrange a layer of cake pieces followed by 1 cup of lemon curd and one cup of blueberries. Repeat for 2 more layers, then top with whipped cream; refrigerate for 2 hours. Before serving, top with remaining blueberries.']

recipe_description: These bars make a great summertime snack! Serve them at a party, a picnic, or a barbecue, they’re sure to be a hit no matter what!
recipe_overview: ['Serves: about 1 dozen', 'Prep Time: 20 minutes', 'Cook Time: 45 minutes']
recipe_ingredients: ['2 1/2 c. All-Purpose Flour', '2/3 c. Sugar', '1/2 tsp. Salt', '1 c. +2 tbsp. Unsalted Butter, cut into small cubes and thoroughly chilled', '1/4 c. Light Brown Sugar, packed', '1/2 c. Old-Fashioned Rolled Oats', '1/2 c. Pecans, finely chopped', '3/4 c. Raspberry Preserves', '3/4 c. fresh Raspberries', '1 tbsp. Lemon Juice']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line a 9x13 baking dish with aluminum foil so that the foil hangs over the sides of the dish. Thoroughly grease foil and exposed dish, then set aside.', 'Mix flour, sugar, and salt; cut in 1 cup of butter until the mixture is the texture of damp sand. Reserve 1 1/4 cups of mixture, and spread remaining mixture evenly over bottom of baking dish; firmly press into an even layer to form the bottom crust. Bake for 14-18 minutes or until edges begin to brown.', 'While crust bakes, add brown sugar, oats, and pecans to reserved flour mixture, tossing to combine; add 2 tbsp. butter, working in by hand. Combine preserves, raspberries, and lemon juice, mashing berries roughly with a fork. Spread the filling over the hot crust and toss with streusel. Bake an additional 22-25 minutes or until the streusel is golden and the filling is bubbling. Lift from the pan by the edges of foil, and allow to cool completely on a wire rack before cutting into squares.']

recipe_description: If you’ve never heard of an icebox cake before, you’re in a for a real treat! These creamy and delicious “cakes” require no baking and set up overnight, meaning you get to do less cooking and more enjoying!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 c. each Blueberries, Raspberries, Blackberries, & Strawberries (sliced)', '1 lb. Mascarpone Cheese', '1 c. Sour Cream', '2 c. Heavy Cream', '1/2 c. Powdered Sugar', '2 packages Italian Ladyfingers (+1/2 package for decoration, if desired)', 'Soaking Syrup', '1 1/2 pints fresh Strawberries', '1 tbsp. Sugar', '1 oz. Strawberry Liqueur or Eau de Vie']
recipe_instructions: ['To make the soaking syrup, puree the 1 1/2 pints of strawberries until blended. Strain the seeds, then mix with sugar and strawberry liqueur. Set aside until needed.', 'In a medium bowl, stir together mascarpone and sour cream; in a separate large bowl, whip together the heavy cream and powdered sugar until stiff peaks form. Slowly beat in the mascarpone mixture, then whip until stiff peaks form again. Fold in 1/2 cup each of the blueberries, raspberries blackberries and strawberries.', 'To assemble the cake, briefly soak the ladyfingers in the syrup, about 30 seconds. In a 10 inch springform pan, layer first the ladyfingers, then half the cream. Top with a 1/4 cup each of the remaining blueberries, raspberries, blackberries, and strawberries. Repeat for a second layer, smoothing out the cream before topping with berries. Cover and refrigerate overnight; unmold before serving. If desired, decorate sides with additional ladyfingers for a more polished look.']

recipe_description: A clafoutis is a traditional French dessert that’s surprisingly simple to make, given how elegant it looks. With a texture like rich custard and the inclucion of sweet-tart cherries, this dessert is sure to impress.
recipe_ingredients: ['2 c. Fresh Cherries, pitted & halved', '2 tbsp. Slivered Almonds', '3 Eggs', '3/4 c. Sugar', '1 tbsp. Brown Sugar, packed', '1/8 tsp. Salt', '1 c. Milk', '3/4 tsp. Almond Extract', '1 1/2 tsp. Vanilla Extract', 'Powdered Sugar, for dusting']
recipe_instructions: ['Thoroughly grease and flour a 9x9 baking dish, and preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place slivered almonds and cherries in bottom of dish and set aside.', 'In a large mixing bowl whisk together all ingredients until smooth and airy. Pour batter over almonds and cherries, then bake for 35-45 minutes; if the clafoutis browns too quickly, cover it with a loose tent of aluminum foil and continue baking.', 'Remove from oven when a sharp knife inserted in the center comes out clean. The clafoutis may not be set entirely and will have expanded - it will settle as it cools. Cool on a wire rack, then dust with powdered sugar to finish.']

recipe_description: Let those strawberries shine in this recipe for Fresh Strawberry Ice Cream! Even better? This recipe doesn’t require an ice cream maker!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 lb. fresh strawberries, hulled and pureed', '8 oz. fresh strawberries, hulled and chopped', '14 oz. sweetened condensed milk', '2 cups heavy whipping cream', '1/8 teaspoon Kosher salt']
recipe_instructions: ['In the large bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, whip the cream until stiff peaks form.', 'Carefully fold in the condensed milk, salt, pureed strawberries and chopped strawberries.', 'Transfer mixture to a freezer-safe container and freeze for 4 hours or until hard - if you can wait that long!']

recipe_description: The perfect end to a fantastic barbecue, make it while camping or at home for a delicious treat that’s to please anyone!
recipe_ingredients: ['6 fresh or canned Peaches, peeled & sliced', '2 tbsp. All-Purpose Flour', '1/2 c. Granulated Sugar', '1 tsp. Cinnamon', '1/8 tsp. Cloves', '1/8 tsp. Nutmeg', '2 tbsp. Butter', '1/4 tsp. Salt', 'Topping', '1 c. All-Purpose Flour', '1/4 c. Sugar', '1 1/2 tsp. Baking Powder', '1/2 c. Heavy Cream', '1/4 c. Butter, melted']
recipe_instructions: ['Heat grill to medium-high. In a large bowl, combine peaches, 2 tbsp. of flour, sugar, cinnamon, cloves, nutmeg, and salt. Place in a cast iron skillet and top with chunks of butter; cover tightly with aluminum foil, then close grill lid and cook on heated side of grill for 15 minutes.', 'Combine all topping ingredients until just combined, being careful not to overmix. Open grill and remove foil. Dollop on biscuit mix and continue cooking for about 15 minutes with grill lid closed. Allow to stand about 10 minutes before serving.']

recipe_description: Lighter than a standard potato salad, this dish is perfect for your next summer BBQ!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 lbs. Red Potatoes, cut into large cubes', '1 lb. Bacon, diced', '2 Shallots, finely diced', '2 cloves Garlic', '1/2 c. Parsley, finely chopped', '1/4 c. Olive Oil', '1/4 c. Apple Cider Vinegar', '2 tbsp. Honey', '1 tbsp. Brown Mustard', '1 tsp. Black Pepper', 'Salt, to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add potatoes and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.', 'At the same time, cook bacon until crispy; remove from pan, leaving 1/4 of grease behind. Cook shallots and garlic in bacon grease until shallots are translucent and garlic is fragrant. Whisk in olive oil, apple cider vinegar, honey, mustard, and black pepper; cook until warmed through and emulsified.', 'Drain potatoes and place in a large bowl. Toss with bacon and parsley, then coat with dressing. Season with salt as needed, and serve warm or at room temperature.']

recipe_description: Spicy and delicious, this homemade horseradish sauce comes from one of our very own Oliver’s employees!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 large Fresh Horseradish Root', '3/4 c. White Vinegar', '2 tsp. White Sugar', '1/4 tsp. Salt']
recipe_instructions: ['Peel and cube 1 cup of fresh horseradish and place in a blender or food processor. Then add the white vinegar, white sugar, and salt. Blend until it forms a paste.', 'Cover the horseradish sauce, and store it in the fridge to chill. It is best paired with prime rib or a pot roast.']

recipe_description: This week we’ve paired our best-selling housemade burger patty, the OMG burger, with locally made Valley Ford Grazin’ Girl Blue – and let me tell you, YUM! For true burger nivana, pair your creation with Deschutes Brewery Obsidian Stout. The robust, roasty beer has just enough hoppy bite to cut the richness in this epic dish.
recipe_ingredients: ["2- or 4-pack of O.M.G. Burger Patties from the Oliver's Meat Department", "4oz. Valley Ford Grazin' Girl Blue", '4 hamburger, brioche or ciabatta buns', 'Sliced tomato, onion and lettice for serving', 'Mayonnaise']
recipe_instructions: ['Grab a cast iron skillet, or other heavy bottomed skillet, and heat over medium-high.', 'Remove the OMG Burger Patties from the packaging. Using your hands, press and flatten out each patty until they are slightly larger than your burger buns (they will shrink slightly when cooked). Using your thumb make a slight indentation in the center of the patty to help keep it flat while it cooks.', "When your pan is very hot, but not smoking, add the burger patties, being careful to not overcrowd the pan. Once the burgers are in the pan set a timer for 5 minutes and don't touch the burgers. When the timer goes off, flip all burgers and set another timer for 4 minutes. During this 4 minutes top each burger with 1 (or more!) ounces of blue cheese and let warm up while the patty continues to cook. Toast your buns while the burgers are cooking. Once the timer goes off remove the burgers from heat and let stand for a few minutes while you finish get the buns ready.", 'Dress each burger bun with mayonnaise, if desired then top with the burger, onion, lettuce and tomato. Devour immediately and enjoy with a cold Deschutes Obsidian Stout!']

recipe_description: These individual breakfasts are easy to make and feel fancy without all the effort.
recipe_ingredients: ['4 Eggs', '4 c. Baby Spinach', '3 cloves Garlic, chopped', '1 Tomato, sliced into at least 4 thick slices', '8 Artichoke Hearts, cut in half', '1 c. Feta Cheese, in small crumbles', '2 tbsp. Olive Oil', 'Salt & Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease four (10 oz.) ramekins and set aside.', 'In a medium pan, heat olive oil and ad chopped garlic. When garlic is fragrant, begin adding spinach one handful at a time; continue cooking until spinach is wilted, then season with salt and pepper and allow to cool slightly.', 'To assemble, place one portion of spinach at the bottom of each ramekin, following with 4 artichoke heart halves, then a slice of tomato, then feta. Crack a single egg into each and finish with salt and pepper. Bake 10 to 14 minutes or until egg whites have set but egg yolks are still runny.']

recipe_description: This OG champagne cocktail makes for a delightfully fizzy end to a perfect Mother’s Day.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 Sugar Cube', 'Angostura Bitters', '1 oz. Brandy', 'Champagne or other Sparkling Wine']
recipe_instructions: ['Place sugar cube at the bottom of a champagne glass and lash with bitters until saturated.', 'Add brandy and top with champagne.', 'Allow sugar cube to dissolve before drinking.']

recipe_description: This sangria is perfect for a Mother’s Day brunch!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 bottle Champagne, chilled', '1/4 c. Brandy', '1/4 c. Grand Marnier', '1/4 c. Superfine Sugar', '1 c. Strawberries, halved', '3 Oranges, sliced in rounds', '1 pint Blueberries', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['In a large pitcher, combine brandy, Grand Marnier, and sugar, stirring until sugar is completely dissolved.', 'Add fruit and ice, then top with champagne, stir once to mix. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: These muffins are the perfect after-brunch treat!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 c. All-Purpose Flour', '1/2 c. Light Brown Sugar', '2 tsp. Baking Powder', '1 1/2 tsp. Cinnamon', '1/4 tsp. Baking Soda', '1/4 tsp. Salt', '3/4 c. Milk', '1 1/2 tsp. Vanilla Extract', '1/3 c. Vegetable Oil', '2 large Eggs', 'Topping', '1/3 c. Granulated Sugar', '1/3 c. Light Brown Sugar', '1 tsp. Cinnamon', '1/4 tsp. Salt', '1/2 c. Unsalted Butter, melted', '1 1/2 c. All-Purpose Flour']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line a muffin tin with cups or spray thoroughly with baking spray, then set aside. For the topping, whisk together sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, salt, and flour. Add melted butter, then stir until combined.
