Using a fork break apart into crumbles.', 'In a separate bowl, sift together flour, brown sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, baking powder, and salt; in another bowl, whisk together milk, eggs, oil, and vanilla. Slowly add wet ingredients to dry, stirring to combine. Scoop batter into muffin tin, then sprinkle with topping.', 'Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until a sharp knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Allow muffins to cool for about 10 minutes in the pan, then transfer to a wire rack to finish cooling completely.']

recipe_description: Who doesn’t love a cocktail for breakfast?! Say “thanks” to your mom this Mother’s Day the best way we know how!
recipe_ingredients: ['3 c. Tomato Juice', '1/4 c. Lemon Juice', '1 tbsp. Prepared Horseradish', '1 1/2 tbsp. Worcestershire Sauce', '1/4 tsp. Garlic Powder', '3/4 tsp. Hot Sauce', '3/4 tsp. Celery Salt', '1/2 tsp. Black Pepper', '1/3 c. Pickle Juice', '1/2 c. Vodka', 'Toppings', 'Cornichon Pickles', 'Bacon Strips, cooked', 'Cherry Tomatoes', 'Baked Shrimp (requires salt & olive oil)', 'Celery', 'Green Olives']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine all cocktail ingredients in a large, nonreactive pitcher and stir until thoroughly combined; alternatively, combine in a blender and blend until smooth, then transfer to a pitcher.', 'To serve, fill highball glasses with ice and top with Bloody Mary mixture. Garnish with a skewered cornichon, cherry tomato, and olive; a strip of bacon; a piece of celery; and a baked shrimp.', 'To make the baked shrimp, toss 1 lb. of peeled and deveined raw shrimp with 2 tbsp. of olive oil, 1/4 tsp. salt, and 1/4 tsp. black pepper. Arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet, then bake at for 400 degrees for 5 to 10 minutes or until shrimp are pink and firm. Allow to cool completely before serving.']

recipe_description: Spread the love this Cinco de Mayo by making margaritas for a crowd! This recipe for margaritas in a pitcher is party perfect.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 cups tequila', '1 cup lime juice', '1/2 cup Triple Sec', '1/2 cup simple syrup', 'Ice', 'Salt for rimming the glasses', 'Lime wheels for garnish']
recipe_instructions: ['Add ingredients to pitcher and stir.', 'Pour salt on to a small plate. Wet the rim of the glass with water, then dip in salt.', 'Add ice to the glasses and fill with Margarita.', 'Garnish with a lime wheel and enjoy!']

recipe_description: Also known as “pastel de elote”, this rich corn cake makes a great addition to a Cinco de Mayo feast.
recipe_ingredients: ['8 ears Sweet White Corn, husks removed', '1 3/4 c. Butter, softened', '5 Eggs', '1 (14 oz.) can Sweetened, Condensed Milk', '1/2 c. Whole Milk', '2 c. All-Purpose Flour', '1 tbsp. Baking Powder', '1 tsp. Cinnamon', '1/4 tsp. Salt']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Thoroughly grease and flour a 9" cake pan, then set in freezer until needed.', 'Using a sharp knife, carefully slice kernels from corn cob. Transfer to a blender and puree with eggs, condensed milk, and whole milk until smooth. In a bowl, beat softened butter until whipped and creamy; pour in corn mixture and beat until combined.', 'Sift flour, cinnamon, and salt together in a large bowl, then slowly mix into wet ingredients. Pour batter into a greased pan and bake for about 45 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for about 15 minutes in the pan before transferring to a wire rack to finish cooling.']

recipe_description: This classic Mexican dish is great for a party, or freeze them for quick, easy lunches.
recipe_ingredients: ['4 c. Masa Harina', '1 1/3 c. Lard', '24 Corn Husks, soaked in water', '1/2 tsp. Salt', 'Filling', '1 (3 lb.) Boneless Pork Shoulder Roast', '1 Onion, quartered', '2 tsp. Thyme', '2 tsp. Oregano', '2 Bay Leaves', '12 Black Peppercorns', '2 tsp. Cumin', '1/3 c. Chili Powder', '2 cloves Garlic', '2 tbsp. Flour', '2 tbsp. Sugar', '1 tbsp. Vegetable Oil']
recipe_instructions: ['Season pork shoulder generously with salt and black pepper, then in a heavy-bottomed pot, sear until deeply browned on all sides. Add about 6 cups of water and onion, thyme, bay leaves, and peppercorns; cover and cook for about 2 hours or until pork is tender and shreds easily.', 'Shred pork, strain and reserve cooking liquid; combine one cup cooking liquid, pork, chili powder, garlic, flour, sugar, and vegetable oil in a large skillet. Continue cooking until liquid has almost cooked off, about 25 minutes.', 'To make the dough, combine masa harina, lard, salt, and 2 2/3 cup of the reserved cooking liquid until combined. Drain corn husks and pat dry. Start about 1/2 inch from wide end and spread about 3 tbsp. of dough down husk, leaving a 1 inch border around the edges. Spoon about 2 tbsp. of pork filling down center of dough, then fold in sides to wrap dough around filling and fold up narrow end. Repeat until dough and filling are gone.', 'Steam until dough is firm, about 45 or 50 minutes.']

recipe_description: A fresh and delicious salad, this makes a perfect side dish for any summer party.
recipe_ingredients: ['5 ears of Corn, boiled or grilled', '1/2 Avocado, diced', '1/2 Red Onion, finely chopped', '1 c. Cotija Cheese', '6 Green Onions, thinly sliced', 'Dressing', '1/3 c. Sour Cream', '1/4 c. Mayonnaise', '1/2 c. Lime Juice', '1 tsp. Cumin', '1 tsp. Chili Powder (plus extra for garnish)', '1 tsp. Garlic Powder', '1/2 tsp. Salt']
recipe_instructions: ['Whisk together ingredients for dressing and set aside until needed.', 'Using a sharp knife, slice corn kernels from cob and place in a large bowl. Fold together corn, avocado, cilantro, and green onions, then cover in dressing and toss. Fold in cotija and sprinkle with chili powder to finish.']

recipe_description: They’re the thick and delicious cousins of the tortillas, and topped with shredded chicken, they’re perfect for a Cinco de Mayo dinner!
recipe_ingredients: ['Chicken', '1 1/2 lbs. Boneless, Skinless Chicken Thighs', '2 Jalapenos, chopped & seeds/ribs removed', '1 (28 oz.) can Diced Tomatoes', '1 Onion, chopped', '6 cloves Garlic, chopped', '1 Carrot, finely chopped', '1 Bay Leaf', '1/2 tsp. Oregano', '2 c. Chicken Stock', 'Sopes', '1 1/2 c. Masa', '1 1/4 c. Water', '1/4 tsp. Salt', '4 tbsp. Vegetable Oil or Lard']
recipe_instructions: ['In a large pot, sear chicken thighs until browned. Add jalapenos, tomatoes, onion, garlic, carrot, stock, and herbs; cover and stew for about 2 hours or until chicken shreds easily with a fork.', 'To make the sopes, mix masa, salt, and water until uniform, being careful not to add too much water. Separate into 10 equal-sized balls and press until flattened but not overly thin. Pinch edges to create a well in the center. Heat oil or lard on a griddle, then cook sopes on both sides until golden.', 'Serve topped with chicken, refried beans, avocado, salsa, crema, and cheese. You can also add pickled jalapenos and carrots or thinly sliced radishes.']

recipe_description: This pork tenderloin is a cinch to make and just as delicious.
recipe_ingredients: ["1 Oliver's Own Natural Boneless Pork Tenderloin", '1/4 c. Dijon Mustard', '3 tbsp. Herbs de Provence', '1/2 tsp. Salt', '1/2 tsp. Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Pat down tenderloin with paper towels to remove excess moisture, then season with salt and pepper. Coat in dijon mustard, then press on herb de provence until entire tenderloin is covered.', 'Bake uncovered 15 to 20 minutes, flipping the tenderloin halfway through, or until a thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the tenderloin register 150 degrees.']

recipe_description: These crispy, crusty pork chops get a punch of flavor from parmesan cheese.
recipe_ingredients: ["4 Oliver's Natural Boneless Pork Chops", '1 c. Parmesan Cheese, grated', '1 1/2 c. Panko Bread Crumbs', '1 tsp. Rosemary', '1 tsp. Parsley', '1 tsp. Basil', '1/2 tsp. Oregano', '1/2 tsp. Salt', '1/2 tsp. Black Pepper', '1/4 tsp. Paprika', '1 c. Flour', '3 Eggs, beaten with 1 tbsp. Water', '2 tbsp. Canola Oil']
recipe_instructions: ['On a plate, combine herbs, salt, and pepper with flour; on a separate plate, mix panko bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese. Set up a breading station - start with flour, followed by egg wash, followed by panko-parmesan mixture. Coat pork chops first in flour, then in egg, then in panko; for a thicker crust, dip again in egg then again in panko.', 'Heat oil in a large pan. Sear pork chops on each side until the crust is crisp and golden, the center of the chop is firm, and the juices run clear.']

recipe_description: Pile it high in a sandwich or eat it by itself – no matter what, this pulled pork is bound to be a hit!
recipe_ingredients: ["1 (3-4 lb.) Oliver's Natural Bone-In Pork Shoulder Roast", '1 (12 oz.) can Coca Cola', '2 c. Ketchup', '1/4 c. Apple Cider Vinegar', '1/4 c. Brown Sugar, packed', '2 tbsp. Smoked Paprika', '1 tbsp. Garlic Powder', '1 tbsp. Onion Powder', '1 tbsp. Mustard Powder', '1 tsp. Cayenne Pepper', 'Salt & Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Pat down shoulder roast with paper towels to remove excess moisture, then season liberally with salt and pepper. Sear on all sides until deeply browned.', 'In a bowl, combine ketchup, vinegar, brown sugar, smoked paprika, garlic, onion, mustard powder, and cayenne. Place shoulder roast in a dutch oven and pour in sauce and Coca Cola; bake for 6 hours or until pork shreds easily.']

recipe_description: Sweet and savory, these pork chops make a great dinner any day of the week!
recipe_ingredients: ["2 Oliver's Natural Bone-In Pork Chops", '1 tsp. Cumin', '1 tsp. Coriander', '1 tsp. Salt', '1/2 tsp, Ginger', '1/2 tsp. Turmeric', '1/4 Cayenne Pepper', 'Mango Chutney', 'Flesh from 2 ripe Mangos, finely diced', '1/3 c. Golden Raisins', '1 Shallot, minced', '1 clove Garlic', '1/4 tsp. Red Pepper Flakes', '1/4 c. Vinegar', '2 tbsp. Sugar']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine all chutney ingredients in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes, or until mango has broken down and chutney has thickened.', 'In a small bowl, stir together cumin, coriander, salt, ginger, turmeric, and cayenne. Pat down pork chops to remove excess moisture, then down with spice mixture. Sear on high for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until center is firm and juices run clear. Serve topped with chutney.']

recipe_description: Bone broth is well known for being healthy, but by using leftover bones, it can be sustainable as well!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 lbs. Assorted Bones', '1 Onion, sliced in half with skin left on', '1 whole head Garlic, cut in half']
recipe_instructions: ['To preserve bones, freeze until needed, then thaw before preparing broth.', 'Place all ingredients in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and cook for 6 to 8 hours. For a slow-cooker version, cook covered on low for 24 hours.', 'Strain finished broth to remove solids. This broth will keep in the fridge for up to a week or in the freezer for up to a year.']

recipe_description: Don’t toss your apple peelings – make them into all-purpose vinegar instead!
recipe_ingredients: ['Peels & Cores from 6-8 Apples', '1 tbsp. Sugar', 'Dechlorinated Water']
recipe_instructions: ['Place apple scraps and sugar in a large, wide-mouth glass or ceramic jar and cover with a piece of cheese cloth secured with a rubberband.', 'Stir several times daily, watching for bubbles indicating the start of fermentation. Allow the vinegar to continue fermenting until bubbles are no longer present, indicating that fermentation has ceased.', 'When vinegar is no longer actively fermenting, remove the apple scraps and compost. Store vinegar in sterilized jars; as a precaution against explosions, "burp" jars regularly, about once a month. This releases any gasses that may have built up over time. The vinegar will continue to concentrate over time and should keep for up to a year.']

recipe_description: Eco-friendly and delicious, this easy veggie stock is a great way to use your veggie scraps!
recipe_ingredients: ["1 Week's Worth of Vegetable Scraps (i.e. dried-out garlic cloves, onion ends, tomato cores, mushroom ends, parsley stems, etc.)", '2 Bay Leaves', '6 Black Peppercorns', '3 stalks Fresh Thyme']
recipe_instructions: ['To preserve veggie scraps, freeze until needed, then thaw before preparing stock.', 'Place all ingredients in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and cook for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Strain broth through a fine mesh sieve to remove remaining solids.']

recipe_description: This Southern classic is a great, eco-friendly side for summer!
recipe_ingredients: ['Rind of 1/2 large Watermelon, with one inch of red flesh remaining', '4 c. White Vinegar', '2 c. Water', '2 c. Sugar', '1/3 c. Salt', '3 Cinnamon Sticks', '4 Whole Cloves', '1 tsp. Red Pepper Flakes']
recipe_instructions: ['Peel the skin from the rind with a vegetable peeler and cut into 1 inch pieces.', 'In a large pot, combine all other ingredients and bring to a boil; add the rinds and reduce the heat. Summer uncovered for 10 to 15 minutes or until tender.', 'Carefully ladle rinds and brine into one or two sterilized 1 pint jars, leaving about a half inch of headspace at the top. Place in a canner filled with simmering water, ensuring the jars are completely submerged, then bring to boil; continue for 10 minutes. Remove jars and cool.', 'For refrigerator pickles, allow to cool completely before refrigerating. Pickles will keep for about 30 days - note, this version is NOT shelf stable.']

recipe_ingredients: ['Flour, to dust your work surface', '1 sheet frozen puff pastry, thawed', '2 cups Gruyere or Swiss cheese, shredded', '1½ pounds asparagus, with 1 inch trimmed from bottoms', '1 tablespoon olive oil', 'Grated parmesean cheese', 'Salt and pepper to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 400 degrees.', 'On a floured surface, roll the puff pastry into a 16-by-10 inch rectangle. Trim edges if needed. Place pastry on a baking sheet. With a sharp knife, lightly score pastry dough 1 inch in from edges to make a rectangle. Using a fork, pierce dough inside the markings at ½-inch intervals. Bake until just golden, about 12-15 minutes.', 'Remove pastry shell from oven, and sprinkle with Gruyere or Swiss.', 'Arrange asparagus in a single layer over cheese, alternating ends and tips.', 'Brush with oil, season with salt and pepper, and top with parmesan. Bake until spears are just tender, yet crisp, about 8-12 minutes.']

recipe_description: Make this bread pudding ahead of time for an easy Easter breakfast or brunch!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 medium loaf day-old French Bread, cut into 1 inch cubes', '4 Shallots, finely chopped', '4 cloves Garlic, chopped', '10 Eggs', '2 c. Whole Milk', '2 c. Heavy Cream', '2 c. Cooked Ham, chopped', '1 1/2 c. Sharp Cheddar Cheese', '1 tbsp. Thyme', '1/4 tsp. Nutmeg', '1/2 tsp. Salt', '1/2 tsp. Black Pepper', '2 tbsp. Olive OIl']
recipe_instructions: ['Generously grease a 9"x13" baking dish and set aside. Heat olive oil in a small pan; saute garlic and shallots until softened and shallots have become translucent, then set aside to cool.', 'Whisk together milk, cream, eggs, thyme, nutmeg, salt, pepper. Place bread cubes in the greased baking dish and pour custard mixture over; mix in ham, shallots, garlic, and 1 cup of cheddar cheese until evenly distributed. Cover and allow the custard to soak into the bread overnight, or for at least one hour.', 'When ready to bake, preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Top the bread pudding with the remaining cheese, then bake uncovered for one hour or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Serve warm.']

recipe_description: Traditional egg salad gets a kick from paprika and hot sauce in this twist on two classics.
recipe_ingredients: ['12 Eggs, hard-boiled & peeled', '1/3 c. Mayonnaise', '2 tbsp. Dijon Mustard', '2 tbsp. Lemon Juice', '1 tbsp. Hot Sauce (more or less to taste)', '2 tbsp. Chives, finely chopped', '1/4 tsp. Paprika', 'Salt & Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Chop eggs in half and scoop out yolks into a large bowl; chop whites and set aside.', 'Combine egg yolks, mayonnaise, mustard, lemon juice, hot sauce, paprika, and chives. Fold in chopped egg whites, then season with salt and pepper to taste. This is best served with pumpernickel or rye toasts.']

recipe_description: A fresh take on an old classic created by our Windsor Wine Department Manager, Thomas Wall!
recipe_ingredients: ['1.5 oz. Suntory Toki Whiskey', '6 oz. Soda Water', "1-2 dashes King Floyd's Cardamom Bitters (optional)", '1 Lemon Wedge', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['Take a chilled Highball glass, and fill it with ice. Pour in whiskey and add bitters, if using. Stir with a spoon to combine.', 'Add soda water and stir again. Garnish with lemon wedge - you can also squeeze in the juice from the lemon for a spark of citrus.']

recipe_description: Delicious and easy to make, this corned beef will be the star of any St. Patrick’s Day Feast!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 (12 lb.) Beef Brisket', '1/3 c. Coriander Seeds', '1/3 c. Fennel Seeds', '1/3 c. Peppercorns', '1/3 c. Star Anise', '2 c. Brown Sugar, packed', '1 c. Kosher Salt', '4 Bay Leaves', '1 Gallon of Water', 'A food-grade plastic bucket OR stainless steel hotel pan']
recipe_instructions: ['In a large pot, toast the spices until they’re fragrant and very lightly browned; you’ll want to keep the heat low and turn everything at least once. Then remove the spices from the pot to use later; instead, fill the pot with water and add the bay leaves, brown sugar, and salt. Heat until the water is just boiling and the salt and sugar have dissolved completely, return the spices to the pot, then remove from the heat and allow the solution to cool.', 'Once it’s cooled, place the beef brisket in the bucket or hotel pan and pour in the brine; you’ll need to make sure the entire brisket is submerged. Cover the pan or bucket tightly with plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator for at least a week, flipping the brisket daily to insure even brining. When the brisket is ready, remove it from the brine and rinse it before cooking. This will remove extra salt and help bring out the more subtle flavors from the brining solution.', 'To cook your homemade corned beef, simply place the entire brisket in a pot, cover it with water, and boil it for at least 4 hours. In the last hour of cooking, throw in a quartered head of cabbage, 4 carrots cut into large chunks, and several boiling-size potatoes cut in halves or in quarters for a stress-free St. Patrick’s Day meal. Alternatively, sear your brisket on both sides and place in a roasting pan on a rack; throw your cabbage, potatoes, and carrots underneath, and roast the whole thing at 275 degrees F for 6 hours. It’s a little slower, but the sumptuous flavor of slow-roasted meat is absolutely worth it.']

recipe_name: Asparagus and Artichoke Pasta Salad with Pine Nuts and Arugula
recipe_description: This salad is like spring in a bowl, with tender greens and fresh asparagus, it’s the perfect side dish or vegetarian lunch.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 lb. Orzo Pasta, cooked', '1 dozen Asparagus', '2 c. Arugula, washed & dried', '5 Artichoke Hearts, quartered', '1 c. Pine Nuts', '1/4 c. Olive Oil', '1/2 tsp. Lemon Juice', '1 tsp. Honey', '1 tsp. Dijon Mustard', 'Salt & Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['In a small frying pan, toast pine nuts on medium-low heat, tossing frequently until they are golden, about 5 minutes. Remove them from the heat and set them aside to cool. Fill a wide-mouthed pot with water and heat to boiling; add two generous pinches of salt. Submerge asparagus completely and boil until tender, about 3 to 4 minutes. Remove and immediately submerge in an ice bath to stop cooking.', 'Slice asparagus on the bias into bite-sized pieces. In a small bowl, whisk together lemon zest, lemon juice, honey, dijon, and olive oil. Add salt and pepper to taste. Combine orzo, pine nuts, artichoke hearts, arugula, and asparagus; dress with lemon vinaigrette and toss.', 'Allow salad 15 to 20 minutes in the fridge before serving for the best flavor.']

recipe_description: These crispy, crunchy asparagus fries are delicious and healthy! Stop by Oliver’s and “stalk” up on asparagus today!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 dozen Fresh Asparagus, woody ends removed', '1 c. Grated Parmesan', '2 c. Panko Bread Crumbs', '2 Eggs, beaten w/ 1 tbsp. Water', '1 c. Flour', '1/2 tsp. Black Pepper', '1 tsp. Salt', '2 tsp. Italian Seasoning']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 425 degrees, and spread a piece of parchment paper on a baking sheet. In a flat dish, combine panko and parmesan; in a separate dish, combine salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, and flour.', 'Dredge asparagus first in seasoned flour, then in egg, and finally in the panko-parmesan mixture. If a thicker crust is desired, dredge again in egg followed by panko. Repeat until all asparagus spears are breaded, then arrange in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Bake until golden brown and tender, about 10 to 15 minutes. Serve simply with fresh lemon or with garlic aioli for dipping.']

recipe_description: Stalk up on delicious asparagus! We’ve gathered some delicious recipes so you won’t ever have to settle for soggy asparagus!
recipe_ingredients: ['24 medium asparagus spear', '24 thin slices prosciutto', '1/4 cup grated parmesan', '1/4 cup boiling water']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat 400*F.', 'Place asparagus spears and 1/4 cup boiling water in a large roasting pan. Cover with foil. Steam for 10-15 minutes or until tender.', 'Transfer spears to paper towels and wipe pan dry.', 'On waxed paper, lay out one strip of prosciutto, sprinkle with cheese and place an asparagus spear on one end.', 'Roll prosciutto around spear, slightly overlapping at the end if possible.', 'Repeat with remaining food.', 'Place wrapped spear in the roasting pan and roast 5-10 minutes or until prosciutto begins to brown.']

recipe_description: Get past the spiky tips of artichokes and you’ll find that these leafy veggies are downright delicious. We’ve rounded up some of our favorite artichoke recipes that are out of this world!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 c. mayonnaise', '1-2 tbsp. soy sauce', '2 tsp. fresh ginger, minced (or 1 tsp. dried ginger)', '3 green onions, minced']
recipe_instructions: ['In a bowl, mix mayonnaise, soy sauce, and ginger until well blended.', 'Taste and adjust seasonings if necessary.', 'Add minced green onions and stir well. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: I dip, you dip, we all dip! Try this delicious dip with your next hearty artichoke, and eat your heart out.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup mayonnaise', '3-4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon fresh lemon zest', '3 tablespoons fresh squeezed lemon juice', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['In a bowl, mix mayonnaise, garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, salt and pepper until well blended.', 'Cover and refrigerate for 30-60 minutes.', 'Before serving, taste and adjust seasonings if necessary.']

recipe_name: Kevin West’s Simi Sauvignon Blanc Artichokes
recipe_description: These little flavor bombs are a cinch to make at home, and with globe artichokes on sale at Oliver’s, now’s the perfect time to get creative and cook it up!
recipe_ingredients: ['8 Globe Artichokes', '2 Lemons, halved', 'Large bowl of water', '3 c. Simi Sonoma County Sauvignon Blanc', '1/2 tsp. Sea Salt', '1 tsp. Dried Oregano', '1/8 tsp. Dried Thyme', '1 Bay Leaf, torn in half', '1 tsp. Black Pepper', '1/8 tsp. Red Pepper Flakes', '2 (2 in.) strips Lemon Zest', '2 Garlic Cloves, lightly crushed', '4 fresh Thyme Sprigs', '2 fresh Parsley Sprigs', '2 fresh Rosemary Sprigs', '4 tbsp. Extra Virgin Olive Oil']
recipe_instructions: ['Squeeze 3 lemon halves into water and mix; reserve the 4th lemon half. Trim artichokes and place into lemon bath to prevent browning. When all artichokes are trimmed, place in a small pot and add white wine, dried oregano, dried thyme, reserved lemon, bay leaf, salt, and black pepper. Cover and bring to a boil; reduce heat to simmer and cook until artichokes are tender, about 10 minutes.', 'Remove artichokes from the pan using a slotted spoon and slice into quarters. Divide the remaining ingredients between to pint sized, resealable jars and pack with cooled artichoke pieces. Ladle in cooking liquid, leaving about 1/2 inch of space at the top of each jar. Seal and store in the fridge for up to one month.']

recipe_description: Get past the spiky tips of artichokes and you’ll find that these leafy veggies are downright delicious. We’ve rounded up some of our favorite artichoke recipes that are out of this world!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 egg yolk', '1/2 tsp. fine salt', '1/2 tsp. dry mustard', '2 tsp. fresh squeezed lemon juice', '1 tbsp. white wine vinegar', '1 c. olive oil (for milder flavor, use avocado or canola)']
recipe_instructions: ['In a bowl, whisk together the egg yolk, salt, mustard, lemon juice, and vinegar until blended, about 30 seconds.', 'Start whisking briskly, and very slowly pour in 1/4 c. of the oil (a few drops at a time) until the oil is incorporated.', 'When the mayonnaise emulsifies and starts to thicken, you can start to pour in the oil in a thin stream as you continue whisking.', 'Taste and adjust seasonings if necessary.']

recipe_description: This chicken is guaranteed to be tender and moist, and best of all, it takes almost no effort!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 Whole Chicken, entrails removed', '2 tbsp. Olive Oil', '1 tbsp. Garlic Powder', '1 tsp. Oregano', '1 tsp. Rosemary', '1 tsp. Thyme', '1 tsp. Basil', '1 tsp. Parsley', '2 tsp. Salt', '2 tsp. Black Pepper', '3 lemons, quartered', '10 cloves Garlic, smashed', '4 tbsp. Butter, cubed']
recipe_instructions: ['Rinse chicken and pat dry inside and outside with paper towels. Using a large piece of aluminum foil, form a ring that will fit in your slow cooker - this will act as a roasting rack. Place chicken breast side down in cooker on top of foil ring.', 'Combine herbs, salt, pepper, and garlic powder in a small bowl. Rub chicken with olive oil and follow with seasoning mixture, including cavity. Place lemons, garlic cloves, and butter into chicken cavity. Cover with lid and roast 3 to 4 hours on high or until thermometer inserted into thickest point registers 165 degrees.', 'Before serving transfer to baking dish and broil on high 4 to 5 minutes or until skin is crisp and golden.']

recipe_description: Tender and crispy, these carnitas are a cinch to make and even easier to eat.
recipe_overview: ['Serves: 4-6 people', 'Prep Time: 10 minutes', 'Cook Time: 8 hours OR 4-5 Hours']
recipe_ingredients: ['1 (4 lb.) Pork Shoulder, trimmed', '2 tbsp. Chili Powder', '2 tbsp. Cumin', '1 tbsp. Onions Powder', '1 tbsp. Garlic Powder', '1 tsp. Black Pepper', '1 tsp. Salt', '2 Oranges, juiced & bodies reserved', '2 Limes, juiced & bodies reserved', '1 Onion, quarted', '6 cloves Garlic, smashed', '1 tbsp. Canola Oil']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine chili powder, cumin, garlic, powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper in a small bowl; rub spice mixture onto pork until evenly coated. In a large, heavy bottomed pan, heat canola oil until wavy and sear pork shoulder on all sides until evenly browned.', 'Place pork, orange juice, lime juice, orange and lime bodies, and garlic into slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or on high 4 to 5 hours.', 'When pork is fork tender, shred and lay in single layer on baking sheet. Broil on high until crisp, just before serving.']

recipe_description: This recipe uses Country Style Pork Ribs but could very easily be made with Baby Back Ribs or even Beef Brisket.
recipe_ingredients: ['3 lbs. Country Style Ribs', '6 slices Bacon, chopped', '1 c. Ketchup', '1 Yellow Onion, sliced', '6 cloves Garlic, smashed', '1/3 c. Apple Cider Vinegar', '1/4 c. Brown Sugar, packed', '2 tbsp. Smoked Paprika', '1 tbsp. Chili Powder', '1 tbsp. Garlic Powder', '1 tbsp. Onion Powder', '2 tbsp. Mustard Powder', '2 tsp. Salt', '1 tsp. Black Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Pat ribs dry with paper towels to remove excess liquid and set aside. Fry bacon until crispy, remove from pan and drain', 'In a small mixing bowl, whisk together ketchup, vinegar, brown sugar, spices, salt, and pepper. Place ribs in slow cooker with onion, garlic cloves, and bacon, top with sauce and mix until ribs are coated. Cook on low 7 to 9 hours. Before serving, remove ribs from slow cooker, reserving sauce. Broil on high 4 to 5 minutes or until caramelized, flipping once. Puree sauce in a blender until smooth and serve with ribs.']

recipe_description: French food has a reputation for being incredibly delicious and equally complicated – not this beef burgundy! With a slow cooker in your corner, you can turn your kitchen into a fine French bistro tonight!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 lbs. Beef Stew Meat', '1 lb. Crimini Mushrooms, quartered', '4 Carrots, cut in large pieces', '1 lb. Pearl Onions, peeled', '6 slices Bacon, chopped', '6 cloves Garlic, sliced', '1 (750 ml.) bottle Red Wine', '1 c. Beef Broth', '2 Bay Leaves', '4-5 stalks Thyme', '3 tbsp. Tomato Paste', '2 tbsp. Butter', '2 tbsp. Flour']
recipe_instructions: ['In a saute pan on medium heat, cook bacon until crisp; remove from pan, leaving bacon grease behind. Raise heat to medium high and brown stew meat in batches until meat is deeply browned on all sides.', 'Add all ingredients except flour and butter to slow cooker and stir until well combined. Cook on low for 7 hours. In a small bowl, mix flour and butter by hand until they form a cohesive paste; stir paste in beef, turn heat to high, and continue cooking for one hour. Season with salt and black pepper to taste before serving.']

recipe_description: A fresh take on a classic, these tacos are becoming quite the trend right now. And it’s no wonder when they’re as delicious and easy to make as these!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 (3 lb.) Beef Chuck Roast, trimmed', '1/3 c. Soy Sauce', '1/2 Onion, sliced', '8 cloves Garlic, smashed', '1 Jalapeno Pepper, sliced', '1/4 c. Rice Wine', '1 tbsp. Sesame Oil', '2 tbsp. Honey', '3-4 thin slices Fresh Ginger', '1 tsp. Crushed Red Pepper Flakes', '1 tbsp. Canola Oil']
recipe_instructions: ['Pat chuck roast dry with paper towels. In a large, heavy-bottomed pan, heat canola oil until wavy - sear chuck roast on all sides until evenly browned.', 'Place beef, onion, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, jalapeno, rice wine, sesame oil, honey, ginger, and red pepper flakes into slow cooker. Cook on high for 8 hours or on low for 10 hours, then shred beef and mix with sauce before serving.', 'Serve with corn or flour tortillas, shredded red cabbage, and fresh lime.']

recipe_description: Neat, petite, and ready to eat, these salad cups are the perfect healthy lunch!
recipe_ingredients: ['Salad', '2 heads Butter Lettuce, separated into leaves', '2 (12 oz.) can Starkist Solid Albacore Tuna', '1 c. Kalamata Olives, pitted and chopped', '½ lb. Green Beans, blanched and chopped', '4 hard-boiled Eggs, yolks discarded and whites chopped', '1 tbsp. Capers, drained', '1 large Tomato, finely diced', '1 Avocado, sliced', 'Vinaigrette', '1/2 c. Olive Oil', '1/4 c. Red Wine Vinegar', '2 tbsp. Dijon Mustard', '1/4 tsp. Black Pepper', '1/4 tsp. Garlic Powder']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine all vinaigrette ingredients in small bowl and set aside. Drain tuna and flake into a large mixing bowl. Add Kalamata olives, tomato, green beans, capers, shallot, and boiled eggs; fold together gently to combine. Add vinaigrette and fold again until salad is evenly moistened.', 'Lay out butter lettuce leaves individually and place two slices of avocado in each. Top with single scoop of salad mixture.']

recipe_description: Rich and velvety, these mousse cups are the perfect end to a romantic dinner for two. Though a little complex to make, they are well worth the payoff!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 c. Heavy Cream', '4 Large Egg Yolks', '3 tbsp. Sugar', '1/8 tsp. Salt', '1 tsp. Vanilla Extract', '7 oz. Bittersweet Baking Chocolate, chopped']
recipe_instructions: ['Heat 3/4 cup of heavy cream in saucepan until just simmering. In a separate bowl, beat together egg yolks, sugar, and salt; VERY SLOWLY stream in hot cream, whisking vigorously to combine. Return the mixture to the saucepan and cook over medium low heat until the custard begins to thicken or until it register 160 degrees on a thermometer. Strain the custard through a fine mesh sieve to remove any lumps and stir in vanilla.', 'Melt chocolate in a double boiler, stirring constantly to prevent it from scorching. Whisk into warm custard and allow the entire mixture to cool off.', "Beat remaining 1 1/4 cups cream until they form stiff peaks; stir a quarter of this mixture into the custard so it's not quite so heavy. When combined, gently fold in remaining cream. Spoon the mousse into serving cups or ramekins and chill for 6 hours or over night. Allow the mousse to come to room temperature before serving."]

recipe_description: Tart, fresh strawberries combine with decadent dark chocolate to create a taste sensation as delicious as it is classic.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 c. Dark Chocolate, roughly chopped', '3 tbsp. Coconut Oil, solid', '1 dozen Strawberries, washed & dried']
recipe_instructions: ['Melt chocolate and coconut oil together over low heat, stirring constantly. When evenly melted and fully combined, remove the chocolate from the heat and transfer to a bowl.', 'Immediately begin dipping strawberries into the chocolate, swirling each so it is evenly coated. Allow the strawberries to set in the fridge for approximately 15-20 minutes before serving.']

recipe_description: This cake is easy and fast, and it makes a great option for a gluten-free Valentine’s dessert!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 c. Semisweet Baking Chocolate, roughly chopped', '1/2 c. Unsalted Butter', '3/4 c. Granulated Sugar', '2 tsp. Instant Coffee', '1 tsp. Vanilla Extract', '3 Large Eggs', '1/2 c. Unsweetened Cocoa Powder', '1/4 tsp. Salt', "Confectioner's Sugar (for dusting)"]
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly grease and flour an 8" cake pan.', 'Melt chocolate and butter together over low heat, stirring constantly until they are evenly melted and fully combined. Transfer this mixture to a bowl and add the sugar, vanilla, and salt. Mix until combined, then beat in eggs until smooth; add the cocoa powder and stir until just combined.', "Bake for 25 minutes or until top is crisp and center is still slightly jiggly. Allow cake to cool for 5 minutes on wire rack before turning out of pan. Finish with a healthy dusting of confectioner's sugar."]

recipe_name: Stemple Creek Ranch Cast Iron Skillet Ribeye
recipe_description: Where your beef comes from matters. With Stemple Creek Ranch Grass Fed & Grass Finished Beef you will not only enjoy delicious, locally grown beef, but you can be confident that you are being good to your body, and the environment. Try this amazing recipe, courtesy of Stemple Creek Ranch, today!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 inch thick bone-in Stemple Creek ribeye steak (should be about 1 1/2 pounds)', '1 tablespoon garlic powder', '1 tablespoon Kosher salt', '1 tablespoon black pepper', 'Olive Oil']
recipe_instructions: ['Pre-heat your oven to 300 degrees.', 'Drizzle olive oil over both sides of the steak. In a bowl combine the salt, garlic powder, and pepper. Liberally apply the splice mix to both sides of the steak.', 'Coat the bottom of a cast iron skillet with olive oil. Heat the skillet over high heat on the stove. The olive oil should sizzle and almost burn.', 'Make sure your fan is on and carefully place the steak in the skillet. Cook on each side for about 2 minutes. Put the whole skillet into the hot oven. Cook for about 10 minutes. Check the internal temperature of the steak, it should be about 110 degrees.', 'Remove the skillet from the oven and cover the skillet with aluminum foil and let the steak rest for 10 minutes. It should be medium rare, just the way we like it.', 'Cut the steak against the grain. The meat closest to the bone will be the most flavorful.', 'If you like your steak more cooked let the internal temperature rise to 120-130 degrees. We always error on the side of under cooking because you can always cook it a bit more.']

recipe_description: Where your beef comes from matters. With Stemple Creek Ranch Grass Fed & Grass Finished Beef you will not only enjoy delicious, locally grown beef, but you can be confident that you are being good to your body, and the environment. Try this amazing recipe, courtesy of Stemple Creek Ranch, today!
recipe_ingredients: ['4 pounds Stemple Creek Ranch beef or lamb bones (a mixture of marrow & knuckle) with a little meat on them', '2 unpeeled carrots, cut into 3" pieces', '1 leek, topped and cut into thick slices', '1 medium yellow onion, skin removed and quartered', '1 head garlic, halved crosswise', '2 celery stalks, cut into 2" pieces', '2 bay leaves', '2 tablespoons black peppercorns', '2 tablespoons cider vinegar', 'Filtered water']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 400 F. Rinse the bones and pat them dry. Line a large roasting pan with foil. Place bones, carrots, leek, onion, and garlic in pan and roast for about one hour (or until bones are well-browned and fragrant).', 'Spoon the roasted bones, veggies, and roasting juices into a large stock pot and cover with water (about 12 cups). Add celery, bay leaves, peppercorns and vinegar. Add more water if necessary to cover.', 'Cover the pot and bring to a gentle boil. Reduce the heat to a low simmer and cook, with lid slightly ajar, for at least 8 hours but up to 24 hours. The longer the broth is simmered the more flavorful it will be. Add more water to keep bones covered if necessary.', 'Remove the pot from the stove and let cool. Strain broth into a large container using a fine mesh sieve. Discard bones and veggies. Refrigerate overnight.', 'Skim the solidified fat from the top of the chilled broth and discard. The cold broth will be gelatinous, but will liquefy when reheated. Warm & serve plain or with sautéed mushrooms.']

recipe_name: Stemple Creek Ranch Beef-Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
recipe_description: Where your beef comes from matters. With Stemple Creek Ranch Grass Fed & Grass Finished Beef you will not only enjoy delicious, locally grown beef, but you can be confident that you are being good to your body, and the environment. Try this amazing recipe, courtesy of Stemple Creek Ranch, today!
recipe_ingredients: ['4 medium Portobello mushrooms, brushed clean & stems removed', 'Olive Oil', '1 lb. Stemple Creek ground beef', '1 large sweet onion, diced', '2-3 garlic cloves, minced', '2 teaspoons herb seasoning blend', 'Salt & pepper to taste', '3/4 cup favorite chunky tomato pasta sauce', '4 teaspoons prepared pesto sauce + extra for topping', '12 oz. package shredded mozzarella cheese']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 375. Using the edge of a spoon, scrape out the filaments on the inside of the mushroom cap, leaving the shell intact. Brush the outer mushroom shell with olive oil and place on a foil-covered baking sheet. Bake for 15 to 17 minutes on the center rack of the oven. Remove mushrooms from the oven and set aside.', 'Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add diced onion and garlic and sauté until translucent (about 3-4 minutes).', 'Add ground beef and cook evenly. Sprinkle with herb seasoning blend & pepper to taste.', 'When the meat is no longer pink, add the pasta sauce and mix to coat. *If the sauce is too juicy, continue to cook until the excess liquid evaporates.', 'Coat the inner shell of each cooked mushroom with a teaspoon of prepared pesto sauce. Top with 1/3 to 1/2 cup of the beef-tomato mixture. Sprinkle generously with shredded mozzarella cheese.', 'Put stuffed mushrooms back in the oven and bake for an additional 5 minutes until the cheese is melted and ingredients are heated through. Finish with a dollop of pesto if desired.']

recipe_description: We love refried beans! Don’t you? This week, we’re showing you how to make refried beans from scratch, using pinto beans from our bulk department!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 1/2 c. dry pinto beans (about 1lb.)', '3 qts. water', '1/2 c. chopped onion (optional)', '2 tbsp. pork lard, bacon fat, or olive oil (for vegetarian option)', '1/4 c. water', 'Salt, to taste', 'Cheddar Cheese (optional)']
recipe_instructions: ['Rinse beans: Rinse the beans in water and remove any small stones, pieces of dirt, or bad beans.', 'REGULAR METHOD: Cook the beans in water. Put beans into a pot and cover beans with at least 3 inches of water—about 3 quarts for 2 1/2 cups of dry beans. Bring to a boil and then lower heat to simmer, covered, for about 2 1/2 hours. The cooking time will vary depending on the batch of beans you have. The beans are done when they are soft and the skin is just beginning to break open.', 'PRESSURE COOKER METHOD: Put beans into a 4 quart or larger pressure cooker with a 15 lb weight. Fill the pressure cooker with water up to the line that indicates the capacity of the pot (about two-thirds of the way). Cook for 30-35 minutes, until the beans are soft and the skins are barely breaking open.', 'Allow the pressure cooker to cool completely before opening. If there is resistance when attempting to open the cooker, do not open it, allow it to cool further. Follow the directions for your brand of pressure cooker.', 'Strain the beans from the cooking water.', 'Add the onions and lard/fat/oil to a wide, sturdy (not with a flimsy stick-free lining) frying pan on medium-high heat. Cook onions until translucent. (Note the onions are optional, you can skip them if you want.)', 'Add the strained beans and about a 1/4 cup of water to the pan. Using a potato masher, mash the beans in the pan, while you are cooking them, until they are a rough purée.', 'Add more water if necessary to keep the fried beans from getting too dried out. Add salt to taste. Add a few slices of cheddar cheese, or some (1/2 cup) grated cheddar cheese if you want.', 'When beans are heated through (and optional cheese melted) the beans are ready to serve.']

recipe_description: Now is the time to explore the possibilities of the bulk department! Break up with pre-packaged mixes and do it yourself!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 large onion, chopped', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '4 garlic cloves, finely chopped', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 Turkish or 1/2 California bay leaf', '1 sprig fresh thyme', '1 cup red lentils (7 ounces), picked over and rinsed', '3 1/2 cups reduced-sodium chicken broth', '3 cups water', '2 tablespoons chopped flat-leaf parsley', 'Lemon wedges']
recipe_instructions: ['Cook onion in oil with 1/2 teaspoon salt in a medium heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 8 minutes.', 'Add garlic, cumin, bay leaf, and thyme and cook, stirring, 1 minute more. Add lentils, broth, water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper and simmer, partially covered, stirring occasionally, until lentils are very soft and falling apart, about 30 to 45 minutes.', 'Discard bay leaf and thyme sprig, then purée 2 cups of mixture in blender (use caution when blending hot liquids) and return to pan.', 'Stir in parsley and season with salt and a squeeze of lemon.']

recipe_description: Now is the time to explore the possibilities of the bulk department! Break up with pre-packaged mixes and do it yourself!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup quinoa (all red or a mix of red, white or black)', '1 1/2 cups water', '2 cinnamon sticks', '1/4 teaspoon salt', 'ACCOMPANIMENTS', 'Broken or chopped walnuts, pure maple syrup or honey, milk and flaky sea salt such as Maldon']
recipe_instructions: ['Wash quinoa in several changes of water in a bowl, rubbing grains and letting them settle before pouring off water (if quinoa does not settle, drain in a large fine-mesh sieve after each rinse), until water is clear.', 'Drain washed quinoa well in a large fine-mesh sieve.', 'Combine all ingredients in a heavy medium saucepan and bring to a boil, covered. Reduce heat to low and cook, covered, until water is absorbed and quinoa is tender, about 20 minutes.', 'Remove pan from heat and let stand, covered, 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and keep covered to keep warm. Remove cinnamon sticks.', 'Divide quinoa among bowls and top with walnuts, maple syrup or honey, milk, and sea salt.']

recipe_description: Now is the time to explore the possibilities of the bulk department! Break up with pre-packaged mixes and do it yourself!
recipe_ingredients: ['3 cups old fashioned oats', '2 tablespoons cooking oil', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', '2 tablespoons maple syrup', '1/4 cup honey', '1 teaspoon vanilla', '1 teaspoon cinnamon', '1/4 teaspoon nutmeg', '1 1/2 cups add-ins (think raisins, dried cranberries, dried apricots, sunflower seeds, chocolate chips...)', '5 oz. dark chocolate']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 350°F and scatter the oats in a 9 X 13 pan. Let them toast, stirring at least once, for about 15 minutes. When they are done they will look slightly golden and you will smell the toasty oats.', 'Line a 9 X 9 pan with parchment paper or foil. You want a piece large enough that the sides will come back over and cover the top of the bars once you fill the pan.', 'While the oats toast heat the oil in a small saucepan on the stove. Add the brown sugar, maple syrup, honey, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg.', 'Bring it to a simmer over medium high heat. Stir to make sure the brown sugar dissolves, and turn the heat off.', 'Put the toasted oats in a large bowl. Pour the hot liquid over the oats and stir to coat evenly. Stir in all your add-ins. Scrape the mixture into the prepared pan.', 'Fold the parchment or foil over the top of the granola in the pan and PRESS to fill the corners and flatten. Keep pressing and smooth the granola out so that it is even across the pan.', 'Let the granola bars set up in a cool dry place for at least an hour. They will set faster in the freezer. I like to make mine in the evening and let them set up overnight.', 'Turn them out of the pan onto a cutting board. Peel the parchment or foil away. Slice down the middle and then cut each half into 6 bars. Lay the bars on a clean piece of parchment or foil. Melt the chocolate in a small saucepan over low heat. Use a spoon to drizzle the chocolate over the sliced bars. Let it set up and ENJOY!']

recipe_description: Now is the time to explore the possibilities of the bulk department! Break up with pre-packaged mixes and do it yourself!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 pounds raw cashews', '2 pounds raw sprouted almonds', '1 pound raw sunflower seeds (no shell)', '1 pound dry roasted peanuts', '1 pound raisins', '1/2 pound coconut flakes', '1 pound chocolate chips']
recipe_instructions: ['Mix everything together and enjoy in one of our Sonoma County Parks.']

recipe_description: Now is the time to explore the possibilities of the bulk department! Break up with pre-packaged mixes and do it yourself!
recipe_ingredients: ['3 cups (~450 grams) raw nuts (almonds, walnuts, pecans, hazelnuts, sunflower...)', 'OPTIONAL:', 'Sea salt to taste (1/2 teaspoon)', 'Vanilla extract to taste', 'Chocolate']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F and add raw nuts to the baking sheet. Roast raw nuts for 8-12 minutes, or until fragrant and slightly golden brown', 'If roasting hazelnuts, remove from oven once toasted and transfer to a clean dish towel. Rub the hazelnuts against one another using the towel to remove the skins. Removing most of the skins is preferred (not all will come off).', 'Add roasted nuts to a food processor or blender and blend / mix until a creamy butter forms. This can take up to 10-15 or more minutes so be patient! Scrape down sides as needed.', 'Once creamy, add salt (or other add-ins) to taste. Then transfer to a clean jar or container and store in the refrigerator up to 3 weeks (sometimes longer).']

recipe_description: Now is the time to explore the possibilities of the bulk department! Break up with pre-packaged mixes and do it yourself!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup raw almonds', '3 1/2 cups filtered water', '2 to 4 pitted Medjool dates, to taste (or a dash of maple syrup)', '1 whole vanilla bean, chopped (or 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract)', '1/4 teaspoon cinnamon', 'Small pinch fine sea salt']
recipe_instructions: ['Place almonds in a bowl and cover with a couple inches of water. Soak the almonds in water overnight (about 8 to 10 hours). For a quick-soak method, soak the almonds in boiled water for 1 hour. Rinse and drain well.', 'Place drained almonds into a blender along with the filtered water, pitted dates (or maple syrup), and chopped vanilla bean (or vanilla extract).', 'Blend on the highest speed for 1 minute.', 'Place a nut milk bag over a large bowl and slowly pour the almond milk mixture into the bag. Gently squeeze the bottom of the bag to release the milk. This process can take a few minutes so be patient!', 'Rinse out blender and pour the milk back in. Whisk in the cinnamon and sea salt.', 'Using a funnel, pour into a large glass jar and secure lid. Store in the fridge for up to 3 to 4 days. I recommend storing in the coldest spot in the fridge (typically the back) rather than on a door. Shake the jar very well before drinking as the mixture separates when sitting.']

recipe_description: Now is the time to explore the possibilities of the bulk department! Break up with pre-packaged mixes and do it yourself!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup flour', '1/2 cup white sugar', '1/2 cup brown sugar', '1 1/2 cup rolled oats', '1/2 teaspoon baking soda', '1/2 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon cinnamon', 'Optional: 1/2 cup raisins and/or nuts']

recipe_description: Now is the time to explore the possibilities of the bulk department! Break up with pre-packaged mixes and do it yourself!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup flour', '1/4 cup white sugar', '1/2 cup brown sugar', '1/2 teaspoon baking soda', '1/2 teaspoon salt', '3/4 cup chocolate chips']
recipe_instructions: ['Mix all ingredients together and store in a quart-sized Ziploc or Mason jar. Write instructions on the bag or jar to add: 1 stick softened butter, 1 large egg, ½ teaspoon vanilla extract. Mix everything and bake at 350 for 9-11 minutes.']

recipe_description: We love fish for its flavor and versatility, not to mention it’s a great healthy protein to add to any meal. Make it a meal and pair your fish with some fresh cut veggies from our Produce Department!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 coho salmon fillets', '2 tsp vegetable oil', '¼ tsp kosher salt', 'Freshly ground black pepper', '1-2 scallions, sliced']
recipe_instructions: ['Set a 10-inch nonstick sauté pan over medium heat', 'Brush each fillet with the oil and sprinkle with kosher salt and black pepper', 'Place the fillets in the pan, flesh side down. Cook 2-4 minutes', 'Turn each fillet over and continue to cook for another 2-4 minutes, add scallions', 'Transfer the fillets to a plate, cover loosely with foil and allow to rest for 5 minutes before serving']

recipe_name: Sautéed Petrale Sole in Herb Butter Sauce
recipe_description: We love fish for its flavor and versatility, not to mention it’s a great healthy protein to add to any meal. Make it a meal and pair your fish with some fresh cut veggies from our Produce Department!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 pounds fresh petrale sole fillets', 'Salt, to taste', '2 Tbsp olive oil', '3 Tbsp minced shallots', '1/4 cup dry white wine', '2 Tbsp, cut into 4 pieces, cold, unsalted butter', 'Fresh thyme leaves (or any fresh herb for flavor)', 'Minced fresh chives', 'Meyer Lemon Wedges']
recipe_instructions: ['Pat dry the fillets, lightly salt: Pat the sole fillets dry with paper towels. There is a lot of moisture in Petrale sole, so you might have to pat them dry twice. Lightly salt the fillets on both sides', "Brown the fillets on both sides: Heat oil in a large, non-stick skillet on medium-high heat. Once the oil is hot, carefully add the fillets to the pan. Brown the fillets gently on both sides. Fish is cooked when it flakes easily and is no longer translucent. Sole fillets will cook up very quickly, no more than a few minutes on each side, so don't walk away from the pan while cooking. Once done, remove the fillets from pan and place on a warm plate", 'Cook shallots: Add shallots to the pan and sauté until soft', 'Make sauce: Add white wine to the pan with the shallots to deglaze the pan, and scrape up the browned bits at the bottom of the pan.', 'Add butter and gently swirl to make a sauce. Add herbs, and squeeze a little lemon juice into the sauce. Spoon over the sole.', 'Serve immediately']

recipe_description: We love fish for its flavor and versatility, not to mention it’s a great healthy protein to add to any meal. Make it a meal and pair your fish with some fresh cut veggies from our Produce Department!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 lbs salmon (King, Sockeye or Coho salmon)', '1/4 cup fresh parsley, finely chopped', '1/4 cup Dijon mustard', '1 tbsp lemon juice', '1 tbsp avocado oil', '3 garlic cloves, finely chopped', 'salt and pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit', 'Place the salmon on a parchment lined baking tray and set it aside', 'Mix together the remaining ingredients in a small bowl and generously coat the top of the salmon', 'Bake the salmon for 18-20 minutes (depending on size and thickness), then slice it into individual portions and serve immediately']

recipe_name: Sautéed Swiss Chard with Garlic and Lemon
recipe_description: Eat your greens and love them too!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '4 garlic cloves, thinly sliced', '1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', '2 large bunches Swiss chard, ribs & stems removed & reserved, leaves torn into 2" pieces (about 12 cups)', 'Salt & pepper', '2 tablespoons lemon juice']
recipe_instructions: ['Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Cook garlic, stirring occasionally, until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Add red pepper flakes and half of Swiss chard, season with salt & pepper, and cook, tossing often, until wilted, about 4 minutes. Add lemon juice and remaining chard and cook, tossing, just until all chard is wilted, about 1 minute; season with salt & pepper.']

recipe_name: Buddha Bowl with Kale, Avocado, Orange & Wild Rice
recipe_description: Eat your greens and love them too!
recipe_ingredients: ['RICE', '1 cup wild rice', '1 garlic clove, minced', '2 tablespoons rice vinegar', 'Salt & pepper', '3 cups vegetable broth', '2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil', '1 tablespoon chopped mint', 'TOPPINGS', '1 bunch kale, roughly chopped', '1 tablespoon rice vinegar', '1 orange, cut into segments', '1/4 cup pumpkin seeds', 'Salt & pepper', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1/4 cup pomegranate seeds', '1/2 avocado, sliced', '2 hard-boiled eggs']
recipe_instructions: ['Make the rice: In a medium pot, stir the rice with the broth and garlic to combine. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Once the liquid is boiling, reduce the heat to low & simmer until rice is tender & all the liquid is absorbed, 15 to 17 minutes. Let rice cool for 5 to 10 minutes & then toss with olive oil, vinegar, mint, salt & pepper.', 'Make the toppings: In a medium bowl, toss the kale with the olive oil & vinegar. Divide the rice between two bowls and then top with equal amounts of kale. Top each of the bowls with 2 Tbsp pomegranate seeds, half the orange slices, half the avocado slices, 2 Tbsp pumpkin seeds and a hard boiled egg. Season the egg with salt & pepper. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: Eat your greens and love them too!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 slices thick-cut bacon, cut into pieces', '1 clove garlic, minced', '1 bunch mustard greens (about a pound), tough stems discarded, roughly chopped', 'Salt & Pepper', '1/2 cup chicken broth or stock', '1 tablespoon lemon juice']
recipe_instructions: ['Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the bacon and cook until the fat has rendered and the bacon is browned. Add the garlic and cook just until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the mustard greens and stir to wilt. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Cover and let cook until the greens are tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and serve immediately.']

recipe_description: Start 2019 on a healthy note with this delicious Keto smoothie featuring Garden of Life Keto Meal!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 cups unsweetened chocolate almond milk', '1 scoop Garden of Life Keto Meal, chocolate', '1 1/2 cups frozen raspberries', '1 tablespoon almond butter', '1 tablespoons raw honey']
recipe_instructions: ['Place all ingredients into a high speed blender and blend until smooth. Enjoy immediately!']

recipe_description: Seasonally themed cocktails are an excellent route to take, but you should be careful. A lot of them can be overly sweet and a little too boozy. The perfect answer to that is to make a Spritz instead. What makes the Spritz an excellent choice? Well, for starters they’re low in alcohol, extremely versatile and refreshing. Plus, we here at Oliver’s Market have a secret weapon for you to make your Spritz even more sophisticated — fruit drinks from Belvoir Fruit Farms!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 ounces dry Sparkling wine', '2 ounces Belvoir Elderflower Lemonade', '2 ounces club soda', 'Lemon twist (for garnish)', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['In a Collins glass filled with ice, pour in Elderflower Lemonade, club soda and Sparkling wine. Garnish with a twist of lemon.']

recipe_ingredients: ['1 oz. Bourbon Whiskey', '1/2 oz. Cointreau Orange Liqueur', '4 dashes Angostura Bitters', "3 dashes Peychaud's Bitters", 'Champagne', 'Orange Twist, for garnish', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['In a tall mixing glass, stir together bourbon, Cointreau, and bitters with ice. Strain into champagne flute and top with champagne, garnish with orange twist.']

recipe_ingredients: ['1 c. Champagne', '1 tbsp. Granulated Sugar', '1 tbsp. Fresh Lemon Juice', '2 packets Gelatin', '1 c. Ginger Ale', 'Colored Sugar Sprinkles']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine champagne, sugar, and lemon juice in saucepan and add gelatin. Allow to bloom without stirring for 3 minutes.', 'When gelatin has bloomed, heat on low and stir until gelatin has fully dissolved. Do not allow to boil. Add ginger ale and allow carbonation to bubble off, then pour into shallow baking dish and chill until set. Top with sugar sprinkles before serving.']

recipe_name: Spirit Works Sloe Gin Sloe Royal
recipe_description: “Right from the beginning, the support from Oliver’s has made a huge difference in our business. Not only has Oliver’s been an open avenue for selling our product, but they have helped us tell our story, which has brought a lot of customers to our tasting room to learn more about us.” – Timo & Ashby Marshall, Spirit Works Distillery
recipe_ingredients: ['1 oz. Spirit Works Sloe Gin', 'Dry Sparkling Wine', 'Juice of a fresh lime wedge']
recipe_instructions: ['Pour Sloe Gin into Champagne flute.', 'Top with Sparkling Wine.', 'Squeeze juice of lime wedge into glass and discard wedge.', 'Garnish with lime wheel.']

recipe_description: May your days be bubbly and bright with this sparkling cocktail!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 dashes Angostura bitters', '2 oz. Champagne (or other sparkling wine)', '1 sugar cube']
recipe_instructions: ['Add a dash of bitters onto sugar cube & drop it into a sparkling wine flute. Add chilled bubbles & garnish with an orange slice and maraschino cherry.']

recipe_description: Cocktails have a lot going on for them: they are fun, allow you to get creative, can acquaint you with different spirits that you might not be familiar with, and you can make them Champagne/Sparkling wine based as well!
recipe_ingredients: ['1/2 ounces Chambord', 'Brut Champagne or Sparkling Wine']
recipe_instructions: ['Add Chambord to a flute and top with Brut Champagne or Sparkling Wine.', 'Garnish with a raspberry and lemon twist.']

recipe_description: Cocktails have a lot going on for them: they are fun, allow you to get creative, can acquaint you with different spirits that you might not be familiar with, and you can make them Champagne/Sparkling wine based as well!
recipe_ingredients: ['1.5 ounce grapefruit juice', '1 ounce St. Germain elderflower liqueur', 'Brut Rosé Champagne or Sparkling Wine', '1 grapefruit twist']
recipe_instructions: ['Pour grapefruit juice and elderflower liqueur into a flute.', 'Top with Champagne/Sparkling Wine.', 'Garnish grapefruit twist.']

recipe_description: Champagne and peaches – what’s more refreshing than that? Try this sparkling cocktail for a bubbly sweet treat!
recipe_ingredients: ['3 cups peach puree', '1 bottle of Prosecco or Sparkling Wine, chilled', 'Raspberry liqueur - optional']

recipe_description: Orange juice and bubbly – the perfect beginning, middle or end to any day!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 (750ml) bottle chilled Gloria Ferrer Brut or Blanc de Noirs', '3 cups chilled orange juice', '½ cup Grand Marnier or triple sec, optional']
recipe_instructions: ['Fill 8 champagne flutes 1/2 full with chilled sparkling wine. Top with orange juice. If you are using, top mimosa with 1 tablespoon of Grand Marnier or triple sec.']

recipe_description: Cocktails have a lot going on for them: they are fun, allow you to get creative, can acquaint you with different spirits that you might not be familiar with, and you can make them Champagne/Sparkling wine based as well!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 ounce pomegranate liqueur', '1 ounce Cointreau', '1 ounce orange juice', '3 ounces Champagne or Sparkling wine', 'Orange zest']
recipe_instructions: ['Shake the first three ingredients with ice.', 'Gently stir in the Champagne or Sparkling Wine.', 'Strain into a flute and add garnish.']

recipe_description: Warm your spirits with this delicious recipe for Hot Buttered Rum
recipe_ingredients: ['2/3 cup packed dark brown sugar', '1 stick of unsalted butter, room temperature', '1/4 cup honey', '1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg', '1/8 teaspoon ground cloves', 'Pinch salt', '3/4 cup Prat XO Reserve Rum', '2 cups boiling water', '4 sticks cinnamon, for garnish']
recipe_instructions: ['Using an electric mixer, beat the brown sugar, butter, honey, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt in a medium bowl until blended and smooth. Transfer the mixture to a 4-cup (or larger) measuring cup. Add the rum and then 2 cups of boiling water. Stir until the butter mixture dissolves. Divide the buttered rum among 4 mugs. Garnish with the cinnamon sticks and serve.']

recipe_description: Brighten up your Christmas table highlighting some of our favorite winter fruits and veggies.
recipe_ingredients: ['SALAD', '1 large bunch kale, de-stemmed and chopped', '1/2 cup shredded Brussels Sprouts (pick up some pre-cut Brussels Sprouts in our Produce Department!)', '1/2 cup Pomegranate seeds', '2 Satsumas, peeled and segmented', '1/4 cup toasted hazelenuts', '1/4 cup pumpkin seeds', 'DRESSING', '2 tablespoon Apple Cider Vinegar', '1/4 cup freshly-squeezed orange juice', '1 tablespoon freshly squeezed lemon juice', '1 teaspoon honey', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt', 'Kosher Salt & Freshly Ground Black Pepper, to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['For the dressing, combine all ingredients in a mason jar and shake until combined. Alternatively, whisk together in a small bowl.', 'In a large bowl, add kale and dressing. Massage kale for approximately two minutes or until the leaves begin to wilt. Add the remaining salad ingredients and toss quickly to combine.']

recipe_description: Add some bite-sized glam to your Chirstmas appetizer spread with the recipe for a simple Shrimp Cocktail.
recipe_overview: ['Serves: 4 to 6 servings', 'Prep Time: 15 minutes', 'Cook Time: 3 minutes']
recipe_ingredients: ['10 cups cold water', '2 medium carrots, quartered', '2 stalks celery, quartered', '1 large onion, quartered', '1 head garlic, halved', '1 lemon, halved', '1/2 bunch parsley', '5 sprigs fresh thyme', '2 bay leaves', '1 pound medium or large shrimp, in the shellf, rinsed', '1 tablespoon kosher salt', '12 oz. Red Duck Organic Cocktail Sauce', 'Lemon Wedges']
recipe_instructions: ['Put the water, carrot, celery, onion, garlic, lemon, parsley, thyme, and bay leaves in a pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Lower the heat to a simmer, set a cover on top slightly ajar, and cook for 10 to 30 minutes.', 'Drop the shrimp into the liquid and turn off the heat. Cook the shrimp, stirring occasionally, until they curl and turn pink, about 2 to 2 1/2 minutes for medium shrimp, 3 minutes for large ones. Drain and cool to room temperature. Peel the shrimp and remove the vein along the curve of the shrimp, if desired. Refrigerate if not serving right away. If refrigerated, bring the shrimp to room temperature 20 minutes before serving.', 'To serve put the cocktail sauce in a medium bowl and surround with the shrimp, or loop the shrimp over the edge of an individual cocktail glass and top with the sauce. Garnish with the lemon and serve.']

recipe_description: Pecan Pies are a staple on the holiday table in the southern United States, but that doesn’t mean we can’t enjoy them here on the West Coast!
recipe_ingredients: ['1/4 cup dark brown corn syrup', '1 tablespoon cold water', '1 cup sugar', '3 eggs', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 (9-inch) unbaked pie shell', '1 (9-inch) unbaked pie shell', '1/4 cup Clover unsalted butter', '2 teaspoons cornstarch', '1-1/4 cups chopped pecans']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F', 'In a small bowl, whisk the cornstarch into the water until combined. Then in a medium saucepan, combine the cornstarch/water mixture, sugar, corn syrup and butter. Bring to a full boil, and remove from heat.', 'In a large bowl, beat eggs until frothy. Gradually beat in cooked syrup mixture. Stir in salt, vanilla, and pecans. Pour into pie shell.', 'Bake in preheated oven for 45 to 50 minutes, or until filling is set.']

recipe_ingredients: ['2 c. All Purpose Flour', '1/2 tsp. Salt', '1/2 c. + 2 tbsp. Powdered Sugar', '1 tsp. Vanilla Extract', '1 c. Unsalted Butter', '1 tsp. Water', 'Icing', '3 oz. Pasteurized Egg Whites', '1 tsp. Vanilla Extract', '4 c. Powdered Sugar']
recipe_instructions: ['In a food processor, combine flour, sugar, and salt; add butter, vanilla, and water, and combine until a dough begins to form. Form dough into a log and chill for at least one hour or overnight.', 'Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Slice log into 1/3-inch thick disks and transfer to a baking sheet. Bake for 12-14 minutes, rotating pans halfway through. Allow five minutes to cool on tray before transferring to cooling rack.', 'For the Icing: Beat egg whites and vanilla together until frothy, slowly add powdered sugar and beat until mixture forms stiff, glossy peaks. Transfer to piping bag to decorate cookies.']

recipe_ingredients: ['3 1/2 c. All Purpose Flour', '1 tsp. Baking Powder', '1/2 tsp. Baking Soda', '2 tsp. Cinnamon', '2 tsp. Ground Ginger', '1/2 tsp. Salt', '1 Large Egg', '1/4 tsp. Cloves', '3/4 c. Brown Sugar, packed', '3/4 c. Molasses', '3/4 c. Unsalted Butter']
recipe_instructions: ['In a saucepan on low heat, melt butter; stir in molasses, spices, salt, and brown sugar. Remove from heat and allow to cool, then beat in egg.', 'Combine flour, baking powder, and baking soda in a separate bowl; slowly stir dry ingredients into wet. Divide dough into two portions, wrap, and chill for at least two hours or overnight.', 'Preheat oven to 350 degrees. When dough is no longer sticky, roll out and cut with cookie cutters, then transfer to lined baking sheet. Bake for 8 to 12 minutes, or until the edges are browned; transfer immediately to a cooling rack.']

recipe_description: Get into the holiday spirit with this super easy and delicious Classic Sugar Cookie recipe!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2c. butter, softened', '2c. white sugar', '4 eggs', '1tsp. vanilla extract', '5c. all-purpose flour', '2tsp. baking powder', '1tsp. salt']
recipe_instructions: ['In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs and vanilla.', 'Stir in the flour, baking powder, and salt. Cover, and chill dough for at least one hour (or overnight).', 'Preheat oven to 400 degrees(F). Roll out dough on floured surface 1/2 - 1/2" thick. Cut into shapes with any cookie cutter.', 'Place cookies 1" apart on ungreased cookie sheets.', 'Bake 6 to 8 minutes in preheated oven.', 'Cool completely and decorate as desired!']

recipe_name: Spiced Eggnog Cookies with Eggnog Glaze
recipe_description: Try this recipe for your next cookie swap, for a Christmas party, or just because!
recipe_ingredients: ['½ cup unsalted butter, room temperature', '½ cup brown sugar', '¼ cup white sugar', '1 egg, room temperature', '1 tsp rum extract', '¼ cup eggnog', '1½ cups flour', '½ tsp baking soda', '½ tsp baking powder', '¼ tsp salt', '½ tsp nutmeg (preferable freshly grated)', '½ tsp allspice', '¼ tsp ground cloves', 'GLAZE:', '¼ cup eggnog', '1¾ cup powder sugar', '1 tsp rum extract', '¼ tsp nutmeg', '¼ tsp allspice']
recipe_instructions: ['In the bowl of an electric mixer, cream together butter and sugars for a couple of minutes.', 'Add egg, eggnog and rum extract, beat until mixed. Scrape sides and bottom of the bowl.', 'Sift in flour, nutmeg, allspice, ground cloves, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Mix the ingredients on low speed until just combined. Scrape sides and bottom of the bowl and mix just a few times.', 'Refrigerate for about 30 minutes.', 'Preheat the oven to 350 and line baking sheet with parchment paper.', 'Scoop out cookie dough onto the parchment paper using a standard cookie scoop, placing them about 2 inches apart.', 'Bake for 11-13 minutes and transfer to a wire rack to cool.', 'In a small sauce pot, over medium heat, heat up eggnog.', 'Add powder sugar, rum extract, nutmeg and allspice. Whisk until all smooth and heated through. Let it cool just a little but not too much or it will start to harden.', 'Spoon some glaze over cookies.', 'Grate a little more nutmeg on top. (Optional.)']

recipe_description: Dinner Rolls are the vessel for all good things.
recipe_ingredients: ['2 cups all-purpose flour, or more if needed', '1 envelope Instant Yeast', '2 tablespooon sugar', '1/2 teaspoon salt', '1/2 cup Clover milk', '1/4 cup water', '2 tablespoons Clover unsalted butter']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine 3/4 cup flour, undissolved yeast, sugar and salt in a large bowl. Heat milk, water and butter until very warm (120 degrees to 130 degrees F). Add to flour mixture. Beat 2 minutes at medium speed of electric mixer, scraping bowl occasionally. Add 1/4 cup flour; beat 2 minutes at high speed. Stir in enough remaining flour to make soft dough. Knead on lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 8 to 10 minutes. Cover; let rest 10 minutes.', 'Divide dough into 12 equal pieces; shape into balls. Place in greased 8-inch round pan. Cover; let rise in warm, draft-free place until doubled in size, about 30 minutes.', 'Bake in preheated 375 degrees F oven for 20 minutes or until done. Remove from pan; brush with additional melted butter and sprinkle with coarse salt, if desired. Serve warm.']

recipe_description: It’s Winter time, which means we have access to some glorious citrus varieties. Now’s the time to pair your favorite type of citrus with some tasty spirits. Check out this collection of cocktails that all pair citrus with spirits to make your season bright. Cheers!
recipe_ingredients: ['1.5 oz. Bulleit Bourbon', '1 oz. fresh Texas Red Ruby Grapefruit juice', '1/2 oz. honey syrup (equal parts honey & water)', 'Grapefruit peel twist for garnish', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['Place ice in a cocktail shaker, then pour in all ingredients and shake vigorously.', 'Serve in a chilled cocktail glass with a twist of grapefruit peel on the rim of the glass.']

recipe_description: It’s Winter time, which means we have access to some glorious citrus varieties. Now’s the time to pair your favorite type of citrus with some tasty spirits. Check out this collection of cocktails that all pair citrus with spirits to make your season bright. Cheers!
recipe_ingredients: ['2oz. Pama Pomegranate Liqueur', '1/4oz. orange juice', '1oz. fresh Naval Orange juice', '2oz. Mumm Brut Rosé', 'Orange peel twist for garnish']
recipe_instructions: ['In a tall glass, combine all ingredients except brut and stir to incorporate.', 'Pour into champagne flute and top with chilled brut, garnish rim with orange peel.']

recipe_description: It’s Winter time, which means we have access to some glorious citrus varieties. Now’s the time to pair your favorite type of citrus with some tasty spirits. Check out this collection of cocktails that all pair citrus with spirits to make your season bright. Cheers!
recipe_ingredients: ["6oz. Ford's Dry Gin", '12oz. soda water', '4oz. fresh Pomelo juice', '1oz. rosemary simple syrup', 'Ice', 'FOR SYRUP:', '1 cup sugar', '1 cup water', '1/4 cup rosemary leaves']
recipe_instructions: ['Syrup: Combine water, sugar and rosemary in a saucepan over medium heat and cook until sugar is completely dissolved. Remove from heat, allow to steep for 30 minutes; strain and set aside.', 'Cocktail: Combine gin, juice, and syrup in a tall glass and stir to combine. Add ice and finish with soda water.']

recipe_description: It’s Winter time, which means we have access to some glorious citrus varieties. Now’s the time to pair your favorite type of citrus with some tasty spirits. Check out this collection of cocktails that all pair citrus with spirits to make your season bright. Cheers!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 bottle Rain 80 Proof Vodka', "3 Buddha's Hand Citron", '2 liter glass jar with resealable lid', '4 cups simple syrup', 'SIMPLE SYRUP:', '4 cups sugar', '4 cups water']
recipe_instructions: ['Remove and thinly slice “fingers” from citron, then use a vegetable peeler to remove additional zest from the body of the fruit. Place zest and chopped fruit into a jar and completely cover with vodka, then shake to combine. Store container in dark, cool area and shake once daily; allow at least 6 weeks to infuse. When fully infused, remove zest and place liquid back in jar.', 'To make the syrup, combine sugar and water in saucepan on medium heat, and stir until sugar is dissolved. When cool, add syrup to buddhacello and shake to combine; serve well-chilled.']

recipe_description: The long, anticipated wait is over – Dungeness crab is finally here! Celebrate the season with this seafood cioppino recipe, using our finest seafood items available and local Sonoma Gourmet Cioppino sauce.
recipe_ingredients: ['2 lb. Dungeness Crab (when ordering your crab, make sure to get it cracked and cleaned)', '1-1/2 lb. Raw Prawns, peeled', '1 lb. Rockcod Fillets, cubed (1-1/2")', '1 lb. Clams', '1 lb. Mussels', '1 32oz. Sonoma Gourmet Cioppino Sauce']
recipe_instructions: ['Scrub and rinse the mussels well in cold water. Peel the shrimp and remove the tails (this is optional; some people prefer to leave shells and tails on). Chop the fish into 2” pieces.', 'In a large stock pot, pour Sonoma Gourmet Cioppino Sauce and start to simmer. Add the clams & mussels and cook until mussels just begin to open, about 5 minutes.', 'Next, add the fish, re-cover, and cook about 3 minutes.', 'Finally, add the shrimp and crab. Cover, and cook only long enough for the shrimp to turn pink and the fish to cook all the way through, about 8 minutes.', 'Serve in a large bowl and enjoy!']

recipe_description: This is the perfect Christmas morning breakfast, because you make it the night before on Christmas Eve! It sits in the fridge overnight and is ready to go in the oven while you enjoy a cup of locally made coffee or tea.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 yellow onion, diced', '1 red bell pepper, seeds removed and diced', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '12 large eggs', '1 cup milk', '3 cups diced Yukon Gold Potaotes', '1-1/2 teaspoons salt', '1/2 teaspoon black pepper', '2 green onions, chopped']
recipe_instructions: ['Grease a 9×13 baking dish with nonstick cooking spray and set aside.', 'In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Cook until it is a nice crispy brown. Remove bacon with a slotted spoon and place on a paper towel lined plate. Roughly chop the bacon and set aside.', 'Add the onion, diced potato and red pepper to the skillet and cook over medium heat until tender. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Set aside.', 'In a large bowl, beat the eggs and whisk in the milk. Stir in the cooked vegetables, potatoes, and 1 cup of the shredded cheese. Set 3/4 cup of bacon aside and stir in the rest. Season with salt and pepper.', 'Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish and refrigerate for at least 8 hours, but no longer than 12 hours.', 'In the morning, heat oven to 350*F. Top the casserole with remaining cheese and green onions. Bake for 20 minutes so the eggs start to set up. Carefully add the remaining bacon to the top of the casserole. Bake for an additional 20 minutes or until the eggs are firm and the top is slightly golden brown. Let stand for 10 minutes. Cut into squares and serve warm.']

recipe_description: This is an appetizer that is sure to be a hit! It’s one of those snacks that will have everyone asking, “How did they do that?” – the secret is that this couldn’t be easier! (We won’t tell anyone!)
recipe_ingredients: ['1 small round of Nicasio Valley Locarno', '1 package of rolled Pillsbury Pie Dough', '1 jar of fig jam']
recipe_instructions: ['Allow the pie crusts to come to room temperature, as per instructions.', 'Unroll one crust and place the Locarno in the middle. Cut excess crust from around the cheese, leaving about a 1/2-inch border. Save remaining pie dough.', 'Cover top of cheese with fig jam, per your taste. Unroll the other crust and drape over the top and sides of the cheese. Crimp around the bottom to seal and cut away excess dough. You can cut out shapes of the remaining dough to add embellishments or designs.', 'Place in a pie pan and bake in an oven preheated to 400*F for 15-30 minutes, or until browned on top. Let cool for 10-15 minutes and serve with crackers or a sliced baguette.']

recipe_name: Marinated Celebration Roast with Roasted Onions
recipe_description: Don’t leave them crunching on carrots grab a Field Roast Vegan Celebration Roast and make this delicious recipe!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 lb. Celebration Roast, cut into 1/2-inch slices', '1 Onion, peeled and sliced into 1-inch rounds', 'Extra Virgin Olive Oil', 'Salt and Pepper', 'Balsamic Vinegar', 'Parsley or rosemary, chopped']
recipe_instructions: ['Cook Celebration Roast according to package.', 'Toss peeled onion in some of the olive oil. Add a little salt and place on sheet pan.', 'Roast onion in 350°F oven until browned or slightly blackened.', 'Place cooked & sliced Celebration Roast on a platter, interspersed with the roasted onion.', 'Dress with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Sprinkle on black pepper and garnish with chopped parsley or rosemary.']

recipe_description: Everyone loves potatoes! Try this delicious recipe for Roasted Garlic Red Potatotes.
recipe_ingredients: ['2 pounds red potatoes, quartered', '1/4 cup butter, melted', '2 teaspoons minced garlic', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 lemon, juiced', '1 tablespoon grated Parmesan cheese']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Place potatoes in an 8x8 inch baking dish.
