In a small bowl combine melted butter, garlic, salt and lemon juice; pour over potatoes and stir to coat.', 'Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over potatoes.', 'Bake, covered, in preheated oven for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake until golden brown and tender when pierced with a fork, about 10 minutes more.']

recipe_description: Who knew mashed potatoes could get this colorful! Be daring and grab some purple potatoes to add some color to you dinner table!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 head garlic', '1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil', '10 sprigs fresh thyme', '2 pounds purple potatoes, cut into 1-inch pieces', '1/2 cup sour cream', '1/2 cup milk', '1/2 teaspoon salt', '1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 400°F.', 'Rub off excess papery skin from garlic head without separating the cloves. Slice the tip off the head, exposing the cloves. Place the garlic in a small baking dish, such as a bread pan. Drizzle with oil and lay thyme sprigs around it. Cover with foil. Roast until very soft, 30 to 45 minutes. Uncover and let cool.', 'About 15 minutes before the garlic is done, cook potatoes in a pot of boiling water until tender, 8 to 12 minutes. Drain well.', 'Return the potatoes to the pot. Squeeze the garlic cloves out of their skins into the potatoes. Strain the oil through a fine sieve over the potatoes, pressing on the solids (discard the thyme). Add sour cream, milk, salt and pepper; mash to desired consistency.']

recipe_name: Roasted Romanesco with Garlic and Lemon
recipe_description: Romanesco (also known as Roman Cauliflower) is very similar to broccoli – but looks so much cooler! Try it to add a little pizazz to your next dinner table.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 head Romenesco, cut into bite-size pieces', '2-3 tablespoon olive oil, or more to taste', '8 cloves garlic, minced', '1-2 tablespoons lemon zest, or to taste', 'Salt to taste', 'Freshly ground black pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.', 'Spread Romanesco onto the prepared baking sheet; drizzle with olive oil and crushed garlic. Mix everything around.', 'Grate the lemon zest over the Romanesco and sprinkle with salt and pepper.', 'Roast in the preheated oven until tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Add more lemon zest before serving, if desired.']

recipe_description: This appetizer could not be easier, or tastier! Try it with a spicy pepper jelly, or your favorite fruit jelly!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 (8oz) package Clover Cream Cheese', '½ cup mild pepper jelly (or your favorite jelly)', 'Crackers']
recipe_instructions: ['Unwrap the block of cream cheese and place on a serving plate. Spread the jelly over the block of cream cheese. Serve with your favorite crackers.']

recipe_description: This cut is the pork equivalent of the beef prime rib roast or rack of lamb, anatomically speaking. It’s sure to make a huge impact, and when cooked perfectly you will get a tender, juicy cut of meat that will please everyone around your holiday table.
recipe_overview: ['Serves: 12 to 30 servings, depending on how many chops you request from the butcher', 'Prep Time: 10 minutues', 'Cook Time: 3 hours']
recipe_ingredients: ['One 10-rib pork loin roast (5-1/2 pounds)', '6 large garlic cloves, coarsely chopped', '1 tablespoon whole fennel seed', '1 teaspoon ground fennel', '2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper', '2 teaspoons crushed red pepper', '1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil', 'Salt']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 400°. In a mini processor, combine the garlic, rosemary, fennel seeds, ground fennel, crushed red pepper, black pepper and olive oil and process to a paste. Set the pork roast on a large rimmed baking sheet and cut shallow score marks all over the fat. Spread 1 tablespoon of the garlic paste on the underside of the roast; spread the remaining paste all over the scored fat and meaty parts of the roast. Season all over with salt.', 'Roast the pork, fat side up, for 1 hour. Reduce the oven temperature to 325° and roast the pork for about 35 minutes longer, or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the meat registers 150°. Transfer the roast to a carving board and let rest for 15 minutes. Carve the roast into chops and serve at once.']

recipe_description: Roasted rack of lamb sounds fancy, but don’t be scared! It’s actually easy to make!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 tablespoons kosher salt', '2 tablespoons minced fresh rosemary leaves', '3 garlic cloves, minced', '1/2 cup Dijon mustard', '1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar', '2 racks of lamb, frenched']
recipe_instructions: ["In the bowl of a food processor fitted with a steel blade, process the salt, rosemary, and garlic until they're as finely minced as possible. Add the mustard and balsamic vinegar and process for 1 minute. Place the lamb in a roasting or sheet pan with the ribs curving down, and coat the tops with the mustard mixture. Allow to stand for 1 hour at room temperature.", 'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F.', 'Roast the lamb for exactly 20 minutes for rare or 25 minutes for medium-rare. Remove from the oven and cover with aluminum foil. Allow to sit for 15 minutes, then cut into individual ribs and serve.']

recipe_description: It seems like everyone these days has somewhere to be, someone to talk, or something to do – with this kind of chaos, the tradition of the sit-down dinner has unfortunately had to take a bit of a backseat. However, it doesn’t have to! One-pot pasta is a quick, easy way to make a meal for a family, and with the great deals on high quality ingredients like Imagine Broths at Oliver’s Markets, no one will know that it didn’t take you a day to make!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 package Imagine© Low-Sodium, Organic Chicken Broth', '1 package dried Rotini Pasta', '1 package frozen Meatballs', '1 32 oz. can Diced Tomatoes', '1 bunch Basil, chopped', '1 teaspoon Dried Oregano', '2 Bay Leaves', '1/2 teaspoon Chili Flake', '6 cloves Garlic, chopped', '1 Onion, chopped', '1 cup White Wine', '1 tablespoon Olive Oil', '1 tablespoon Butter', 'Salt & Pepper, to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine all ingredients except butter and olive oil in large pot, and stir to combine; make sure that all ingredients are submerged in liquid, especially meatballs.', 'Heat on high until boiling, then reduce heat to simmer and cook for 20 minutes or until sauce is thickened and meatballs are heated through.', 'When sauce is thickened and pasta and meatballs are cooked, add butter and olive oil, stirring to combine. Season with salt and pepper.']

recipe_description: Imagine Broth is a deliciously convenient way to create inspiring dishes. This week we’ve got a great deal on these incredible organic broths – so it makes sense to stock up, right? (yes, pun intended) Rather than wait until you come across a recipe that calls for broth, why not check out this list of all the ways you can use Imagine Organic Broths. Bring some flavorful fun to every meal.

Brining is a surprisingly simple way to add loads of flavor and moisture to poultry and pork. In the most basic sense, it’s the marinating of leaner meats to add moisture and tenderize them. But more specifically, the herbs, salts, and spices of the brine can transform a typically dry turkey into the most tender and juicy entrée you can imagine.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 Turkey, defrosted & entrails removed', '2.5 c. Kosher Salt', '1 c. Sugar', '1.5 Gallons Water', '6 c. Ice', '1 c. Apple Cider Vinegar', '1 tbsp. each Sage, Thyme, Rosemary', 'Large Plastic Tub or Food-Grade Bag']
recipe_instructions: ['Bring 4 cups of water to boil; add sugar and salt, stir until fully dissolved. Remove from heat and add herbs, vinegar, remaining water, and ice.', 'Place the turkey in a container or in a resealable bag, pour in enough brine to completely cover the turkey with an inch or two to spare.', 'Place in refrigerator. The turkey should sit in the brine for about 1 hour per pound of turkey. Brining too long is much worse than not brining enough so watch the time.', 'When you are ready to start cooking your turkey, remove it from the brine and rinse it off thoroughly in the sink with cold water until all traces of salt are off the surface inside and out. Safely discard the brine and cook your turkey as normal.', 'Roasting Time Roasting Time', 'Weight (Unstuffed) (Stuffed)', '• 10-18 lbs. 3-3.5 hrs 3.75-4.5 hrs', '• 18-22 lbs. 3.5-4 hrs 4.5-5 hrs', '• 22-24 lbs 4-4.5 hrs 5-5.5 hrs', '• 24-29 lbs 4.5-5 hrs 5.5-6.25 hrs']

recipe_name: So You Want to Cook a Prime Rib?
recipe_description: Here at Oliver’s Market we are passionate about meat. Especially great cuts shared around a holiday table of friends and family. Here we have instructions on how to cook your Oliver’s Choice 100% Angus Standing Rib Roast! These instructions will help you get your prime rib cooked to perfection – it will be the star of your dinner table!
recipe_ingredients: ["1 5lb Oliver's Choice 100% Angus Standing Rib Roasts", '2 teaspoons Kosher salt', '1 teaspoon Coarse black pepper', '1 teaspoon Garlic Powder', 'Au Jus (optional)']
recipe_instructions: ['Allow roast to stand at room temperature for at least 1 hour.', 'Preheat oven to 375*F. Combine the salt, pepper and garlic powder in a small bow. Place the roast in a rack in a roasting pan so the fatty side is up and the rib side is on the bottom. Season the meat liberally with the spice mix.', 'Roast for 1 hour in the preheated oven. Turn the oven off and leave the roast inside. DO NOT OPEN THE DOOR. Leave it in there for 3 hours. 30 to 40 minutes before serving, turn the oven back on at 375*F to reheat the roast. The internal temperature should be between 135*F and 145*F. Remove from oven and let rest for 10 minutes before carving into servings.', 'Slice the meat as desired and serve with your Aus Jus.']

recipe_description: Punch doesn’t have to be that headache-inducing sweet and boozy bowl full of canned juices, sherbet, and spirits. Instead, it can be an elegant and refreshing bowl full of fresh juices and quality spirits. Cheers!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 cups pear nectar', '4 cups orange juice', '2 cups chilled club soda', '1 cup sliver rum', 'Orange slices for garnish']

recipe_description: Punch doesn’t have to be that headache-inducing sweet and boozy bowl full of canned juices, sherbet, and spirits. Instead, it can be an elegant and refreshing bowl full of fresh juices and quality spirit. Cheers!
recipe_ingredients: ['4 cups Rye whiskey', '3 tablespoons bitters', '3 bottles chilled sparkling apple cider', '1 apple, thinly sliced']
recipe_instructions: ['In a large punch bowl, combine the rye and bitters; chill for up to 12 hours. Just before serving, add the sparkling apple cider and apple slices.']

recipe_description: Cocktails have a lot going on for them: they are fun, allow you to get creative, can acquaint you with different spirits that you might not be familiar with, and you can make them Champagne/Sparkling wine based as well!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 ounces cranberry juice', '2 ounces spiced rum', '3 ounces ginger beer']
recipe_instructions: ['In a rocks glass filled with ice, combine cranberry juice and rum.', 'Top with ginger beer.']

recipe_description: Punch doesn’t have to be that headache-inducing sweet and boozy bowl full of canned juices, sherbet, and spirits. Instead, it can be an elegant and refreshing bowl full of fresh juices and quality spirit. Cheers!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 cups fresh cranberries', '1 cup sugar', '1 cup water', '1 cup vodka', '5-6 cups chilled club soda']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine 2 cups fresh cranberries, sugar, and water in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, 8 minutes or until cranberries begin to pop. Pour mixture through a wire-mesh strainer into a large pitcher, discarding solids; cool completely (about 1 hour). Stir in chilled club soda, fresh Key lime juice, and vodka. Serve over ice. Garnish with Key lime slices and fresh cranberries.']

recipe_description: Turkey gravy is what unites your whole holiday meal – literally and figuratively.
recipe_ingredients: ['1/2 cup Clover butter', '1/2 cup + 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1/2 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper (or more to taste)', '4 cups pan drippings, chicken broth or water']
recipe_instructions: ['Drain the pan drippings for the roasted turkey through a fine strainer into a large glass measuring up or fat separater. Let sit, the remove fat from the top of the drippings. Add in chicken broth or water to make 4 cups, if necessary.', 'In a medium saucepan, melt butter. Add in lots of black pepper. Add in flour (1/2 cup + 3 tablespoons); constantly whisk for about 3 minutes over low heat.', 'Slowly add in the 4 cups of drippings/broth; whisk constantly over medium-low heat until bubbly and thickened, about 3 minutes.', 'Use right away or keep warm over the lowest heat setting. Whisk again before serving.']

recipe_description: This high flavor dish will be a beautiful complement to any main dish. Take advantage of Sonoma County Mycopia Mushrooms to make this a truly local dish.
recipe_ingredients: ['2 pounds wild mushrooms (hedgehogs, chantrelles, black trumpets, etc.)', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1-2 garlic cloves, minced', 'Kosher salt', 'Freshly ground black pepper', '2-3 tablespoons chopped Italian parsley']
recipe_instructions: ['Trim any brown spots off the mushrooms, slice off the bottoms, cut them in half and roughly slice. If any are very dirty you can swish them gently in warm water.', 'Heat the olive oil in a large sauté pan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds, then rais the heat and throw in the thickest mushroom variety, season with salt and pepper, and sauté for 4 minutes. Then add the more delicate mushrooms and cook for another minute or two. Pour off any juice that collects in the pan. Top with the chopped parsley and serve immediately.']

recipe_description: Add a little zing and excitement to mashed potatoes with creamy and tangy goat cheese – you will not be disappointed.
recipe_ingredients: ['3 pounds large Yukon gold potatoes, peeled and cut into 3/4-inch chunks', '5 large garlic cloves', 'Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper', '7 to 8 ounces garlic-and-herb goat cheese, at room temperature', '4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) unsalted butter, at room temperature', '1 1/2 cups sour cream', '1/2 cup half-and-half or milk', '1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Place the potatoes, garlic and 1 tablespoon salt in a large pot with enough water to cover the potatoes. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce to a simmer and cook for 20 to 25 minutes, until very tender.', 'Drain the potatoes and garlic and process them together through a food mill fitted with the coarsest blade set on top of a bowl. While the potatoes are still hot, stir in the goat cheese, butter, sour cream, half-and-half, 4 teaspoons salt and 2 teaspoons pepper until smooth.', 'Pour the mixture into a 9-by-12-by-2-inch oval baking dish, smoothing the top. Sprinkle the Parmesan on top and bake for 30 to 40 minutes, until lightly browned. Serve hot.']

recipe_description: Butternut squash, white cheddar and thyme give this classical comfort food favorite a seasonal twist.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 pound penne pasta', '2 tablespoons unsalted butter', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 cups Clover 2% milk', '1 teaspoon dried oregano', '1 teaspoon dried thyme', '1/2 teaspoon black pepper', '1 teaspoon salt', '1-1/4 cups butternut squash puree (pumpkin puree also works)', '1 cup shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese (about 3.8 ounces)', '1 cup shredded white cheddar cheese (about 3.8 ounces)', '1/3 cup shredded parmesan cheese (about 2.3 ounces)', 'Olive oil for greasing baking dish', 'Finely chopped parsley for topping (optional)']
recipe_instructions: ['Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain pasta and rinse under cold water.', 'Position an oven rack to the center. Preheat oven to 350ºF (175ºC). Grease a baking dish with olive oil. Set aside.', 'Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in sauté pan over medium-high heat. Add flour and stir immediately until a soft paste, or roux, forms. Add milk and begin to stir everything immediately to prevent the roux from clumping up too much.', 'Once the milk boils, reduce heat to medium-low and let the sauce simmer for about 3 to 4 more minutes, until the sauce thickens. Reduce the heat to low.', 'Add the oregano, thyme, black pepper and salt and stir. Add the butternut squash puree and mix until everything is incorporated. Mix in 3/4 cup of mozzarella, 3/4 cup of white cheddar. Save the rest of the cheese for topping later. Turn off heat. Stir in the cooked pasta, until it’s well coated with the butternut squash cheese sauce.', 'Pour mac and cheese into the prepared baking dish. Top with remaining mozzarella, white cheddar and parmesan. Bake for 15 minutes, then broil for 4 minutes to brown the cheese on top.', 'Top finished mac and cheese with chopped parsley. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: The Green Bean Casserole many know and love was first created by the Campbell Soup Company in 1955.
recipe_ingredients: ['FOR THE CRISPY ONION TOPPING: 2 medium onions, thinly sliced', '1/4 cup all-purpose flour', '2 tablespoons panko bread crumbs', '1 teaspoons kosher salt', 'Cooking Spray', 'FOR THE GREEN BEANS & SAUCE: 2 tablespoons + 1 teaspoon Kosher salt, divided', '1 pound fresh green beans, trimmed and halved', '2 tablespoons Clover unsalted butter', '12 oz. mushrooms, trimmed and cut into 1/2-inch pieces', '1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1/4 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg', '2 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 cup vegetable or chicken broth', '1 cup Clover half-and-half']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F.', 'Combine the onions, flour, panko and salt in a large mixing bowl and toss to combine. Coat a sheet pan with nonstick cooking spray and evenly spread the onions on the pan. Place the pan on the middle rack of the oven and bake until golden brown, approximately 30 minutes. Toss the onions 2 to 3 times during cooking. Once done, remove from the oven and set aside until ready to use. Turn the oven down to 400 degrees F.', 'While the onions are cooking, prepare the beans. Bring a gallon of water and 2 tablespoons of salt to a boil in an 8-quart saucepan. Add the beans and blanch for 5 minutes. Drain in a colander and immediately plunge the beans into a large bowl of ice water to stop the cooking. Drain and set aside.', 'Melt the butter in a 12-inch cast iron skillet set over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms, 1 teaspoon salt and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms begin to give up some of their liquid, approximately 4 to 5 minutes. Add the garlic and nutmeg and continue to cook for another 1 to 2 minutes. Sprinkle the flour over the mixture and stir to combine. Cook for 1 minute. Add the broth and simmer for 1 minute. Decrease the heat to medium-low and add the half-and-half. Cook until the mixture thickens, stirring occasionally, approximately 6 to 8 minutes.', 'Remove from the heat and stir in 1/4 of the onions and all of the green beans. Top with the remaining onions. Place into the oven and bake until bubbly, approximately 15 minutes. Remove and serve immediately']

recipe_description: This is comfort food at its finest, with some added Fall flair! Salty bacon, crisp pears and melty cheese, doesn’t that sound delicious?!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 slices Sourdough bread', '2 slices Gouda cheese', '2 slices Havarti cheese', '3 slices bacon', '1 Bosc Pear, thinly sliced', '2 tablespoons butter']
recipe_instructions: ['Cook bacon until crispy and set aside, leaving drippings in pan. Add pear slices to warm pan and cook until just heated through. Remove from pan and set aside.', 'Heat griddle or panini press to medium. Spread butter on one side of one slice of bread and place butterside down on griddle; arrange cheese, pear slices, and bacon on bread. Butter second bread slice like first, and top sandwich, butterside up. Flip when golden on bottom; remove from pan when golden on both sides and cheese is melted.']

recipe_description: If you’re looking for a fun, versatile dinner, look no further than fondue. This classic Swiss dish is loaded with cheesy comfort; whether you’re hosting a small gathering of close friends or a big party for the whole family, fondue is a dish that can’t be beat! Also, check out our guide for throwing the ultimate fondue party – it’s as “gouda” as it gets!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 Garlic Clove', '1 lb. Gruyere Cheese, shredded', '1/2 lb. Emmentaler Cheese, shredded', '1 cup Milk', '1/2 cup Dry White Wine', '2 tbsp. Butter', '2 tbsp. Flour', 'Black Pepper & Nutmeg, to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['Rub bottom of a saucepan with garlic clove. On medium heat, melt butter in saucepan and add flour; whisk together flour and butter until flour is cooked.', 'Add white wine, whisk into roux until all lumps are gone. When alcohol has burned off, pull saucepan off heat and add milk.', 'Return to medium high heat, stirring constantly; when sauce just begins to simmer, lower heat to medium and add cheeses one handful at a time to prevent clumping. Finish with black pepper and nutmeg, then transfer to a fondue pot and serve.']

recipe_name: guide for throwing the ultimate fondue party
recipe_description: The fall season has finally started to settle in, and there’s nothing we crave more at this time of year than rich, warm comfort foods. When it comes to these sumptuous fall delights, nothing can compare to fondue! Cheese fondue was invented in 1930’s Switzerland as a way of making food last through winter – instead of throwing away old cheese and bread, why not heat it up? The heat made the cheese luscious and gooey, while also making the bread soft and supple, and voila, a classic was born!

This recipe for the Perfect Beef Pot Roast will fill your home with the flavors of Fall. The technique is simple – take a big hunk of meat and place it in a pot with a bunch of veggies, fill halfway with stock and cook it slowly until it is fall-apart tender and perfectly fragrant and perfectly Fall.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 teaspoon olive oil', '1 (3-pound) boneless chuck roast, trimmed', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '2 cups coarsely chopped onion', '1 cup dry red wine', '4 thyme sprigs', '3 garlic cloves, chopped', '1 (14-ounce) can fat-free, less-sodium beef broth', '1 bay leaf', '4 large carrots, peeled and cut diagonally into 1-inch pieces', '2 pounds Yukon gold potatoes, peeled & cut into 2-inch pieces', 'Fresh thyme leaves (optional)']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350F.', 'Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Sprinkle chuck roast with salt and pepper. Add roast to pan; cook 5 minutes, turning to brown on all sides. Remove roast from pan. Add onion to pan; saute 8 minutes or until tender.', 'Returned browned roast to pan. Add the red wine, thyme sprigs, chopped garlic, beef broth, and bay leaf to pan; bring to a simmer. Cover pan and bake at 350F for 1 1/2 hours or until the roast is almost tender.', 'Add carrots and potatoes to pan. Cover and bake an additional 1 hour or until vegetables are tender. Remove thyme sprigs and bay leaf from pan; discard. Shred meat with 2 forks. Serve roast with vegetable mixture and cooking liquid. Garnish with thyme leaves, if desired.']

recipe_name: Pork Chops with Tomato-Marsala Sauce and Polenta
recipe_description: Oliver’s is proud to announce a new partnership with Stone Valley Farms! These local piggies are all heritage breed and free-roaming, with no antibiotics or hormones. They’re raised at a fourth generation family farm on a completely vegetarian diet, and they’re finished on walnuts, imparting a creamy consistency to the fat. So, what does this mean for you? A delicious, versatile meat that’s completely guilt-free – pick some up today at your neighborhood Oliver’s Market and experience the difference!
recipe_overview: ['Serves: Makes 4 Servings', 'Prep Time: 20 minutes', 'Cook Time: 30 minutes']
recipe_ingredients: ['PORK CHOPS', '4 3/4 inch-thick Pork Chops (Boneless or Rib Chops)', '2 tbsp. Butter', '3 tbsp. Olive Oil', '2 Eggs, lightly beaten', '1 1/2 cups Fresh Bread Crumbs', '1/4 cup Minced Onion', '1/4 cup Chicken Stock', '1/4 cup Marsala Wine', '1 cup Canned San Marzano Tomatoes, well drained', '1-2 tbsp. Softened Butter, for finishing sauce', 'Salt & Pepper, to taste', 'POLENTA', '4 cups Chicken Stock', '1 cup Quick Cooking Polenta', '1/2 cup Medium White Cheddar, shredded', '1/2 cup Parmesan Cheese, shredded', 'Salt & Pepper, to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['PORK CHOPS: Using a mallet, pound chops to ½ inch thickness, then score each chop on one side to prevent curling. Season chops with salt and pepper. Dredge chops in egg, then coat in bread crumbs.', 'Heat two tablespoons of butter and two tablespoons of olive oil in large sauté pan. Brown chops until just heated through, approximately 2 minutes per side, then remove from pan and keep warm. Pour off fat, leaving behind any fond that may have formed.', 'Heat remaining tablespoon of olive oil and sauté onion. Season with salt and pepper. Add stock to pan and reduce to a glaze, then add marsala wine and reduce again. Stir in tomatoes (and any juices given off by pork) and heat through. Remove from heat and swirl in butter.', 'Serve chops atop soft polenta, spoon on sauce, and garnish with parmesan curls.', 'POLENTA: In a heavy-bottomed sauce, pour in chicken stock and bring to boil. Slowly add in polenta while whisking; cook polenta according to package directions, whisking constantly to prevent lumps.', 'When cooked through, add cheese handful at time. When cheese is completely incorporated, season with salt and pepper and stir to combine. Serve immediately.']

recipe_name: Game Day Good from our Butchers – Pan Seared Rib Eye Steak
recipe_description: Our Oliver’s Market Butchers are not only talented and passionate meat mongers, but they are foodies too! Check out their favorite game-day recipes that will make your party a touchdown.
recipe_ingredients: ['Prime Rib Eye Steak', '1 1/2 inches thick', 'Kosher salt', '2 tablespoons butter', 'Rosemary or Thyme sprigs']
recipe_instructions: ['Season the steak with salt. Let steak come to room temperature for an hour.', 'Pre-heat cast iron pan 10 minutes on high heat until it starts to smoke.', 'Cook steak for 5 minutes then flip. Add butter & rosemary or thyme to the pan and cook 5 to 7 minutes more, basting the steak with butter from the pan. Let steak rest for 10 minutes before enjoying.']

recipe_name: Game Day Good from our Butchers – Bacon Wrapped Pork Tenderloin
recipe_description: Our Oliver’s Market Butchers are not only talented and passionate meat mongers, but they are foodies too! Check out their favorite game-day recipes that will make your party a touchdown.
recipe_ingredients: ['Pork Tenderloin', "1 lb. Oliver's Own Bacon", '1/2 cup corn meal', '2 tablespoons maple syrup']
recipe_instructions: ["Delicately wrap the pork tenderloin in Oliver's Own Bacon and carefully roll in cornmeal. Deep fry to a caramel brown and lightly drizzle with maple syrup before serving."]

recipe_name: Game Day Good from our Butchers – Lemon Grilled Lamb Chops
recipe_description: Our Oliver’s Market Butchers are not only talented and passionate meat mongers, but they are foodies too! Check out their favorite game-day recipes that will make your party a touchdown.
recipe_ingredients: ['2 lbs. lamb shoulder chops or steaks', '1/2 cup lemon juice', '1/4 cup worchestire sauce', 'Zest of 2 lemons', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '2 tablespoons rosemary', '1/2 cup olive oil', 'Salt & pepper to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['Mix all ingredients together & pour over chops or steaks. Marinate for at least 4 hours (8-12 hours is best). Grill over medium heat until desired doneness is achieved. 6 to 8 minutes per side for medium rare to medium.']

recipe_name: Game Day Good from our Butchers – Steak Rub Hot Wings
recipe_description: Our Oliver’s Market Butchers are not only talented and passionate meat mongers, but they are foodies too! Check out their favorite game-day recipes that will make your party a touchdown.
recipe_ingredients: ['2 1/2 lbs. Rocky Chicken Wings', "1/2 cup H3 Ted & Braney's Steak Rub", '2 tablespoons cooking oil', "1/4 cup Oliver's Own Rub Potion #9"]
recipe_instructions: ["Rub wings in cooking oil and H3 Ted & Barney's Steak Rub. Bake wings at 375F for 25 minutes. Rub wings in Oliver's Own Rub Potion #9. Pan fry wings in oil for 5-10 minutes or until crispy. Devour."]

recipe_description: Spice up your traditional Fall flavors with this Pumpkin Hummus with a kick of Curry!
recipe_ingredients: ['1/2 to whole 15oz. can Pumpkin Puree', '1 13.5oz can Chickpeas, drained and rinsed', '3 tablespoons Tahini', '1 clove garlic', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '1-2 tablespoons curry powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 tabelspoons extra virgin olive oil']
recipe_instructions: ['In a food processor fitted with a blade, process pumpkin, chickpeas, tahini and garlic until fairly smooth. Scrape sides and process again.', "Add lemon juice, curry powder and salt. With the processor running, slowly pour in a thin stream of olive oil. Stop adding the olive oil once you've reached your desired consistency. It should process until smooth.", 'Add additional salt to taste. Serve with tortilla chips, crostini, or fresh veggie sticks.']

recipe_description: Oliver’s Market proudly presents Mycopia. Founded in Sebastopol, CA in 1977, Gourmet Mushrooms was the first to commercially grow Shiitake mushrooms in the U.S. Today, under the Mycopia Specialty Mushroom brand, they grow Alba Clamshell, Brown Clamshell, Trumpet Royale, Forest Nameko, Velvet Pioppini, Nebrodini Bianco and Maitake Fonderosa. Enjoy this delicious recipe featuring Mycopia Mushrooms!
recipe_ingredients: ['3 lb. Whole Chicken', '1/2 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil', 'Salt and pepper to taste', '8 oz. fresh mushrooms', '6 cloves garlic, sliced', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', '1 teaspoon fresh thyme leaves', '1/2 cup dry white wine']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Rub the chicken with extra virgin olive oil and season inside and out with salt and pepper.', 'Quarter the mushrooms. Mix the mushrooms with the garlic, parsley and thyme and pack the mixture tightly in the cavity of the chicken. Tuck the wingtips behind the chicken and tie the legs together to secure the stuffing. Place the chicken on a rack in a roasting pan and place in the oven. Roast for one hour and fifteen minutes.', 'Remove the chicken from the oven and transfer it to a cutting board. Pour out excess fat from the roasting pan and add the white wine. Scoop the mushroom mixture out of the chicken and add it to the pan. Place the pan on top of the stove and heat, scraping the bottom of the pan. Season the mixture to taste with salt and pepper.', 'Cut the chicken in pieces and arrange on a platter. Spoon the mushroom mixture around the chicken and serve.']

recipe_description: There’s nothing like cold bowl of ice cream on a hot day. Take your indulgence up a notch by adding sweet stewed raspberries and blueberries with a splash of Framboise for an extra zing.
recipe_ingredients: ['3 half-pints fresh raspberries', '2 half-pints fresh blueberries', '1 1/2 c. sugar', '3/4 c. water', '2 tbsp. Framboise (optional)', '2 pints vanilla ice cream']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine 2 half-pints raspberries with the blueberries, sugar, and 3/4 cup water in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil, and cook uncovered over medium to low heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar is a syrup and the berries have released their juices, 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in the remaining half-pint of raspberries and the Framboise, if using.', 'Place 3/4 cup stewed berries in a bowl. Add a large scoop of ice cream to each bowl, and serve immediately.']

recipe_description: Float away! This might be the best way to celebrate Hard Cider season! Cool off with this ice-cold hard cider ice cream float.
recipe_ingredients: ['1/4 cup prepared caramel sauce', '4 (1/2 cup) scoops vanilla ice cream', '2 cups hard apple cider']
recipe_instructions: ['Place two large glasses on a work surface. Drizzle about a tablespoon of caramel sauce into each glass. Place two scoops of ice cream into each glass. Pour 1 cup of hard apple cider into each glass, garnish with remaining caramel sauce and serve.']

recipe_description: Awesome Sauce! Take advantage of these delicious Gravs and make your own Gravenstein Apple Sauce.
recipe_ingredients: ['8 lbs. Gravenstein apples, cored and quartered', "2 cups Oliver's Own Apple Juice", '1/4 cup fresh lemon juice, strained']
recipe_instructions: ['In an 8-10-quart heavy kettle or pot combine apples, apple juice, and lemon juice, Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 25-30 minutes until apples are very tender, stirring often.', 'Press apples through a food mill or sieve, if desired, or you can roughly mash them with a potato masher. Return pulp to kettle. If necessary, add ½-1 c. water to reach desired consistency. Bring to boiling.', 'Serve warm, or cool in the refrigerator.']

recipe_description: Get the most out of heirloom tomato season with this deliciously fresh heirloom tomato bloody mary!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 large ripe heirloom tomatoes', '2 oz. vodka', '1 oz. lime juice', '1 teaspoon fresh grated horseradish', 'Tabasco, to taste', 'Sea salt & freshly ground black pepper', 'Cherry tomatoes, for garnish']
recipe_instructions: ['Push tomatoes through a potato ricer or a medium sieve into a small bowl; discard solids. Refrigerate juice until chilled.', 'Stir in vodka, lime juice, horseradish, and Tabasco. Season with salt and pepper. Fill a highball glass with ice and add the tomato juice mixture.', 'Garnish with a wooden skewer threaded with grape tomatoes.']

recipe_description: While we love a good BLT, we’ve decided to kick it up a notch and make a BLATCH. It’s your traditional BLT with avocado and Havarti cheese, created by one of Oliver’s Own Richard Williams. Bon appetit!
recipe_ingredients: ['Sourdough bread, sliced', '3-4 slices crispy bacon', 'Whole leaf butter lettuce', 'Marvel stripe tomato, 1-2 slices', '1/2 avocado, sliced', 'Havarti cheese, 1 slice', 'Salt & pepper, to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['Grill or toast bread slices and spread lightly with a thin layer of quality mayonnaise.', 'Top one slice of toasted bread with a slice of Havarti, then tomato slice(s), then a layer of bacon, lettuce, the avocado slices, salt & pepper to taste, and finally another slice of Havarti.', 'Top with the other slice of bread, push down gently to hold all together and slice diagonally.']

recipe_ingredients: ['3 Heirloom Tomatoes, on the larger side', '1lb. Fresh Mozzarella, sliced (1/4" thick)', '1 bunch basil', 'Estra Virgin Olive Oil', 'Balsamic Vinegar', 'Coarse Sea Salt', 'Fresh Ground Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Slice tomatoes about 1/4" thick. Slice mozzarella in same thickness as well.', 'Layer alternating slices of tomatoes and mozzarella, adding a basil leaf in between.', 'If desired, drizzle the salad with extra-virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar, to taste.', 'Sprinkle salt and pepper to desired taste.']

recipe_name: Ginger, Lemon and Garlic Swordfish Steaks
recipe_description: Bring the seaside dining experience to your family table with the freshest, most flavorful fish.
recipe_ingredients: ['1-inch section of ginger, peeled and finely chopped', '2 garlic cloves, crushed', 'Juice of one lemon', '2 green onions, chopped', '1 red chile, deseeded and finely chopped', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '4 swordfish steaks']
recipe_instructions: ['Place ginger and garlic in a small bowl and mix together to form a paste. Add the lemon juice, spring onions, chili and oil, then mix again.', 'Add swordfish steaks and coat well with the mixture. Leave to marinate for 15 minutes.', 'Preheat grill to high.', 'Remove fish from marinade and place on grill rack. Grill for 5-6 minutes, turning once.', 'Drizzle with remaining marinade and serve with new potatoes, lime wedges and mixed salad.']

recipe_ingredients: ['5 cm. piece turmeric, peeled', '5 cm. piece ginger, peeled', '1/2 lemon', '2 tsp., raw honey, to taste', 'Cayenne pepper, to sprinkle', 'Sparkling water, plain']
recipe_instructions: ['Juice the turmeric, ginger and lemon with peel (alternatively, peel the lemon and blend with turmeric and ginger, then strain). Stir through the honey.', 'Pour a couple of tablespoons into a glass, add ice cubes and top with sparkling water. If you can cope with more kick, sprinkle some cayenne on top!']

recipe_description: This recipe takes turmeric and plantains to a whole new level. A great way to incorporate turmeric into a delicious, healthy snack!
recipe_ingredients: ['½ pound peeled green plantains, about 2 plantains', '1 tablespoon melted sustainable red palm oil', '½ teaspoon ground turmeric', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon Himalayan rock salt or other sea salt']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350°F and set a baking sheet aside.', 'Peel plantains by cutting off the top and running a knife alongside. The peel is very thick and the plantains are very woody. This is normal. Once peeled, slice on a bit of an angle.', 'Place sliced plantains in a large bowl. Toss with melted palm oil until all slices are covered evenly.', 'In a separate bowl, combine spices. Then, pour over plantains and toss to coat.', 'Spread coated plantain slices onto the prepared baking sheet. Transfer to the oven and bake for 15 minutes before rotating to the other side and baking for another 10 minutes. At this point, some slices will be complete, others will not. Remove the crispy slices from the baking sheet, placing on a cooling rack. Return the sheet back to the oven and repeat, every 5 minutes. Total cooking time for some of the larger slices is 35–40 minutes when all said and done.', 'Allow to cool completely and dig in. Store in a plastic container on the counter for a couple of days, or the freezer for 1–2 months.']

recipe_description: A prosciutto melon salad can be best distinguished by its wonderful play on sweet and salty. If you choose your cantaloupe correctly, you’ll be rewarded with a sweet and juicy melon that pairs wonderfully with the delicate, savory prosciutto.
recipe_ingredients: ['4 large wedges of cantaloupe (rind removed)', '4 slices of prosciutto', '1 small bunch of basil leaves', '2 tbsp. basil oil or olive oil', '1 tbsp. balsamic vinegar', 'sea salt and freshly ground pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Wrap each cantaloupe wedge with a slice of prosciutto, then plate each cantaloupe.', 'Mix the oil with the balsamic, before drizzling a small bit over each cantaloupe.', 'Add a tiny pinch of sea salt and freshly ground pepper to each cantaloupe before garnishing them with some basil leaves.']

recipe_description: The Mexican street-cart staple of juicy fruit, lime, and chili powder is transformed into a refreshing cocktail (with just a hint of spice).
recipe_ingredients: ['1 c. London Dry Gin', '1 c. chopped, skinned, and seeded cantaloupe (about 1/2 melon)', '1 c. water', '1 c. sugar', '1/4 c. finely minced cilantro leaves and tender stems', '2 oz. Melon-Infused Gin', '3/4 oz. Cilantro Simple Syrup', '1/2 oz. freshly squeezed lime juice (1 lime)', '1/2 oz. white vermouth', 'Pinch of cayenne pepper, add more for garnish', 'Melon slice, for garnish']
recipe_instructions: ['For the Melon-Infused Gin: Combine gin and cantaloupe in an airtight container; cantaloupe should be completely covered with gin. Let stand at room temperature for 3 days. Strain into a clean bottle. Refrigerate up to 6 months.', 'For the Cilantro Simple Syrup: Combine water with sugar in a small saucepan and heat over medium heat, stirring constantly, until sugar is dissolved. Add cilantro and let stand for 1 hour. Strain out the cilantro. Cool before using. Simple syrup will keep in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.', 'For the Cocktail: Combine melon-infused gin, cilantro simple syrup, lime, vermouth, and pinch cayenne pepper in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds.', 'Strain into an ice-filled rocks glass. Garnish with a melon slice sprinkled with additional cayenne and serve immediately.']

recipe_description: For a little late night nosh that calms sweet tooth cravings (and maybe the Sunday Scaries), try Rosé-Soaked Gummy Bears!
recipe_ingredients: ['1/2 c. Gummy Bears', '3/4 c. Sparkling Brut Rosé']
recipe_instructions: ['Place gummy bears into a bowl. Pour the wine over the bears, enough to cover them well.', 'Leave out on the counter at room temperature to soak for at least 10 hours. (If you want them to soak for longer, place them in the fridge for another 10-20 hours).']

recipe_description: This Rosé sangria is the perfect drink to cool off when the temperatures start to soar. Not too sweet, and livened up with a little bit of bubble and white vermouth!
recipe_ingredients: ['4 Persian Cucumbers, divided', '2, 750ml. bottles of Rosé', '1/2 c. Alysian Bianco Vermouth', '1 bunch mixed herbs (think basil, mint, tarragon, and/or parsley- all divided)', '2, 12 oz. cans of citrus soda (such as San Pellegrino Limonata or Pompelmo)']
recipe_instructions: ['Cut 3 cucumbers into spears; set aside. Coarsely chop remaining cucumber, transfer to a large pitcher, then gently muddle to soften flesh and release juices. Add rosé and vermouth and stir to combine.', 'Set aside a few of the prettiest herb sprigs and chill in a zip-top bag until ready to serve. Smack remaining herbs against a cutting board to release aromas and lightly bruise leaves, then add to pitcher.', 'Cover and chill at least 3 hours and up to overnight for flavors to meld.', 'Divide sangria among ice-filled glasses. Top off with soda. Garnish with reserved herbs.']

recipe_description: No summer is complete without a watermelon cocktail! Spike things up this summer with this delicious watermelon mojito recipe.
recipe_ingredients: ['8, 1-inch watermelon chunks', '4 limes', '8 teaspoons sugar', '8 ounces silver rum', 'Mint', 'Ice', 'Ginger Ale']
recipe_instructions: ['Muddle 2 watermelon chunks, the juice of 1 lime and 2 teaspoons of sugar in each glass. Stir in a handful of mint leaves. Add 2 ounces of rum and ice. Top with ginger ale and garnish with mint.']

recipe_name: Watermelon Gazpacho with Feta, Mint & Basil
recipe_description: The delicate flavors of watermelon and cucumber go hand-in-hand to create this delicious summertime gazpacho.
recipe_ingredients: ['16 oz. cubed watermelon, plus extra for garnish', '2 tomatoes, hulled and quartered', '1 cucumber, seeded and chopped', '1/2 Serrano chili, seeded and chopped', '2 tbsp. diced shallots', '8 Basil leaves, roughly chopped', '2 tbsp. Champagne vinegar', '3 tbsp. extra virgin olive oil', 'Salt and Pepper', '6 oz. feta, crumbled', '4 tbsp. fresh mint, chopped']
recipe_instructions: ['Cube watermelon, saving 12-16 pieces for garnish. Hull and quarter tomatoes and add to a separate bowl, along with the cucumber, shallots, and Serrano chili. Pour vinegar over the vegetables and marinate 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.', 'Add the vegetables and basil to a food processor and pulse until well blended. Add watermelon, olive oil, salt and pepper and pulse again until blended. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate until chilled.', 'When ready to serve, divide the Gazpacho among the four bowls. Place 3-4 watermelon cubes in the center of each and place the feta on top of them. Sprinkle each with the freshly chopped mint and serve.']

recipe_description: As summer marches on, finding new ways to use watermelon can be a challenge. Try our grilled watermelon recipe to spice things up a bit!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 watermelon, cut into 1 inch wedges', '1/4 c. honey', '1/4 c. fresh lime juice', '2 tsp. Cayenne pepper', '1 tsp Chipotle chili powder', '1 tsp. salt', '1/2 c. fresh mint, chopped']
recipe_instructions: ['In a small bowl, whisk together all ingredients except watermelon and mint.', 'Heat your grill to high heat. Clean and oil the grill grate. Brush each side of the watermelon with the sauce. Grill watermelon slices for about 2 minutes per side.', 'Remove from grill, sprinkle with mint and serve.']

recipe_description: Bite into a slice of summer with this easy, no-carb dessert.
recipe_ingredients: ['1/2 c. ricotta', '1/4 c. softened cream cheese', '1 tbsp. honey', '1/2 tsp. vanilla', 'Watermelon slice, 1" thick', 'Fresh berries, for garnish', 'Fresh mint, for garnish', 'Toasted coconut, for garnish']
recipe_instructions: ['In a small bowl, mix ricotta, cream cheese, honey, and vanilla together until combined.', 'Spread mixture onto slice of watermelon and top with berries, mint, and toasted coconut. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: A little sweet, a bit bubbly and super fresh – this is the drink of summer!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 lb. stone fruit - white peaches, white nectarines and yellow plums', '3/4 cup light colored honey', '10 sprigs of fresh thyme', '3/4 cup apple cider vinegar', 'Crushed Ice for serving', 'San Pellegrino Sparkling Water']
recipe_instructions: ['Place fruit in a large mason jar or glass bowl. Add honey and thyme leaves, stir to combine and cover. Place in refrigerator for at least 24 hours until fruit is syrupy.', 'Using a fine mesh strainer, strain syrup from fruit, pressing firmly to collect remaining syrup.', 'Stir in vinegar and pour into a clean jar or bottle. Let sit in refrigerator for 24 hours before using, if desired. (Store any unused portion in the fridge)', 'To make drink, place ice in a glass, add a few spoonfuls of syrup and top with sparkling water. ( A good ratio is 1 park syrup to 3 parts sparkling water)']

recipe_description: You will love this fresh and easy dessert celebrating Stone Fruit season!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 3/4 lb. stone fruit - peaches, nectarines, plums and cherries', '1/4 cup raw sugar', '2 to 3 tablespoons balsamic vinegar', 'Vanilla ice cream']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350*F. Prepare the fruit: peel, pit and slice peaches/nectarines, pit and slice plums and pit and halve the cherries.', 'Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Toss the stone fruit with sugar and balsamic vinegar and spread into a single layer. Bake for about 30 minutes, tossing halfway.', 'Serve warm with ice cream. Optional: top with toasted almonds, pecans or some yummy granola!']

recipe_name: Grilled Peaches with Mascarpone and Honey
recipe_description: This is a simple but delicious dessert to make, especially when peaches are at their best in the heart of summer.
recipe_ingredients: ['6 large ripe peaches, halved and pitted', '6 tbsp. honey, plus more for serving (optional)', '8 oz. mascarpone cheese, at room temperature']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat a grill to medium-high.', 'Place the peaches, cut side down, on the grill and cook until lightly charred, 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer the peaches, cut side up, to a grill-proof baking dish or baking sheet, and drizzle them evenly with the honey. Place the dish on the grill and close the grill. Cook until the peaches are soft, about 5 minutes.', 'Remove the baking dish from the grill, and divide the peach halves among six dessert plates. Divide the mascarpone evenly among the plates, and drizzle with additional honey if desired. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: With a steak this good, you need to make sure you cook it right. Here are step-by-step instructions on how to get your Wagyu steak from the Oliver’s Meat Department to your dinner table and have it taste delicious! This is a fast and easy way to cook steaks 1.25″ or thinner.
recipe_ingredients: ['Wagyu steak, 1.25" or thinner', 'Vegetable Oil', 'Salt and Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['SEASON - Heat a heavy skillet (cast iron is ideal) over medium heat until hot. Add a light coat of vegetable oil to the skillet. Season top side of steaks with salt and pepper.', 'SEAR - Place steaks, seasoned side down, in skillet and sear 4 to 5 minutes until nicely browned. Season the top side of the steak with salt and pepper. If the steak sticks to the skillet, it’s not ready to turn. Wait until it releases on its own.', 'FLIP - Turn steaks over and allow to cook for an additional 3 to 5 minutes. After 2 to 3 minutes, use a thermometer to test the thickest part of the steak. When the temperature reaches the desired level, remove from the skillet. Remove steaks from a skillet and serve']

recipe_description: With a steak this good, you need to make sure you cook it right. Here are step-by-step instructions on how to get your Wagyu steak from the Oliver’s Meat Department to your dinner table and have it taste delicious! This is the classic way to prepare a steak. This method works best for steaks 1.5″ and thicker.
recipe_ingredients: ['Wagyu steak of choice, at least 1.5" thick', 'Vegetable Oil', 'Salt & Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['SEASON - Heat a heavy skillet over medium high heat until hot. Add a light coat of vegetable oil to the skillet. Season steaks with salt and pepper.', 'SEAR - Place steaks in hot skillet and sear for 4 minutes, turning once. If a steak sticks to the skillet, it’s not ready to turn. Wait until it releases on its own.', 'COOK - Place skillet in a 350 degree oven for 10 to 20 minutes depending on desired doneness. Turn once half way through the cooking time. Remove from oven when preferred internal temperature is reached. [Rare: 110*F, Medium Rare: 120*F, Medium: 130*F, Medium-Well: 140*F]', 'REST - Remove steaks from a skillet and cover loosely with aluminum foil. Let stand 5 to 10 minutes. The steaks will continue to cook and the temperature will rise about 5 degrees.']

recipe_description: Beef + teriyaki = something delicious. When the beef is Snake River Farms New York Strip Slices the Asian-inspired appetizer becomes something really special! (Recipe courtesy of Snake River Farms)
recipe_ingredients: ['2 lbs. Snake River Farms Black New York Strip', '1/3 cup soy sauce', '1/3 cup brown sugar', '1 tablespoons ginger, grated', '1 tablespoon garlic, minced', '1/4 cup green onion, chopped', '1/4 cup vegetable oil', '1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes', '1 teaspoon sesame seeds', '1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar', '1 teaspoon sesame oil', '1/4 cup water', 'Charcoal', 'Lighter Fluid', 'Matches', 'Grill Grate', 'Wood Skewers, soaked in water']
recipe_instructions: ['Light coals according to instructions on the bag and allow time for them to get white hot.', 'In a bowl, whisk all ingredients then add slices of New York Strip. Let beef sit in marinade for 30 minutes.', 'Skewer marinated beef on wooden skewers that have been soaked in water.', 'Place Grill Grate across the coals and, when hot, lay the skewered meat evenly across the grates.', 'Cook for 4 minutes per side. Remove from grill and serve.']

recipe_name: Grilled Wagyu Ribeye with Crispy Potato and Smoked Bacon Vinaigrette
recipe_description: Nothing is more simple, or satisfying, than meat and potatoes. And this recipe has you covered for both, with elegant takes on each staple. Enjoy a thyme seasoned steak with a bacon and onion infused potato side. (Recipe courtesy of Snake River Farms)
recipe_ingredients: ['For the Marinade', '1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil', '6-8 sprigs fresh thyme', '1/2 tablespoon freshly ground black pepper', 'For the Steak', '4 Wagyu Ribeye Filets', 'For the Potatoes', 'Potatoes', '2 oz. Red Wine Vinegar', '1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil', 'Kosher salt', 'Freshly ground black pepper', 'Smoked Bacon']
recipe_instructions: ['For the marinade: Combine marinade ingredients in a medium size mixing bowl. Dredge the steaks through marinade, coating well with the oil mixture; store chilled for a minimum of 4 hours, up to 24 hours.', 'For the steak: Prepare a medium hot wood fire, gas or charcoal grill. Brush grilling surface clean, make sure it is clean and then oil slightly to prevent sticking. Season steaks with salt. Place onto clean hot grill surface and cook for approx. 2.5 to 3 minutes then turn 90 degrees to create cross marks. After another minute, turn steak over and repeat process on second side.', 'Turn steak back onto first side for 2 more minutes, then turn over again and grill for final 2 minutes. Transfer cooked steak to plate, and allow to rest for 4 to 5 minutes before serving. Slice ribeye on the bias at a 45 degree angle, cutting into 4 to 5 slices. Plate and serve with Crispy Potatoes and Bacon Vinaigrette.', 'For the potatoes: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Line a baking pan with aluminum foil. Combine the potatoes, EVOO, Bacon, Shallots and seasoning, mix well and spread out onto baking pan.', 'Place into oven and roast for 15 to 18 minutes or until potatoes are cooked and crisp. Remove from oven. Transfer potatoes to mixing bowl and dress with Vinaigrette.']

recipe_description: Looking for a perfect steak recipe for Father’s Day? Look no further! It only takes a little whiskey to raise the steaks.
recipe_ingredients: ['3/4 c. concentrated orange juice', '1/2 c. whiskey', '1/3 c. apple cider vinegar', '2/3 c. Worcestershire sauce', '1/2 c. tomato paste', '1/3 c. balsamic vinegar', '2 tsp. honey', '2 tsp. soy sauce', '1/2 c. water', '2 tsp. whiskey pepper spice rub (see above)']
recipe_instructions: ['Mix all ingredients together.', 'Using in a glass or heavy plastic container, pour over meat, cover, and place in the refridgerator. Use about 1/4 c. of marinade per pound of meat. Typically it can take from two hours for chicken, and as long as eight hours for pork or beef. Discard the liquid after marinating.']

recipe_description: The perfect frozen treat on a hot day! Enjoy this 3-ingredient recipe all summer long!
recipe_ingredients: ['1/2 c. seedless watermelon', '1 c. Santa Cruz Lemonade', '1/3 c. sugar']
recipe_instructions: ['Cut 1/2 of a seedless watermelon into chunks.', 'Toss watermelon cubes, sugar and lemonade into a blender. Blend until pureed.', 'If necessary, divide the ingredients into 2 batches to blend it all.', 'Pour the frothy blend into a 9 x 13-inch pan, and set it in the freezer.', 'After 1 – 2 hours in the freezer, pull out the tray and use a spoon to start scraping at the partially frozen slush. Contents should be a fluffy, icy consistency. If the pan is not entirely frozen at this time, stick it back in the freezer and pull it out an hour later, and repeat the scraping with the newly frozen watermelon mixture.']

recipe_description: Cocktails have a lot going on for them: they are fun, allow you to get creative, can acquaint you with different spirits that you might not be familiar with, and you can make them Champagne/Sparkling wine based as well!
recipe_ingredients: ['6 mint leaves', '3 strawberries, hulled, plus more for garnish', '1/2 ounce Simple Syrup', '2 ounces Gin', '1 ounce Lillet Blanc', 'Crushed ice']
recipe_instructions: ['In a cocktail shaker, muddle the mint, strawberries and simple syrup.', 'Fill shaker with ice and add gin and Lillet; shake vigorously and strain into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice.', 'Garnish with strawberries.']

recipe_description: You can enjoy this salsa with your favorite chips OR use it to top some grilled meat. We love grilling marinated chicken and serving it with a huge topping of this salsa.
recipe_ingredients: ['2 mangos, peeled and diced', '2 avocados, pitted and diced', '1/2 c. red pepper, diced', '1 tbsp. jalapeno, finely diced', '1/3 c. red onion, diced', '1 tbsp. fresh-squeezed lime juice', '1/3 c. cilantro leaves, coarsely chopped', 'Optional: 1/2 tsp. ground cumin', 'Salt & Pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine the mango, avocado, red pepper, jalapeño, red onion, lime juice and cilantro leaves and mix well. Season with salt and pepper to taste (and cumin if desired).']

recipe_ingredients: ['3/4 c. fresh squeezed grapefruit juice', '1 tbsp. lemon juice', '4 oz. gin', '1 oz. sweet vermouth']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine grapefruit & lemon juices.', 'Fill a shaker with ice & pour juice, gin, & sweet vermouth. Shake. Pour up or over rocks.']

recipe_ingredients: ['2 oz. Hangar 1 Rosé Vodka', '4 oz. Club Soda', '1/4 oz. Simple Syrup (if desired)', 'Squeeze of lemon']
recipe_instructions: ['Place two thin lemon slices into a stemless wine glass.', 'Add ice and vodka and simple syrup (if using), and top with club soda.']

recipe_description: A healthy and delicious start to your day! Prep the night before for a quick and easy breakfast.
recipe_ingredients: ['One 17 oz. container plain Greek yogurt', '1/2 cup heavy cream', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1/2 cup brown sugar', 'Assorted berries or other fruits', '2 cups granola']
recipe_instructions: ['In a bowl, carefully whisk the yogurt, cream and vanilla together until combined.', 'Sprinkle the brown sugar evenly over the top of the yogurt mixture. Do not stir the mixture. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and tightly seal the edges. Refrigerate for at least 20 to 30 minutes.', 'When you are ready to serve, without stirring the mixture, spoon a large dollop of the yogurt into a wine or other tall glass and top with a large spoonful of granola. Add some berries over the granola. Repeat the layers once more, ending with the berries on top.']

recipe_description: Our Oliver’s Own Carne Asada makes these tacos the best tacos… ever! This recipe is complete with a Carne Asada marinade, Spicy Tomatillo Sauce and Grilled Pineapple to top your tacos. Yum!
recipe_ingredients: ["1 1/2 pounds Oliver's Own carne asada", '4 cloves garlic minced or grated', '1/2 cup fresh cilantro chopped', 'zest + juice of 1 lime', '1/4 cup olive oil', '1/3 cup fresh orange juice about 1 orange', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '1 teaspoon chipotle chili powder', '1/2 teaspoon salt', '(See instructions for Tomatillo salsa and Grilled Pineapple Ingredients)']
recipe_instructions: ['In a large gallon size zip-top bag, combine the ingredients for carne asada and toss to combine. Seal and chill at least 1 hour or up to 12 hours.', 'Meanwhile, prepare the spicy tomatillo sauce.', 'Ingredients:', '-6 tomatillos skins removed', '-4 jalapeños', '-6 cloves garlic skin on', '-3 tablespoons fish sauce (can sub soy sauce but fish sauce it best)', '-1 tablespoon honey', '-Juice + zest of 1 lime', 'Preheat the broiler to high. Line a baking sheet with parchment. Add the peeled tomatillos, jalapeños and garlic and place under the broiler for 3-5 minutes, turning once or twice or until the tomatillos and jalapeños are mostly charred all over. Remove from the oven and let cool slightly. Once cool enough to handle, remove the seeds from the jalapeños and discard. Remove the skins from the garlic and discard.', 'Add the tomatillos, jalapeños and garlic to a blender or food processor. To the blender, add the fish sauce, honey, lime zest and lime juice. Blend until mostly smooth. Pour into a glass jar or serving bowl. Cover and store in the fridge until ready to serve. The sauce can be stored for at least a week in the fridge.', 'When ready to cook the meat, heat a grill or grill pan over high heat.', 'Once hot, remove the steak from its marinade and sear the steak for 5-8 minutes, flip and sear another 5 minutes or until your desired doneness is reached. Remove the steak and allow to rest 5 minutes.', 'Toss the sliced pineapple with the olive oil and brown sugar.', 'Grilled Pineapple Ingredients:', '-1 small pineapple, cored and cut into sticks', '-1 tbsp. olive or coconut oil', '-2 tsp. brown sugar', 'Place on the grill and grill until golden and lightly charred.', 'To serve, slice steak thinly against the grain. Serve the steak in warm tortillas. Top with grilled pineapple and the spicy tomatillo sauce. Serve along side your desired toppings. EAT!']

recipe_description: This canned cocktail starts by draining a bit of your beer (into your mouth) to make room for a few ingredients. No shakers. No jiggers. No glasses to clean. When you finish it, you just spike it directly into the recycling bin.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 can Mexican beer (Modelo Especial)', 'Lime wedge', 'Tajin spice', '1-2 dashes Tabasco', '1-2 dashes Worchestershire']
recipe_instructions: ['Before opening the can, rub the rim of the beer can in lime juice and roll in Tajin spice.', 'Open the can and add a dash or two of Tabasco and Worcestershire, adding more as you drink, as desired.']

recipe_description: A spicy and tropical rendition of the classic margarita. The rim is coated with chilé powder, so this drink packs a punch!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 medium mangos, peeled, pitted and chopped into large chunks', '2 cups ice', '6 ounces tequila', '4 ounces orange liqueur', '3 ounces fresh lime juice', '1 teaspoon super fine sugar', '1 tablespoon chile powder', '1 tablespoon kosher salt', '1 lime for garnish']
recipe_instructions: ['In a blender, puree the mango then add the ice, tequila, orange liqueur, lime juice and super fine sugar and blend until smooth.', 'Mix the chile powder and kosher salt on a small plate. Moisten the rim of a glass with the lime wedge; dip the rim in the chile powder and twist to coat. Pour into the glass and serve with a wedge of lime.']

recipe_ingredients: ['1 pint fresh blueberries, approx. 2 c.', '1/4 c. granulated sugar, plus more for sprinkling', '1 1/2 tsp. fresh lemon juice', '1 tbsp. butter, cut into pieces', '2 tbsp. cornstarch', '1 egg', '1 tbsp. water', '1 pie crust (can be store-bought)']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 450*F.', 'Unroll pie crust and place on a baking sheet lined with a Silpat or parchment paper.', 'In a medium sized bowl, toss together the blueberries, cornstarch, sugar and lemon juice. Spoon mixture unto the middle of the crust leaving about 2” around the edge.', 'Fold the edges over, making sure the fruit in the middle shows. Cut the butter up into 6-8 chunks and place on top of the blueberries.', 'Whisk up the egg and water in a small bowl. Brush this onto the crust and sprinkle with sugar.', 'Bake 20-23 minutes until the crust is a nice golden brown.', 'Once cooled, you can move it onto a serving plate or be all fancy and serve straight from the baking sheet. Enjoy with a big scoop of vanilla ice cream!']

recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 c. flour', '3/4 c. white sugar', '1/2 tsp. salt', '2 tsp. baking powder', '1/3 c. vegetable oil', '1 egg', '1/3 c. milk', '1 c. fresh blueberries']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 400*F. Grease muffin cups or line with muffin liners.', 'Combine 1 1/2 cups flour, 3/4 cup sugar, salt and baking powder in a bowl. In a 1-cup measuring cup, place vegetable oil, the egg and enough milk to fill the cup. Mix this with the flour mixture. Fold this with the flour mixture. Fold in the blueberries, being careful to not over-mix. Fill muffin cups right to the top, and sprinkle with the crumb topping mixture.', 'To Make Crumb Topping: Mix together 1/2 cup sugar, 1/3 cup flour, 1/4 cup butter and 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon. Mix with a fork and sprinkle over the muffins before baking.', 'Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in a preheated oven, or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean.']

recipe_ingredients: ['1 large Brie round', '3-4 slices bacon', '2 tbsp. minced shallots', '1 c. blueberries', '3 tbsp. pure maple syrup', '1/4 tsp. cinnamon', 'Crackers, sliced baguette, apple slices, etc. for serving']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 350*F.', 'Place Brie round on a baking sheet. With a sharp knife, cut into the rind on the top of the Brie about a quarter inch from the edge. Do not remove the rind. Bake 15 minutes, or until cheese is soft and melted.', 'While Brie is baking, in a skillet, cook the bacon until crispy. Remove bacon from the pan and drain on paper towels. Leave about 1 tablespoon of the bacon grease in the pan.', 'Reduce heat to medium-low, add shallots and sauté for 1-2 minutes or until they become translucent.', 'Add the blueberries, balsamic vinegar, maple syrup and the cinnamon to the pan, stir and bring to a simmer.', 'Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 8-10 minutes until the liquid is reduced and the mixture is thickened. Remove from heat and stir in the bacon.', 'Move the hot Brie to a serving plate. Carefully remove the top rind using a sharp knife, to separate it, if needed. Top Brie with blueberry mixture and serve with crackers, baguette, apple, etc.']

recipe_description: Recipe courtesy of Niman Ranch.
recipe_ingredients: ['1/2 Niman Ranch Smoked Ham', '1/2 c. Pear nectar (Kerns Nectar)', '1/2 c. Orange juice', '1/2 c. Firmly packed brown sugar', '1/2 c. honey']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place ham, cut end down, in a large baking pan. Mix together pear nectar and orange juice in a bowl. Bake ham in a preheated oven for 15 minutes, basting twice with juice mixture.', 'Mix together brown sugar and honey in a small bowl. Brush mixture over ham and bake for 1 hour or until the internal temperature measures 140 degrees on an instant-read meat thermometer. Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: Now that Easter brunch & the big egg hunt is over… what to do with your carton of leftover hard-boiled eggs? Eat them, of course!
recipe_ingredients: ['8 hard-boiled eggs', '1/2 c. mayonnaise', '1 tsp. yellow or Dijon mustard', '1/4 c. chopped green onion', '1-2 ribs of finely chopped celery (optional)', '1/4 tsp. paprika', 'Salt & pepper, to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['Peel and chop the hardboiled eggs.', 'Please the chopped eggs in a bowl, and stir in the mayonnaise, mustard, green onion and celery. Season with salt, pepper, and paprika.', 'Stir and refridgerate, or serve immediately on your favorite bread or crackers!']

recipe_ingredients: ['4 Russet potatoes, sliced into ¼ slices', '1 onion, sliced into rings', '3 tbsp, flour', 'Salt and pepper, to taste', '3 tbsp. butter', '1/2 tsp. salt', '2 c. milk', '1 1/2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Butter a 1-quart casserole dish.', 'Layer 1/2 of the potatoes into bottom of the prepared casserole dish. Top with the onion slices, and add the remaining potatoes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.', 'In a medium-size saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.', 'Mix in the flour and salt, and stir constantly with a whisk for one minute.', 'Stir in milk.', 'Cook until mixture has thickened.', 'Stir in cheese all at once, and continue stirring until melted, about 30 to 60 seconds. Pour cheese over the potatoes, and cover the dish with aluminum foil.', 'Bake 1 1/2 hours in the preheated oven.', 'Enjoy that buttery-cheesy goodness!']

recipe_ingredients: ['4 boneless skinless Rocky chicken breasts, halved', 'Salt & Pepper', '1/2 c. Italian breadcrumbs', '1 egg, beaten', '4 tbsp. butter', "2 c. Amy's Organic Pasta Sauce", '4 slices mozzarella cheese', '1 tbsp. Parmesan cheese, grated']
recipe_instructions: ['Pound chicken to flatten. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.', 'Dip chicken in egg, then in breadcrumbs.', 'Fry in butter in hot skillet, turning and browning for 10 minutes or until chicken is done.', 'Remove chicken from skillet, set aside. Pour the pasta sauce into the skillet and heat thoroughly.', 'Add the chicken to the pasta sauce, and add slices of mozzarella on top of chicken. Add a sprinkle of Parmesan and cover until cheese is melted.', "Serve alongside your favorite Oliver's Own Pasta, and enjoy!"]

recipe_ingredients: ['1 bottle (12oz.) of Harp Lager', '1 bottle (12oz.) of Guinness']
recipe_instructions: ['Gently pour half the lager beer into a tall beer glass.', 'Place a large tablespoon, dome side up, an inch or so above the lager beer, with the tip of the spoon pointed slightly downhill.', 'Slowly pour half the stout beer over the tablespoon, so the stout gently pours down the side of the glass in a thick trickle. Allow to stand a few seconds so 2 distinct layers of beer form. (Like the photo above!)']

recipe_description: We know you want to keep your garden and yard free of pesky bugs that damage your beautiful plants. But, some of those pesticides make it very hard for the beloved honey bee. Before you break out that bottle of chemical-laden weed killer, try out this recipe for a bee friendly garden spray. Your plants will thank you, but so will our friend, the honey bee!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 gallon distilled white vinegar', '2 cups Epsom Salt', '1/4 cup original Dawn dishwashing detergent']
recipe_instructions: ['Mix all ingredients and spray on weeds early in the day for the best effect. Repeated applications may be necessary.']

recipe_description: We all know and love that sweet taste of honey. But did you know it has more usages than just a teaspoon in your tea? Check out these recipes we’ve gathered that pay homage to our favorite pantry staple – honey!
recipe_ingredients: ['1/4 cup honey', '1 tablespoon brandy', '1/4 cup coarsely chopped pecans', '1 8oz. wheel of Brie cheese (about 5-inch diameter)']
recipe_instructions: ['In a small bowl, combine honey, pecans and brandy.', 'Place cheese on a large ovenproof platter or 9-inch pie plate. Bake in preheated 500*F oven 4-5 minutes or until cheese softens.', 'Drizzle honey mixture over top of cheese. Bake 2-3 minutes longer or until topping is thoroughly heated. Do not melt cheese.']

recipe_description: We all know and love that sweet taste of honey. But did you know it has more usages than just a teaspoon in your tea? Check out these recipes we’ve gathered that pay homage to our favorite pantry staple – honey!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 tablespoon white wine vinegar', '1 1/2 tablespoon lime juice', '1 tablespoon cilantro, coarsely chopped', '1/2 tablespoon jalapeno pepper, coarsely chopped', '1 large clove garlic, quartered', '1/2 teaspoon salt', '1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '1/3 cup honey', '1/3 cup vegetable oil, such as canola']
recipe_instructions: ['In a blender, process vinegar, lime juice, cilantro, jalapeno, garlic, salt and pepper. With blender running, add honey, then oil.']

recipe_description: We all know and love that sweet taste of honey. But did you know it has more usages than just a teaspoon in your tea? Check out these recipes we’ve gathered that pay homage to our favorite pantry staple – honey!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter or margarine', '4 cups sliced carrots', '1/4 cup honey', '1/2 cup chicken broth', '1/2 cup fresh squeezed orange juice', '1/2 teaspoon minced orange zest', '1 teaspoon salt', '1/4 teaspoon pepper']
recipe_instructions: ['In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add carrots and sauté for several minutes. Add honey, broth, orange juice and orange zest. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until carrots are cooked and liquid is thick. Season with salt and pepper.']

recipe_description: We’ve found the perfect cheese to melt atop your favorite soup! We recommend melting the Red Witch Melting Cheese over the Bacon Gruyere with a few slices of La Brea French Baguette! This recipe is so simple and so easy to make on a chilly winter’s evening.
recipe_ingredients: ["1 pint Oliver's Own Bacon Gruyere Soup", '1-2 slices Red Witch Melting Swiss Cheese', '1-2 Slices La Brea Baguette']
recipe_instructions: ['Pour soup into an oven-safe bowl and heat up under the broiler for a few minutes to get soup warm.', 'Pull soup out, and put some bread slices on top.', 'Layer Red Witch cheese slices on top of bread and put back into the broiler.', 'Broil for a few minutes until cheese is bubbly and melted.']

recipe_description: Making cold brew coffee at home almost couldn’t be easier! All you need is coffee, water and time! We like using a French press because it has a filter built in, but you could also use a regular old coffee filter too.
recipe_ingredients: ['2/3 cup coarse-ground coffee beans', '3 cups room-temperature water']
recipe_instructions: ['Place ground coffee beans in a large (8-cup) French press.', 'Add 3 cups of room-temperature water.', 'Stir well to combine.', 'Place the French press plunger on top and store in the fridge for 12 hours.', 'Carefully press down the plunger to push all the grounds to the bottom.', 'Enjoy!']

recipe_description: Who needs a root beer float when you can have a COLD BREW FLOAT?! Ice cream, cold brew coffee and chocolate sauce come together in a creamy, caffeinated treat that will satisfy any time of day!
recipe_ingredients: ['Large scoop Vanilla Ice Cream', '1/3 cup chocolate sauce', '8oz. Cold Brew Coffee']
recipe_instructions: ['Pour 1/3 cup chocolate syrup in a tall glass. Top with one large scoop of vanilla ice cream. Slowly pour Cold Brew on top. Enjoy, preferably with a fun and funky straw!']

recipe_description: Chocolate-covered strawberries have become the go-to Valentine’s Day dessert– but they’re certainly not the only thing that tastes good with chocolate!
recipe_ingredients: ['12 marshmallows', '2 oz. semisweet chocolate', '3 tbsp. toppings (chopped nuts, sprinkles, coconut shreds, etc).']
recipe_instructions: ['Microwave chocolate in a large microwaveable bowl on high, stirring every 10-15 seconds, until smooth.', 'Dip half of each marshmallow into the melted chocolate, letting the excess drop off.', 'Sprinkle with desired toppings', 'Serve immediately or chill until firm, about 20 minutes']

recipe_description: Chocolate-covered strawberries have become the go-to Valentine’s Day dessert– but they’re certainly not the only thing that tastes good with chocolate!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 oz. dark chocolate, chopped', '1 tbsp. pistachios, finely chopped', 'Sea salt', '4 Clementines; peeled, pith removed, in segments']
recipe_instructions: ['Place chocolate in a small bowl set over a pan of simmering water. Cook, stirring occasionally until just melted (1-2 min.). Stir until smooth. In a separate bowl, combine pistachios and a generous pinch of salt.', 'Remove pan from heat but keep the bowl over hot water. Dip clementine slices halfway in the chocolate. Arrange on a serving plate and sprinkle pistachio mixture over the chocolate coated part.']

recipe_description: Chocolate-covered strawberries have become the go-to Valentine’s Day dessert– but they’re certainly not the only thing that tastes good with chocolate!
recipe_overview: ['Serves: 6 Pieces', 'Prep Time: 20', 'Cook Time: Freeze Time - 2 Hours']
recipe_ingredients: ['1/4 c. bittersweet chocolate chips', '1/4 tsp. olive oil', '1 banana, cut into 6 slices', '3/4 tsp. chopped almonds (toasted)']
recipe_instructions: ['Microwave chocolate and oil in a large microwaveable bowl on high, stirring every 10-15 seconds, until smooth.', 'Add the banana slices and roll until well coated. Transfer to wax paper on a plate and sprinkle almonds on top. Freeze until solid (about 2 hours)']

recipe_description: We can’t think of a more well-loved dip than guacamole!! We’ve simplified this recipe so you can spend less time cutting veggies and more time enjoying the party!
recipe_ingredients: ['8 ripe Hass avocados', "1 pint Oliver's Own Pico de Gallo", 'Juice of 1 lime', 'Kosher salt']
recipe_instructions: ['Roughly mash avocados in a medium-sized bowl. Gently stir in the pint of Oliver’s Own Pico de Gallo, lime juice, and salt. Taste and adjust seasoning.', 'Grab your favorite chips and dip away!!']

recipe_description: These canned cocktails start by draining a bit of your beer (into your mouth) to make room for a few ingredients. No shakers. No jiggers. No glasses to clean. When you finish it, you just spike it directly into the recycling bin.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 Modelo tall can', '1 lime wedge', 'Coarse salt', '1 oz. tequila']
recipe_instructions: ['Before opening the can, rub the rim of the beer can in lime juice and roll in salt.', 'Pop the can open and add more lime juice and 1 oz. tequila.', 'Enjoy! Warning: it may inspire dancing.']

recipe_description: These canned cocktails start by draining a bit of your beer (into your mouth) to make room for a few ingredients. No shakers. No jiggers. No glasses to clean. When you finish it, you just spike it directly into the recycling bin.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 Budweiser tall can', '1 oz. Amaro']
recipe_instructions: ['Crack open the Budweiser can, take a sip, then add 1 oz. Amaro. Enjoy!']

recipe_description: Is it just us, or is getting a child to eat a healthy, well-rounded meal seemingly impossible? How many times do we really want to pick broccoli or squash up off the floor after it was thrown from a plate with a grimace of disgust. Sure, a child’s tastes and preferences change throughout their life…shoot they seem to change every hour, but in the meantime we try, try and try again to get them to eat A vegetable, let alone a few. So here are some recipes with “hidden veggies”. These recipes are based off of meals most of us know and love, but we’ve sneaked in some vegetables so the kids are happy and we can rest a little easier knowing that they have some nutrition in their diet. Good luck!
recipe_ingredients: ['6 oz. olive oil', '3/4 cup diced red onion', '1/2 cup diced black olives', '1/2 cup diced red bell peppers', '1 tablespoon diced jalapeno', '1/4 cup diced garlic', '1/4 cup diced artichoke hearts', '1 15oz. can black beans, drained', '1 15oz. garbanzo beans, drained', '1 15oz. white beans, drained', '3 cups rolled oats', '2 teaspoons paprika', '2 teaspoons chili powder', '4 teaspoons dried oregano', '1/4 cup minced fresh parsley', '2 teaspoons red chili flakes', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '2 teaspoons celery salt', '1 teaspoon ground sage', '1/2 cup seasoned bread crumbs', '3-4 eggs']
recipe_instructions: ['In a medium sauté pan over medium heat, add 3-ounces olive oil and all raw vegetables except beans. Sauté until translucent. Remove and cool.', 'Place all beans in a large mixing bowl and mash slightly (mash the beans enough so about ½ of the beans are still whole). Add veggies to beans and mix thoroughly.', 'Combine all dry ingredients in a bowl, mix well.', 'Add dry ingredients along with the egg to the beans/veggie mix. Thoroughly mix all ingredients, adding more bread crumbs, oatmeal or eggs so it doesn’t crumble too much when formed into patties. Once mixed thoroughly, form into 12 patties, cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.', 'In sauté pan add 1-ounce olive oil, and cook patties 2 to 3 minutes per side.', 'NOTE: You can freeze the uncooked patties until you are ready to eat. Have a couple for dinner tonight, then freeze the rest for later!']

recipe_description: Is it just us, or is getting a child to eat a healthy, well-rounded meal seemingly impossible? How many times do we really want to pick broccoli or squash up off the floor after it was thrown from a plate with a grimace of disgust. Sure, a child’s tastes and preferences change throughout their life…shoot they seem to change every hour, but in the meantime we try, try and try again to get them to eat A vegetable, let alone a few. So here are some recipes with “hidden veggies”. These recipes are based off of meals most of us know and love, but we’ve sneaked in some vegetables so the kids are happy and we can rest a little easier knowing that they have some nutrition in their diet. Good luck!
