recipe_ingredients: ['1 lb. of your favorite pasta (gluten-free or regular)', '2 tablespoons butter or coconut oil', '1 small yellow squash, cut into small cubes', '1 small carrot, peeled and diced', '1/2 small sweet onion, diced', '1/2 teaspoon garlic powder', '3/4 teaspoon ground mustard', '1-2 tablespoons nutritional yeast (optional)', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 can coconut milk', '1 egg yolk', 'Pepper, to taste', '1 can tuna, drained (optional)']
recipe_instructions: ['Cook pasta, according to package.', 'Heat the 2 T. butter in a saucepan over medium/high heat. Add the squash, carrot, onion, garlic powder, mustard, nutritional yeast, and salt to the melted butter.', 'Sauté for 5 minutes, or until onion is translucent. Add the can of coconut milk to the saucepan and bring to a simmer. Allow to simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the coconut milk has reduced by 2/3 and is thick.', 'Pour the vegetables and coconut milk into a blender and puree until very, very smooth. Immediately add an egg yolk to the puree and blend well. The hot puree will cook the egg which will thicken the sauce and give it a rich texture.', 'Check seasonings and add more salt or pepper to taste.', 'Once the seasonings are where you want them, return the sauce to the pan and toss with the cooked pasta and tuna (if using). This is great served with chicken and broccoli!']

recipe_description: Is it just us, or is getting a child to eat a healthy, well-rounded meal seemingly impossible? How many times do we really want to pick broccoli or squash up off the floor after it was thrown from a plate with a grimace of disgust. Sure, a child’s tastes and preferences change throughout their life…shoot they seem to change every hour, but in the meantime we try, try and try again to get them to eat A vegetable, let alone a few. So here are some recipes with “hidden veggies”. These recipes are based off of meals most of us know and love, but we’ve sneaked in some vegetables so the kids are happy and we can rest a little easier knowing that they have some nutrition in their diet. Good luck!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 cups chicken broth', '1 cup long-grain white rice', '2 tablespoons butter', '2 medium zucchini, grated (about 2 cups)', '1 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese', 'Salt and pepper to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['In a medium saucepan, add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Stir in the rice, cover and reduce heat to low and cook for about 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed.', 'Remove from heat and add the butter, zucchini, and cheese. Stir and let stand for about 5 minutes. Salt and Pepper to taste.']

recipe_description: Is it just us, or is getting a child to eat a healthy, well-rounded meal seemingly impossible? How many times do we really want to pick broccoli or squash up off the floor after it was thrown from a plate with a grimace of disgust. Sure, a child’s tastes and preferences change throughout their life…shoot they seem to change every hour, but in the meantime we try, try and try again to get them to eat A vegetable, let alone a few. So here are some recipes with “hidden veggies”. These recipes are based off of meals most of us know and love, but we’ve sneaked in some vegetables so the kids are happy and we can rest a little easier knowing that they have some nutrition in their diet. Good luck!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 cups shredded chicken', '2 tablespoons oil', '1 small yellow onion, chopped', '1 zucchini, shredded', '1 (8oz) frozen spinach, thawed and squeeze dried', '1 cup frozen corn, thawed', '1 (4oz) can chopped green chilies', '1/2 teaspoon cumin', '1/2 teaspoon chili powder', '1/4 teaspoon garlic powder', 'Kosher salt', '3 (8oz) containers green enchilada sauce or salsa verde', '8 flour tortillas', '3 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese', 'Sour cream or plain Greek yogurt', '1 bunch green onions, chopped', 'Chopped cilantro, for garnish']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 375°F. Spray a 9×13 baking dish with nonstick cook spray and set aside.', 'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook onion and zucchini for 4-5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetable are softened. Stir in spinach, corn, green chilies, cumin, chili powder, and garlic powder. Season mixture generously with Kosher salt and cook for 2-3 minutes until flavors are combined. Remove from heat and stir in chicken and 1 1/2 cups of shredded cheese.', 'Divide mixture among the 8 tortillas and roll closed. Place tortillas seam side down in the prepared baking dish and pour enchilada sauce over the tortillas. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and cook for 25 to 30 minutes, until the cheese is bubbly and enchiladas are heated through.', 'Remove from oven and top enchiladas with sour cream or plain Greek yogurt, scallions, and cilantro. Devour. You can allow the enchiladas to cool completely and then freeze (without the toppings) for a future dinner. Reheat before serving.']

recipe_description: Bro, do you even meal prep? Sometimes, when the stars align and our kids don’t require 100% of our attention, we can make time for meal prepping. Seriously though, with a little bit of time set aside Sunday afternoon, you can have 5 healthy, substantial lunches ready to walk out the door with you on your way to work. Say “buh-bye” to those liquor store snacks, because you’ll be set up for the whole week! It’ll be worth your time, promise!!
recipe_ingredients: ['5 cups cooked chicken (diced, shredded or sliced) – Try using a Rocky Rotisserie Chicken from the Deli!', '2.5 cups frozen sweet corn, thawed', '1 cup salsa', '1 (14oz) can black beans (or other bean), drained', '1 (7oz) can diced green chilies', '1-2 heads romaine lettuce, shredded (or your favorite salad mix)', '1 bunch green onions, diced', '2.5 cups cooked white or brown rice', 'Salt and pepper to taste', 'Shredded cheese and sour cream (optional)']
recipe_instructions: ['Gather five meal prep containers and add ½ cup rice, 1 cup diced chicken, ½ cup sweet corn and 1/5 of the shredded lettuce.', 'Divide the can of beans evenly among all five containers.', 'Top with salsa, green onions, and cheese (if you choose to)', 'Store in the refrigerator until ready to eat.']

recipe_description: Bro, do you even meal prep? Sometimes, when the stars align and our kids don’t require 100% of our attention, we can make time for meal prepping. Seriously though, with a little bit of time set aside Sunday afternoon, you can have 5 healthy, substantial lunches ready to walk out the door with you on your way to work. Say “buh-bye” to those liquor store snacks, because you’ll be set up for the whole week! It’ll be worth your time, promise!!
recipe_overview: ['Serves: 5 Pre-Prepped Lunches', 'Prep Time: 10 minutes', 'Cook Time: 15 minutes']
recipe_ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '5 chicken thighs, boneless and skinless', 'Salt, to taste', 'Pepper, to taste', '1.5 pounds green beans', '2.5 cups cherry tomatoes, halved', '1/2 cup basil pesto, or to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['In a large pan, heat olive oil and add chicken thighs. Season with salt and pepper. When the chicken is completely cooked through, remove from pan, slice into strips, and set aside.', 'Add green beans and cook until crisp tender, make sure to not overcook. Return the chicken strips to the pan, then add tomatoes and pesto. Stir until fully incorporated.', 'Serve immediately or divide into 5 food storage containers and store in the refrigerator.', 'Enjoy throughout the week!']

recipe_description: Bro, do you even meal prep? Sometimes, when the stars align and our kids don’t require 100% of our attention, we can make time for meal prepping. Seriously though, with a little bit of time set aside Sunday afternoon, you can have 5 healthy, substantial lunches ready to walk out the door with you on your way to work. Say “buh-bye” to those liquor store snacks, because you’ll be set up for the whole week! It’ll be worth your time, promise!!
recipe_overview: ['Serves: 5 Pre-Prepped Lunches', 'Prep Time: 15 minutes', 'Cook Time: 15 minutes']
recipe_ingredients: ['2 1/2 cups cooked white or brown rice', '1/3 cup reduced sodium soy sauce', '2 tablespoons brown sugar, packed', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon freshly grated ginger', '1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar', '1 teaspoon sesame oil', '1 teaspoon Sriracha, optional', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 1/2 pound ground beef', '1 lb. broccoli florets, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', '1 bunch green onions, thinly sliced', '1 teaspoon sesame seeds']
recipe_instructions: ['In a large saucepan of 2 cups water, cook rice according to package instructions; set aside.', 'In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, ginger, vinegar, sesame oil and Sriracha, if using', 'Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add ground beef and cook until browned, about 3-5 minutes, making sure to crumble the beef as it cooks; drain excess fat.', 'Stir in broccoli, green onions, rice and soy sauce mixture until well combined, allowing to simmer until heated through and the broccoli is tender, about 3-4 minutes.', 'Place mixture into meal prep containers, garnished with sesame seeds, if desired.']

recipe_description: Bro, do you even meal prep? Sometimes, when the stars align and our kids don’t require 100% of our attention, we can make time for meal prepping. Seriously though, with a little bit of time set aside Sunday afternoon, you can have 5 healthy, substantial lunches ready to walk out the door with you on your way to work. Say “buh-bye” to those liquor store snacks, because you’ll be set up for the whole week! It’ll be worth your time, promise!!
recipe_overview: ['Serves: 5 Pre-Prepped Lunches', 'Prep Time: 15 minutes', 'Cook Time: 15 minutes']
recipe_ingredients: ['SAUCE', '1/3 cup low-sodium soy sauce', '1/4 cup water', '3 tablespoons rice wine vinegar', '3 tablespoons brown sugar', '3 tablespoons cornstarch or arrowroot powder', '1 tablespoon sesame oil', '2 tablespoons fresh grated ginger', '1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes, plus more to taste', 'STIR FRY', '1 1/4 pound fresh broccoli, cut into florets', '2 tablespoons oil', '1 large green bell pepper, cut into bite-sized pieces', '1 large red bell pepper, cut into bite-sized pieces', '1 large white onion, cut into bite-sized pieces', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '10 oz. crimini mushrooms, sliced', '1 (14oz.) can baby corn, drained and rinsed', '5 cups of cooked white rice, brown rice, quinoa, or stir fry noodles', 'Sliced green onions and sesame seeds, for topping']
recipe_instructions: ['In a small mixing bowl, whisk together all the sauce ingredients until well-mixed. Set aside.', 'Heat a wok or other large, deep skillet over high heat. Fill with 1/2 inch of water, and then add the broccoli. Steam the broccoli until just bright green and slightly tender, about 5 minutes. Remove broccoli with slotted spoon and set aside, drain remaining water, and wipe wok clean.', 'Return wok to high heat, and add in the oil. Add in the red and green bell pepper, and cook for 1 minute. Then add in the onion and garlic and cook for an additional minute – be careful to not let the garlic burn. Add in the mushrooms, and cook until the mushrooms begin to soften and darken, about 5 minutes. Then add in the baby corn and stir well.', 'Stir the sauce again, and then pour over the stir fry. Heat until just thickened, about 30 seconds, and then remove from heat.', 'Scoop 1 cup of rice, quinoa, or stir fry noodles into a food storage container. Then add in 1/5 of the stir fry mixture. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Place sliced green onions in a small, airtight container with the stir fry.', 'Let containers cool, with lids open, for about 15 minutes, then cover, and store in fridge for up to a week.', 'To reheat in microwave: remove lid and green onions, and microwave stir fry and rice at full power for 1-2 minutes, stopping and stirring halfway through. Once hot, sprinkle on sliced green onions and serve.']

recipe_name: Steak or Chicken Fajitas – Using Oliver’s Fresh Cut Fruits & Veggies
recipe_description: Everyone loves a fresh, warm fajita! We’ve cut the prep time down by incorporating Oliver’s Fresh-cut Fajita Mix. Grab a container in Produce Department. It will cut down on your prep time…leaving more time to hide bedroom while the kids run laps around the house.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 pound top sirloin steak OR 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut into 1/2-inch strips', '1 teaspoon chili powder', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '1/2 teaspoon cumin', '1/2 teaspoon onion powder', '1/2 teaspoon garlic powder', '1/4 cup water', '3 tablespoons olive oil', "1 container Oliver's Fresh-cut Fajita Mix", '2 tablespoons fresh lime juice', '8 tortillas, warmed in the oven or microwave', 'Toppings: Shredded lettuce, shredded cheese, salsa, sour cream, cilantro, avocado...']
recipe_instructions: ['In a resealable plastic bag, combine the chili powder with the salt, cumin, onion powder, garlic powder, cornstarch, water and 2 tablespoons of the oil. Place the chicken or steak in the bag with the fajita seasonings, seal and knead gently to coat. Refrigerate for 15 minutes.', 'Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil in a large nonstick skillet until shimmering. Empty the contents of the bag into the skillet and cook over high heat, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are crisp-tender and the chicken or steak is cooked through, about 6 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the lime juice.', 'Transfer the chicken or steak and vegetables to a large bowl and serve with the warmed tortillas, lettuce, cheese, salsa, sour cream and lime wedges.']

recipe_name: Shrimp Stir-Fry – Using Oliver’s Fresh Cut Fruits & Veggies
recipe_description: Grabbing an Oliver’s Fresh-Cut Stir Fry Mix from our Produce Department will cut down on your prep time for this delicious dinner…leaving more time to drink wine!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 cups cooked white or brown rice', '1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', '1/4 teaspoon ground ginger', '1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 garlic clove, minced', '1 tablespoon sesame seeds', '1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 tablespoons sesame oil', '3 tablespoons teriyaki sauce', '1/8 cup cornstarch', '3/4 cup chicken broth', '1/4 teaspoon salt', "1 container of Oliver's Fresh-Cut Stir-Fry Mix"]
recipe_instructions: ['Combine shrimp, ginger, cayenne pepper, garlic, sesame seeds and black pepper in a large plastic food storage bag. Allow to marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.', 'Heat sesame oil in a large wok or skillet. Add stir-fry mix; sauté 3 to 4 minutes to soften slightly. Add teriyaki sauce. Add shrimp with seasoning; sauté 4 minutes or until shrimp are opaque. Do not overcook shrimp!', 'Stir cornstarch into chicken broth and add to wok; cook, stirring until mixture boils. Sprinkle with salt. Spoon shrimp mixture over rice.']

recipe_name: Taste the Rainbow Fruit Salad – Using Oliver’s Fresh Cut Fruits & Veggies
recipe_description: This crazy easy fruit salad will brighten any cloudy day! Grab a few containers of Oliver’s Fresh-cut Fruits in the colors of the rainbow and you’ll have a delicious salad that didn’t take forever to prepare…so you have more time to avoid doing the dishes…
recipe_ingredients: ['1 container Oliver’s Fresh-Cut Kiwi & Strawberry Mix', '1 container Oliver’s Fresh-Cut Pineapple Chunks', '1 container Oliver’s Fresh-Cut Mixed Berry', '1 container Oliver’s Fresh-Cut Cantaloupe', '1 container Oliver’s Grapefruit & Orange Slices']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine all ingredients in a large salad bowl, or (if you’re OCD like me) arrange all ingredients, by color, on a serving platter. Need a reminder of the order of the colors? Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Purple.']

recipe_name: Simple Roasted Butternut Squash – Using Oliver’s Fresh Cut Fruits & Veggies
recipe_description: What could be easier than throwing fresh, pre-cut, butternut squash on a pan, tossing it in olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper and throwing it in the oven? We can’t think of much…maybe besides if someone spoon fed us…
recipe_ingredients: ["1 container Oliver's Fresh-cut Butternut Squash", '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 cloves garlic, minced', 'Salt & freshly ground black pepper, to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['Preheat oven to 400 degrees F', 'Toss butternut squash with olive oil and garlic in a large bowl. Season with salt and black pepper. Arrange the butternut squash on a baking sheet.', 'Roast in the preheated oven until squash is tender and lightly browned, 25-30 minutes.']

recipe_description: Looking for a refreshing pick-me-up cold-brew tea? Look no further! This Iced Green Tea is a great refresher to accompany your lunch and packed with antioxidants and nutrients.
recipe_ingredients: ['4 c. boiling water', '8 tea bags Traditional Medicinals Green Tea', '2 c. cold water', '1/3 c. honey', 'OPTIONAL: Add lemons or limes and mint for extra flavor.']
recipe_instructions: ['In a saucepan, pour boiling water over tea bags; cover and steep for about 1-3 minutes.', 'Remove tea bags from water, squeezing gently.', 'Stir in 2 cups cold water and honey, stirring until honey has dissolved.', 'Serve immediately over ice, or let tea come to room temperature and then serve over ice.']

recipe_name: Traditional Medicinals Stress Ease Hot Cocoa
recipe_description: A soothing cup of hot chocolate infused with stress-relieving skullcap.
recipe_ingredients: ['2 tbsp. Dutch-processed cocoa powder', '1-2 tbsp. honey', '1 bag of Traditional Medicinals Stress Ease Cinnamon Tea', 'Half and Half, or creamer of choice', 'OPTIONAL - Dried rose petals or cinnamon stick for garnish', 'OPTIONAL - Cinnamon or cayenne powder for garnish', 'Salt']
recipe_instructions: ['Boil water, place the tea bag in mug, and then fill the cup ¾ full with hot water.', 'Allow mixture to steep, covered for 5-8 minutes.', 'Then add the cocoa powder and mix.', 'Next, stir in the honey and a pinch of salt, and feel free to add more to taste.', 'Fill mug to the top with your creamer of choice. We recommend using a milk frother to make it extra foamy.', 'Sprinkle your cocoa with dash of cayenne for a kick, or with cinnamon powder for added spice. Garnish your cup with dried rose petals or a cinnamon stick for an extra touch of decadence.']

recipe_description: On a restrictive diet? Trying to make the switch to dairy-free? Try this take on the classic – your family will love the popcorn topping!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 bag Daiya Deliciously Dairy Free Cheddar Style Shreds', '8 oz. gluten-free pasta (or your favorite pasta)', '1/4 cup gluten-free all purpose flour (or regular all purpose flour)', '2 1/2 cups unsweetened dairy-free beverage of choice (like almond or rice milk)', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '2-3 tablespoons nutritional yeast', 'Salt and pepper to taste', '2 cups freshly popped popcorn']
recipe_instructions: ['Cook pasta according to package instructions, drain thoroughly when done.', 'Preheat oven to 350˚F. Prepare the cheese sauce while oven is warming.', 'In a small pot, combine olive oil and gluten-free flour and cook until fragrant.', 'Slowly add in unsweetened dairy-free beverage 1/2 cup at a time so that flour mixture is properly incorporated.', 'Add garlic powder, salt, pepper, nutritional yeast and cheddar shreds to the sauce. Cook until cheeze is melted.', 'Place macaroni and cheese sauce into an 8x8 casserole dish.', 'Top with crushed popcorn and bake for 20-25 mins. Remove from oven and enjoy!']

recipe_description: On a restrictive diet? Need a recipe for “meatless Monday”? You will love this meatless option for your next taco feast. Switch out pork chorizo for Beyond Beef Beefy Crumbles and no one will be the wiser!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 package of Beyond Beef Beefy Crumbles', '1 Potato, cubed', 'Corn Tortillas', '2 teaspoons cumin', '1 teaspoon coriander', '1/2 teaspoon cinnamon', '1/2 teaspoon Italian seasoning', '1 teaspoon black pepper', '2 teaspoons paprika', '4 teaspoons apple cider vinegar', '2 teaspoons oil', 'SALSA', '3 tomatillos (husked & rinsed)', '1 garlic clove', '1/2 jalapeno, stemmed', '1/2 lime (for juice)', '1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 avocado', 'Cilantro', 'Salt to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['Make a paste with the cumin, coriander, cinnamon, Italian seasoning, black pepper, paprika, vinegar, oil and 6 teaspoons of water.', 'Mix the paste with the Beyond Beef Beefy Crumbles.', 'Cook potato in a pan until fork tender and season with salt & pepper. Add Beyond Beef mixture and heat through.', 'Serve on tortillas with tomatillo salsa.', 'To make tomatillo salsa: Coarsely chop tomatillos and jalapeño and process in a blender or food processor with the rest of the ingredients until smooth.']

recipe_name: Field Roast Classic Meatloaf Sloppy Joes
recipe_description: On a restrictive diet? Need a recipe for “meatless Monday”? You will love this take on a classic family favorite. Switch out ground beef for a Field Roast Classic Meatloaf and no one will be the wiser!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 Field Roast Classic Meatloaf (broken into crumbles by hand)', '1 onion, diced', '2 cloves garlic, diced', '2-3 tablespoons olive oil', '1/4 cup canola oil', '1 large can tomato paste', '2 tablespoons vinegar', '1/4 cup molasses', '1/4 cup + 1 tbsp water', 'Salt to taste', '6 hamburger buns']
recipe_instructions: ['In a large pot on medium heat begin to saute onions in olive oil. Saute until translucent then add garlic. Add canola oil and when temperature has recovered in the pot add crumbled Field Roast meatloaf. Stir and and once meat has begun to brown a bit add tomato paste and water. Then add vinegar and molasses. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Serve on hamburger bun or slider buns.']

recipe_description: Switch out your cocktail with a botanical mocktail!
recipe_ingredients: ['Traditional Medicinals Turmeric with Meadowsweet and Ginger Tea, 4 bags', 'Limes and/or lime juice (enough for 1/2 c. of juice and garnish)', 'Sea Salt', 'Honey', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['Boil 4 cups water and brew four tea bags of turmeric tea in a mason jar, allowing it to steep covered for 10-15 minutes.', 'Stir tea into a bowl with lime juice, honey. Taste and add more if desired.', 'Circle the rim of your cup with a freshly cut lime wedge, then dip in a plate of salt to garnish the glass.', 'Once the mixture has cooled, pour it into your cocktail glasses over ice.', 'Add a slice of lime for an extra touch, and enjoy! And of course, you can always add a shot of tequila for the real thing. (Your secret’s safe with us!)']

recipe_description: Skip the eye-watering shots of apple cider vinegar and start the day with this flavorful and healing lemon, ginger & turmeric detox tea!
recipe_ingredients: ['6 c. water', '1 chunk fresh ginger (approx. 5-6" in length)', '3 cinnamon sticks', '1/2 tsp. cayenne pepper', '6 fresh lemons']
recipe_instructions: ['Peel the ginger and dice into thin slices.', 'In a large pot or saucepan over high heat, combine the peeled and sliced ginger and water. Bring to a boil. Turn to low heat and let simmer for approximately 10 minutes.', 'After 10 minutes, add the cinnamon sticks, turmeric, and cayenne pepper. Simmer on low for another 10 minutes; stirring occasionally.', 'Remove from heat; Let cool and then strain.']

recipe_description: This is a great winter salad that will leave you feeling satisfied and healthy. Serve with a Rosie Chicken Breast for the perfect light dinner.
recipe_overview: ['Serves: Four to Six Servings', 'Prep Time: 5 minutes']
recipe_ingredients: ['4 cups very finely chopped or slivered curly kale, stemmed and washed', '2 tablespoons coarsly chopped toasted almonds', '1 Fuji apple, cored and cut in 1/4-inch dice', '1 oz. sharp Cheddar cheese, cut in 1/4-inch dice', '2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', 'Salt to taste', '1 very small garlic clove, finely minced', '5 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil', '2 tablespoons fresh grated Parmesan']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine the kale, almonds, apple and Cheddar in a large bowl.', 'Whisk together the lemon juice, salt, garlic and olive oil. Add to the salad, and toss well, let sit for 15 minutes to allow the kale to soften. Sprinkle the Parmesan over the top, and serve.']

recipe_description: This is the perfect recipe for breakfast, lunch or dinner! Serve with a side salad for a delicious complete meal.
recipe_ingredients: ['4 teaspoons olive oil, divided', '1 cup thinly sliced onion', '4 cups trimmed and thinly sliced Swiss chard', '1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, divided', '1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', '4 tablespoons small fresh basil leaves, divided', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '4 large eggs, lightly beaten', '1.5 oz. Gruyére cheese, shredded and divided (about 1/3 cup)', '2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese']
recipe_instructions: ['Heat a 10-inch ovenproof nonstick skillet over medium-low heat. Add 2 teaspoons olive oil to pan; swirl to coat. Add thinly sliced onion; cook 12 minutes or until onion is tender, stirring occasionally. Add chard; cook 10 minutes or until chard is tender, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon salt and black pepper.', 'Combine parsley, 2 tablespoons basil, garlic, eggs, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt, stirring with a whisk. Add chard mixture to egg mixture. Stir in 1 ounce Gruyère cheese.', 'Preheat broiler to high.', 'Wipe pan clean with a paper towel. Return pan to medium-high heat. Add remaining 2 teaspoons oil to pan; swirl to coat. Add egg mixture to pan; cook 30 seconds. Reduce heat to low; cook, without stirring, for 4 minutes or until eggs are partially cooked. Sprinkle egg mixture with Parmesan cheese and remaining 5 ounce Gruyère cheese.', 'Place pan under broiler. Broil 1 minute or until eggs are thoroughly cooked and cheese is browned. Remove pan from oven. Run a silicone spatula around edge and under frittata to loosen from pan; slide frittata onto a plate or cutting board. Sprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons basil. Cut frittata into 4 wedges.']

recipe_description: Start your day off right! These smoothies are paired perfectly with some of our favorite protein powders. It’s good for your body, and your taste buds!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup water', '1 scoop vanilla whey protein powder', '3/4 cup Greek yogurt', '1 banana', '1 tsp flaxseed oil', '2 tsp honey', '1 tsp spirulina']
recipe_instructions: ['Place all ingredients into a high-powered blender. Blend until smooth.']

recipe_description: Start your day off right! These smoothies are paired perfectly with some of our favorite protein powders. It’s good for your body, and your taste buds!
recipe_ingredients: ['1-1/2 cups low-fat milk', '2 scoops vanilla protein powder', '1/2 cup low-fat coffee-flavored ice cream']
recipe_instructions: ['Place all ingredients into a high-powered blender. Blend on high until smooth.']

recipe_description: Start your day off right! These smoothies are paired perfectly with some of our favorite protein powders. It’s good for your body, and your taste buds!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup pineapple juice', '3 strawberries', '1 banana', '1 tsp Greek yogurt', '1 scoop vanilla protein powder']
recipe_instructions: ['Place all ingredients into a high-powered blender. Blend on high until smooth.']

recipe_name: Protein Pairings – Peanut Butter Chocolate Shake
recipe_description: Start your day off right! These smoothies are paired perfectly with some of our favorite protein powders. It’s good for your body, and your taste buds!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 scoops chocolate whey protein', '1 tsp creamy peanut butter', '2 cups nonfat milk', '1 handful ice']
recipe_instructions: ['Place all ingredients into a high-powered blender. Blend on high until smooth.']

recipe_description: Start your day off right! These smoothies are paired perfectly with some of our favorite protein powders. It’s good for your body, and your taste buds!
recipe_ingredients: ['2 scoops whey protein', '8 raspberries', '4 strawberries', '15 blueberries', '2 cups nonfat milk', '1 handful ice']
recipe_instructions: ['Place all ingredients in a high-powered blender, blend on high until smooth.']

recipe_description: Start your day off right! These smoothies are paired perfectly with some of our favorite protein powders. It’s good for your body, and your taste buds!
recipe_ingredients: ['1.5 cups water', '1 serving Alive! Liquid Multivitamin Citrus Flavor', '1 scoop of Dr. Axe Multi Collagen Powder', "1 tablespoon Barlean's Organic Lignan Flax Oil", '1 scoop of Garden of Life Raw Organic Fit Vanilla Powder']
recipe_instructions: ['Place all ingredients in a high-powdered blender and blend until smooth.']

recipe_name: Protein Pairings – Produce Powered Protein Smoothie
recipe_description: Start your day off right! These smoothies are paired perfectly with some of our favorite protein powders. It’s good for your body, and your taste buds!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup green tea, chilled', '1 cup loosely packed organic cilantro', '1 cup loosely packed organic baby kale (or another baby green)', '1 cup organic English cucumber', '1 cup organic pineapple', 'Juice of 1 orange', '1 tablespoon fresh organic ginger, grated', '1/2 avocado', '1 scoop Vega One Protein Powder Natural Flavor']
recipe_instructions: ['Put all ingredients in high-powered blender and blend until smooth.']

recipe_description: Hot Buttered Rum is a classic hot cocktail that will warm your soul during the cold winter months. It’s both sweet and warm, which is just the kind of comfort we want on the coldest days of the year.
recipe_ingredients: ['2c. water', '1/2 stick (1/4c.) unsalted butter', '1/4c. packed dark brown sugar', '1tsp. cinnamon', '1/2tsp. fresh grated nutmeg', '1/4tsp. ground cloves', '1/8tsp. salt', '2/3c. Pyrat Rum']
recipe_instructions: ['Bring water, butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and salt to a boil in a 1 1/2- to 2-quart saucepan over moderately high heat.', 'Reduce heat and simmer, whisking occasionally, 10 minutes.', 'Remove from heat and stir in rum. Serve hot.']

recipe_description: Winter is coming, which means it’s time to get your ‘nog on. This simple seasonal recipe will warm you right up, getting you in the holiday spirit.
recipe_ingredients: ['1qt. Clover Eggnog', "3/4 c. Christian Brother's Brandy", 'Ground Nutmeg', 'Cinnamon sticks']
recipe_instructions: ['In a heavy saucepan, combine eggnog and brandy.', 'Over low heat, stir to blend in flavors. Heat until liquid mixture is hot.', 'Serve in mugs with nutmeg and cinnamon sticks.']

recipe_description: The sophisticated – yet approachable – stylish – classy – delicious – yummy – unforgetable – coffee – rich – go to – martini.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 oz. Kahlua', '1 oz. Absolut Vodka', '1 oz. Freshly brewed espresso']
recipe_instructions: ['Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.', 'Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled Martini glass.', 'Sip and enjoy!']

recipe_description: This Bailey’s Hot Chocolate recipe is the perfect drink to warm you up this winter. Plus, Bailey’s Liqueur is on sale for the entire month of December!
recipe_ingredients: ['3/4 c. + 1tbsp. milk (divided)', '1 tsbp. corn starch', '2 tbsp. sugar', '2 1/2 tsbp. cocoa', '3 1/2 oz. dark chocoalte (chopped)', "1/4 c. Bailey's"]
recipe_instructions: ['In a small bowl whisk until smooth 1/4 cup milk and cornstarch.', 'In a small bowl whisk together sugar and cocoa.', 'In a small to medium pot heat 1/2 cup + 1 tablespoon milk until boiling, reduce heat to low, while whisking add milk mixture, then slowly add cocoa, whisking continually until smooth, add chopped chocolate and baileys. Continue to whisk with heat on low to low medium until thickened approximately three minutes. Pour into glasses and top with whipped cream and chocolate shavings if desired. Enjoy!']

recipe_description: Learn how to make a Hot Toddy with Bulleit Rye Whiskey, on sale all month long here at Oliver’s! Enjoy this quick & easy classic cocktail on a chilly winter evening.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/3 oz. Bulleit Rye', '4-5 Cloves', '1 Lemon Twist', '1/4 oz. lemon juice', '1 tsp. fine brown sugar', 'Hot Water']
recipe_instructions: ['To begin, fill up glass or mug with fresh boiling water and let stand.', 'While mug is warming up, cut a lemon twist and stud it with cloves.', 'Next, throw out the water in the mug and add fresh boiling water.', 'Add 1 bar spoon of demerara or fine brown sugar and stir to dissolve.', 'Add lemon and clove garnish, ¼ ounce lemon juice and stir.', 'Finally, add 1.3 ounces of Bulleit Rye or Bourbon and stir a final time.']

recipe_description: A delicious and refreshing Greyhound cocktail, using our new favorite Humboldt vodka! (On sale all month long!)
recipe_ingredients: ['Ice Cubes', '2 oz. Humboldt Vodka', '4 oz. freshly squeezed grapefruit juice (about 2 grapefruits)', '1 stp. simple syrup (optional)']
recipe_instructions: ['Fill a chilled Old Fashioned glass halfway with ice,', 'Add the vodka and grapefruit juice, stir.', 'Too tart? Add the simple syrup and stir.']

recipe_description: Sip the flavors of the season with this delicious and easy PAMA Pomegranate Martini.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 1/2 oz. PAMA Pomegranate Liqueur', '1 1/2 oz. Vodka', '1/4 oz. orange-flavored liqueur', 'Lemon zest, for garnish']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine all ingredients into a mixing glass.', 'Add ice and shake vigorously.', 'Strain into a chilled cocktail glass', 'Garnish with a lemon zest.']

recipe_description: Cocktails have a lot going on for them: they are fun, allow you to get creative, can acquaint you with different spirits that you might not be familiar with, and you can make them Champagne/Sparkling wine based as well!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 ounce Campari', "1/2 ounce Pimm's Cup No. 1", '3 ounces ginger beer']
recipe_instructions: ["Pour Campari and Pimm's into a shaker filled with ice and shake well; top with ginger beer.", 'Serve over ice in a rocks glass.']

recipe_description: I dip, you dip, we all dip! Try this delicious dip with your next hearty artichoke, and eat your heart out.
recipe_ingredients: ['1 cup mayonnaise', '1-2 tablespoons soy sauce', '1 teaspoon dried ginger (or two teaspoons minced fresh ginger)', '3 green onions, minced']
recipe_instructions: ['In a bowl, mix mayonnaise, soy sauce and dried ginger until well blended.', 'Taste and adjust seasonings in necessary.', 'Add minced green onions and stir well.', 'Serve immediately.']

recipe_description: “For us, Oliver’s is our most important account. Oliver’s customers really care about where and how things are made and where the ingredients come from. It’s a great fit with how we do business, so as customers learn our story, it resonates with them and they support our product. It’s a great partnership.” – Michael & Jenny Griffo, Griffo Distillery
recipe_ingredients: ['2 oz. Griffo Gin', '¾ oz. fresh Lemon juice', '¾ oz. fresh Lime juice', '1 oz. Simple Syrup', '1 oz. chilled Club Soda', '10 Mint leaves', '1 Mint sprig']
recipe_instructions: ['Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.', 'Lime juice, Lemon juice, simple syrup and Mint leaves.', 'Shake vigorously for about 10 seconds.', 'Strain into ice-filled serving glass, top with soda water.', 'Garnish with mint sprig and serve immediately.']

recipe_description: “We appreciate Oliver’s commitment to supporting local craft brands and embracing Sonoma County, which are the same values that we have. Our direct market is Sonoma County, and Oliver’s has been a major player in making our products available to consumers. The distillery is in Windsor, and the new Oliver’s location there has been a huge help to us. It’s the main place we refer customers from our distillery to purchase products.” – Chris and Brandon Matthies, Sonoma Brothers Distilling
recipe_ingredients: ['1.5-2 oz. Sonoma Brothers Distilling Vodka', "3-4 oz. Bloody Bob's Bloody Mary Mix", 'Lime or lemon wedge', '1 stalk celery', 'Pickled green beans, stuffed olives, or pickles (optional)']
recipe_instructions: ['In a shaker, combine Vodka and Bloody Mary mix, shake well.', 'Pour into a glass filled with ice.', 'Garnish with a stalk of Celery, Lemon wedge and pickles and olives stuck onto a toothpick.']

recipe_description: “It is wonderful to have a brand ambassador to the community that supports local brands over large national brands. The base of any company is the community that supports it. Oliver’s has rallied the community behind our small company, and for that we are grateful.” – Matt Weese, Lost Republic
recipe_ingredients: ['3 oz. Lost Republic Bourbon', 'Fever Tree Ginger Beer', 'Fresh lime juice, to taste', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine Bourbon, Ginger Beer and Lime juice.', 'Pour over ice in a copper mug and enjoy!']

recipe_description: Did you know that you can use Apple Cider Vinegar for a comparatively mellow, slightly sweet kick of acidity in glazes, slaws, dressings/marinades and sauces?
recipe_ingredients: ['1 garlic clove, minced', '1 tablespoon Dijon mustard', '¼ cup Apple Cider Vinegar', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 tablespoon honey', '1/3 cup Extra Virgin Olive Oil', 'Salt and pepper to taste']
recipe_instructions: ['Combine all ingredients in a glass Mason jar, seal the lid and shake until the honey dissolves and the ingredients are well combined. Adjust flavor to taste if necessary.', 'Leftover dressing can be stored in the refrigerator for up to one week.']

recipe_description: Seasonally themed cocktails are an excellent route to take, but you should be careful. A lot of them can be overly sweet and a little too boozy. The perfect answer to that is to make a Spritz instead. What makes the Spritz an excellent choice? Well, for starters they’re low in alcohol, extremely versatile and refreshing. Plus, we here at Oliver’s Market have a secret weapon for you to make your Spritz even more sophisticated — fruit drinks from Belvoir Fruit Farms!
recipe_ingredients: ['3 parts Prosecco', '2 parts Aperol', '1 part club soda', 'Orange slice (for garnish)', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['Fill a tumbler or large wine glass with ice. Pour in Prosecco, Aperol and club soda.', 'Garnish with orange slice.']

recipe_description: Seasonally themed cocktails are an excellent route to take, but you should be careful. A lot of them can be overly sweet and a little too boozy. The perfect answer to that is to make a Spritz instead. What makes the Spritz an excellent choice? Well, for starters they’re low in alcohol, extremely versatile and refreshing. Plus, we here at Oliver’s Market have a secret weapon for you to make your Spritz even more sophisticated — fruit drinks from Belvoir Fruit Farms!
recipe_ingredients: ['6 oz. Belvoir Ginger Beer', '2 oz. bourbon', '1 oz. club soda', '8 mint leaves', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['Muddle the ginger beer, bourbon, club soda and 3 mint leaves in a Collins glass.', 'Fill the glass with crushed ice, give it a quick stir and garnish with remaining mint leaves.']

recipe_description: Seasonally themed cocktails are an excellent route to take, but you should be careful. A lot of them can be overly sweet and a little too boozy. The perfect answer to that is to make a Spritz instead. What makes the Spritz an excellent choice? Well, for starters they’re low in alcohol, extremely versatile and refreshing. Plus, we here at Oliver’s Market have a secret weapon for you to make your Spritz even more sophisticated — fruit drinks from Belvoir Fruit Farms!
recipe_ingredients: ['1 part Gin', '2 parts Prosecco', '3 parts Belvoir Elderflower Rose Lemonade', 'Cucumber slice (for garnish)', 'Ice']
recipe_instructions: ['In a Collins glass filled with ice, pour in Gin, Elderflower Rose Lemonade and Prosecco. Garnish with a slice of cucumber.']
